loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en: Sylvia is married to a mason with whom she has 3 children. She uses her income to help her husband pay the household expenses as well as save for a rainy day. As a senior high school graduate Sylvia currently sells provisions, spices, vegetable and various food stuffs in her home at Ve GoloKwati (near Hohoe). With over 4 years of experience in this trade, Sylvia sees an opportunity to expand her enterprise further. Nevertheless, she does not have the working capital necessary to increase her quantity of stock. Thus her loan will be used to buy more gari, sugar, milo, fruit drinks, cooking oil, egg, beans, different kinds of tin fish and tin tomatoes and earthen ware bowl, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales. Sylvia wants to make her business self-sustainable as soon as possible. As a result, she plans to channel the new profits from her expanded business back into her provision business enterprise and also save some so she can acquire a stall oneday.

loans.use: her loan will be used to buy more gari, sugar, milo, fruit drinks, cooking oil, egg, beans, different kinds of tin fish and tin tomatoes and earthen ware bowl, indirectly helping her boost her overall sales

loans.name: Rayos De Luz Group

texts.en:
Totonicapán is a large indigenous town in the Western Highlands of Guatemala. It is a busy place and well-known for the fabrication of the traditional, woven wrap around skirts that the women wear called “cortes”.  These textiles are intricately woven in a “jaspe” or “ikat” pattern and are often quite colorful and detailed. Local women save their quetzales (the currency in Guatemala) for months or years so that they can buy one.

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank called “Rayos de Luz” or “Rays of Light” was organized by eight women who proudly wear the traditional colorful clothing of the area. One of the younger members of the group is 23 year old Berly, who is married and has two children who are 10 months and 2 years old respectively. Berly completed high school with a teaching certificate. She has a business selling shoes, perfumes and cosmetics sold by catalogue. She also has a small store where she displays and sells these items. Berly is requesting a loan to purchase a new inventory of shoes in a large variety of styles so that she can offer high-quality products to her customers. Berly is well on her way to leaving poverty behind and creating new opportunities for her young family. She feels very content and privileged to be able to have access to a loan with low interest. With her earnings, she is creating a more welcoming atmosphere to her store and has painted the walls. 

The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and educational trainings is of great use to Berly and the ladies in the Trust Bank. A Facilitator from Friendship Bridge, using games, role playing, diagrams and pictures, shares lots of knowledge with the women on a variety of subjects. 

KIVA investors, partnering with Friendship Bridge, are of great value to Berly and her friends in the “Rayos de Luz” Trust Bank. They are well on the path to a more empowered and brighter future, that will not only help themselves but also their families and their community in Totonicapan, Guatemala. Thank you, KIVA investors!

loans.use: To purchase a new inventory of shoes in a large variety of styles so that she can offer high-quality products

loans.name: Maryam Parveen

texts.en:
Maryam is the age of 38 and a mother of seven children living with her spouse and children in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her husband is a responsible to fulfil the needs of the entire family. Her husband owns a welding shop. He has been running welding shop 10 years ago to meet the family’s expenses.
Now a day Maryam’s husband wants to buy welding raw material; for example iron and rod and welding machine for proper income but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase welding raw material to earn an income. Therefore Maryam has applied for a KIVA loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan Maryam’s husband can purchase welding raw material to earn an income.
Maryam and her family will be thankful to the KIVA, lender s and field partner BRAC Pakistan for helping them by funding this loan to improve their living standard.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's welding shop

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
"This business is a member of the Future Fruits group. Group lending, also known as solidarity lending, is a mechanism that allows a number of individuals to provide collateral or guarantee a loan through a group repayment pledge. The incentive to repay is based on peer pressure; if one person in the group defaults, the other group members make up the payment amount. - Kiva Staff"

Beatrice is 42 years old. She is single, has 6 dependants and lives in Matasia.

Beatrice sells maize and beans. She also has a dairy cow and sells milk. Due to the prolonged drought that has hit the country; she plans to concentrate on Zero grazing of Dairy cows because she is assured of income daily.

loans.use: Sale of Produce and Milk

loans.name: Akou Augustine

texts.en:
Born in Tsévié village of Zio Prefecture in 1965, Mrs. Akou Agustine K. grew up in Kloto Prececture. A courageous and diligent retailer of shoes and purses, she knew how to take on the competition to make a name for herself. A mother of five children, she is currently the head of her household because her husband has been unemployed for five years. Mrs. K. would like to renew her merchandise with the latest items. She is seeking a $750 loan to stock shoes and purses to meet market demand. This loan will help continue her children’s education and generally improve the family’s standard of living.

Translated from French by Liana Bianchi, Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1965 à Tsévié (Préfecture du Zio), Madame K. Akou Augustine est originaire de la préfecture de Kloto. Très courageuse et assidue dans son commerce de chaussures et sacs, elle a su braver la concurrence autour d’elle pour se faire une place au soleil. Mère de cinq (05) enfants, elle est actuellement la responsable de son foyer car son mari est sans emploi depuis cinq (05) ans. Madame K. veut renouveler sa marchandise en nouvel arrivage. Elle sollicite un crédit de $750 pour s’approvisionner en chaussures et sacs afin de satisfaire la demande du marché. Ce crédit permettra une évolution normale dans l’éducation des enfants et l’amélioration générale de leur condition d’existence.

loans.use: stocking shoes and purses to meet customer demand

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo es un hombre emprendedor y muy responsable, el tiene 36 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos de 11 y 6 años. Él empezó con su negocio de venta de calzado hace cinco años, era una época muy difícil porque no tenía trabajo y aunque su esposa estaba empleada, con su salario no podía solventar todos los gastos del hogar, así fue como se inició en el negocio con una inversión muy pequeña y poco a poco sus ventas se han incrementado al igual que su negocio.

Ahora Gerardo necesita de un préstamo por la cantidad de $ 650 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad y permanecer en su preferencia, él ofrece regresar esta cantidad en un lapso de 5 a 10 meses. En tus manos está el bienestar de esta familia, decídete a apoyarlos, ellos agradecen sinceramente tu ayuda.

Translated to English by Nuria Ruiz

Gerardo is a responsible entrepreneur, he is 36 years old, married and has two kids of 11 and 6. He started his shoe selling business 5 years ago. It was a hard time for him cause he was unemployed and although his wife was working at the time, her salary was not enough to provide for the family. He started with a very small investment but little by little his business has grown.

Gerardo is asking for a $650 loan. He is planning to use the money to buy more goods for his business so he can better serve his clients. He'll repay the loan in a 5 to 10 month interval. Gerardo and his family really appreciate your help.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona is 77 years old and she is married with 9 children, all of whom have left home. Her husband is a horticulturist and she helps to maintain their home by making napkins, tablecloths and shawls with rustic designs on them which she creates and sews herself. She belongs to the group ‘Montaña 4’ and the other members are: Maria de los Angles Hernandez (artisan) and Maria Hernandez Lopez (artisan). With the loan they hope to buy more material and wood and therefore increase the quantity of their products.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Volunteer Translator

PETRONA TIENE 77 AÑOS , CASADA Y SUS 9 HIJOS YA ESTAN SEPARADOS DE SU CASA . SU ESPOSO SE DEDICA A LA FLORICULTURA Y ELLA LO AYUDA EN LA MANTENCION DE SU HOGAR HACIENDO SERVILLETAS MANTELES Y CHALES ARTESANALES EN TELARES RUSTICOS CREADOS POR ELLA MISMA EN DONDE TEJE Y BORDA SUS PRODUCTOS. PERTENECE AL GRUPO MONTAÑA 4 Y SUS OTRAS INTEGRANTES SON : MARIA DE LOS ANGELES HERNANDEZ ( ARTESANA ) Y MARIA HERNANDEZ LOPEZ ( ARTESANA ) . CON EL PRESTAMO ELLAS QUIEREN INVERTIR EN COMPRAR MAS MATERIAL PARA CONFECCIONAR SUS PRODUCTOS Y MADERA PARA HACER MAS TELARES Y ASI AUMENTAR LA CANTIDAD DE ARTESANIAS.

loans.use: To sell crafts/VENTA DE ARTESANIAS

loans.name: Magda Delia

texts.es:
Magda is a very hardworking woman. She is single and has three children; the older two are 6 and 12 years old, and the youngest is only 8 months old. She has had to raise her family by herself and in order to cover their basic needs and give them the time they need, she began her own business one year ago. She started by selling candies and then incorporated other grocery products. She now has a well-stocked store. She would like to be able to meet all the needs of her customers, so that she can offer good service and make sure her business remains their preferred grocery.

In order to continue growing, Magda is requesting a loan of $325.00, which she will use to buy merchandise. She is prepared to return the loan in 3 months. Be an important part of the development of this business and help improve this family’s quality of life. They will be sincerely thankful.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

Magda es una mujer muy trabajadora, ella es soltera y tiene tres hijos, de 6 y 12 años de edad y el más pequeño de solo 8 meses de nacido. Ella sola ha tenido que sacar adelante a su familia y para poder cubrir sus necesidades básicas y darles el tiempo que necesitan desde hace un año inició su propio negocio con la venta de dulces y poco después incorporó otros productos de abarrotes, ahora tiene una tienda bien surtida, ella desea cubrir todas las necesidades de sus clientes para ofrecer un buen servicio y continuar con su preferencia .

Para poder continuar creciendo ahora Magda está solicitando un préstamo de $ 325 dólares que destinará a la compra de mercancía, ella esta dispuesta a regresar esta cantidad en 3 meses. Se parte importante en el desarrollo de este negocio y ayuda a mejorar la calidad de vida de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecen sinceramente.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Neba Eunice

texts.en:
The death of Eunice’s father left her with the responsibility of taking care of her siblings since her mother is unemployed.  In her search for a job she was recruited as a house maid where she earned money to open a hair dressing salon.  This hair dressing salon, athough situated along a very busy street, could not yield the expected profit because of a lack of investment capital.

With a loan of $100, she plans to buy hair products and other cosmetics as well as pay rent.  The profit will be used to pay apprentice fees for her junior sisters.  She plans to repay the loan in 15 months with the first installment on the day the loan is disbursed.

loans.use: Purchase of hair products for her salon and rent

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a hair dryer and a blow dryer

loans.name: Adela

texts.es:
Adela belongs to Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, she has a store which she runs from her home. This store is located in the Huaraz province, Ancash province.

WIth this loan, which will be cancelled in 6 months, she will buy items to buy her own supplies. Some of the supplies are: 2 boxes of breads, 2 boxes of milk, 10 boxes of soda, 1 bag of sugar, 1 bag of rice, 1 jug of oil, 3 boxes of oil, 1 box of tuna, 4 big bags of detergent with 60 units per box.

Adela is 40 years old, she has 2 kids who are 18 and 23 years old. She got her business started some 23 years ago and with her hard work has been able to make this a very successful store. Her husband is an electrician, they have both worked hard to give their children a good education. The oldest one just completed high school and their youngest attends college at Universidad Nacional Antunes de Mayolo.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La Señora Adela pertenece al Banco Comunal Juan Pablo II, ella cuenta con una bodega que funciona en su propia casa, ubicada en la provincia de Huaraz, departamento de Ancash. Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000 soles, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará mercadería para surtir su negocio: 2 cajas de panetones, 2 cajas de leche,10 cajas de gaseosas, 1 saco de azúcar, 1 saco de arroz, 1 lata de aceite, 3 cajas de aceite por litro, 1 caja de atún filete, 4 bolsas grandes de detergente de 60 unidades cada una. La Señora Adela tiene 40 años, es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 23 años. Ella empezó hace 23 años en su negocio y su empeño y esfuerzo han hecho que su negocio hoy en día sea prospero. Su esposo es electricista, ambos han trabajado bastante para darles una buena educación a sus hijos, el mayor de ellos ya terminó sus estudios superiores y la menor cursa estudios en la Universidad Nacional Antunes de Mayolo (UNASAM).

loans.use: Purchase of products for her mimi-mart store

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr Antonio M. lives with his wife and his two children at his own house in the German Busch area of the City of El Alto . Mr Antonio works as doorman of a private building in the city of La Paz. His wife sells cosmetic products in a stand at the Ceja area in the city of El Alto. The requested loan will be use to used to build the framing for four rooms in two floors in the field of his property. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and the socioeconomic analysis made, qualifies him favorably and he can gain access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Antonio M. vive en casa propia en la zona German Busch de la Ciudad de EL Alto con su esposa y sus dos hijos. El señor Antonio trabaja como portero de un edificio particular de la ciudad de La Paz y su esposa vende productos cosméticos en un puesto en vía pública del sector de la ceja en la ciudad de El Alto. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción de cuatro habitaciones en obra gruesa y en dos plantas en el terreno de su propiedad. Esta es la primera ocasión que solicita un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder a un crédito.

loans.use: Build framing for four bedrooms.

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo Q. is characterized as a very hard-working person with the desire to improve his ice cream selling business in the municipality of El Sauce in León. He's in this business because he feels it's his duty to improve the financial situation at home and meet the needs of his wife and children.

It's important to point out that this job requires much effort because bicycling around all day exposes one to sunlight and causes physical exhaustion. Despite this, Bernardo works without any difficulties knowing that this, his only source of income, is the only means he has to support his family.

Today, he turns to CEPRODEL in the hopes of receiving loanss that will allow him to buy the ingredients he needs to make sherbet and sell it in the municipality of El Sauce.

Translated by Beatriz Yuste, Kiva Volunteer.

El caballero Bernardo Q. se caracteriza por ser una persona muy esforzada y con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio de venta de sorbetes ambulante en el municipio de El Sauce en León. Se dedica a este negocio por el hecho de que tiene el deber de mejorar la condición económica de su hogar y suplir las necesidades de su esposa e hijos.

Es necesario destacar que este trabajo requiere de mucho esfuerzo por el hecho de que el trabajo ambulante provoca mucha exposición al sol y desgaste físico por movilizarse en la bicicleta todo el día. A pesar de esto, el señor Bernardo realiza su labor sin ninguna dificultad por estar consiente de que este es su único ingreso con el cual puede mantener a su familia.

Hoy en día acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con créditos que le permitan la compra de sus productos para elaborar los sorbetes y comercializarlos en todo el municipio de El Sauce.

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
The family of Mrs. Nguyễn Thị Hương, 50 years old, had the hardest of time when it was almost impossible for them to find a group with the TYM Fund. When joined, she was allowed a loan of lowest limit amount. She invests the funds from those small loans wisely in livestock. Her husband and her children chip in from their wages. The family’s economy improves. She is in the process of building their new house. With it they won’t be worry much when weather turns bad. She is grateful for the goodness of the Fund. Next round she is applying for a loan of 575USD to buy more piglets. She also would buy bamboo to weave baskets to sell. The profit from selling baskets is used to make weekly payments. The family’s monthly income now is 200USD.

Translated from Vietnamese by ngungo, Kiva volunteer.


Gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Hương, 50 tuổi, trước đây gặp rất nhiều khó khăn. Rất vất vả trong việc tìm nhóm cụm, khi tham gia chị Hương chỉ dám vay mức vốn tối thiểu. Các vòng vốn đầu tư chăn nuôi mang lại hiệu quả, cộng thêm sự hỗ trợ của chồng và con đi làm cửa vạn, chị mạnh dạn vay các mức vốn cao. Do sử dụng vốn đúng mục đích nên đời sống gia đình chị đã được cải thiện. Chị Hương đang tiến hành làm một căn nhà mới khang trang. Với căn nhà này chị không còn phải lo lắng mỗi khi có mưa bão. Chị rất vui mừng vì nhờ tham gia Quỹ đời sống gia đình chị đã thoát khỏi cảnh túng thiếu. Vòng vốn tới chị Hương xin vay 575USD mua lợn chăn nuôi. Bên cạnh đó chị cũng dành ra một phần tiền mua tre đan thúng. Đây cũng là một nguồn thu cho việc trả tiền tuần. Thu nhập hàng tháng của cả gia đình hiện nay là 200USD.

loans.use: Buy piglets and bamboo

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo (Hello!) from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 29-year-old Joyce M.. She is married and has four children between the ages of 1 and 10. She also has two dependents, her sister's children, who live with her.

In 1999, Joyce established her cocoa business. Joyce has already received and successfully repaid one loan from SELFINA, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase additional stocks of cocoa in bulk for resale. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a leading role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania through micro-leasing. Because customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, the women lack tangible collateral assets, and financial institutions do not consider them to be credit-worthy. This leads to poor financial support and, as a result, limited access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. When a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys the equipment from the client, extends a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback" arrangement.

loans.use: To purchase additional stocks of cocoa in bulk.

loans.name: Thi Thuy Ha

texts.vi:
N. thi Thuy Ha (MS: 070030) is twenty six year old. She requests a loan of $VN 2.478.000 to start a poultry business. She is an elementary school teacher, her husband works for the local government but he also helps her in the farm. They have a small child. She likes to participate in the loan program since she can repay slowly and the paper work is fast and simple. She already participated once and repaid her loan completely. Her family income is about $VN 150.000/day.

Translated from Vietnamese by a Kiva volunteer

Chị Nguyễn Thị Thuý Hà (MS:070030), năm nay 26 tuổi. Chị vay 2.478.000 VND để mua gà nuôi. Bản thân chị làm giáo viên, chồng chị làm ở uỷ ban xã nhưng cũng giúp chị trong chăn nuôi. Chị có một con còn nhỏ. Chị rất thích tham gia chương trình trả dần và thủ tục nhanh gọn. Chị đã tham gia được một chu kỳ và đã hoàn trả rất tốt. Mức thu nhập của gia đình là 150.000 VND/ngày.

loans.use: Agriculture

loans.name: Mousse-Tafa

texts.fr:
Married and the father of three children, Mr. Mousse-Tafa A. was born on September 18, 1970 in Lomé. He is a barber in the Agbalépédo neighborhood not far from that district’s open-air market. He opened a barbershop he calls ABISCO COIFFURE in 2006.

He presently lacks certain necessary equipment and is requesting this first loan to buy 4 clippers, 3 mirrors, and two packs of razor blades. With this credit he would also like to redecorate his barbershop so as to attract as many clients as possible.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

Marié et père de trois enfants, Monsieur A. Mousse-Tafa est né le 18 septembre 1970 à Lomé. Il est coiffeur dans le quartier d’Agbalépédo, non loin du marché dudit quartier. Il a ouvert cet atelier dénommé ABISCO COIFFURE en 2006.

Actuellement il manque de certains outils de travail et sollicite à cet effet ce premier crédit pour acheter 4 tondeuses, 3 miroirs et 2 paquets de lames. Avec ce crédit, il désire également réaménager son atelier afin d’attirer plus de clients possible.

loans.use:
Purchase of barber's tools

Achat d'outils de travail

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es:
Victor is a determined man. He is committed to his occupation as a farmer mainly because thanks to that he can maintain a home and provide education to his 5 children, who go to school in the city. He has to send money for the university tuition and the necessary for their food and other expenses. He can’t stop working until his children have successfully completed their studies. Victor leaves early in the morning to go supervise his land; he goes on his horse to make the journey less tiring. He now needs to increase his production, for what he needs seeds and fertilizer. He requests this money as a loan with the goal to increase his income and cover all the needs of his home.

Translated from Spanish by Sofia Burt, Kiva volunteer.

Don Víctor es un hombre empeñoso y dedicado a su labor como agricultor, sobre todo porque gracias a ello puede mantener su hogar y la educación de sus 5 hijos, quienes cursan estudios en la ciudad, a donde tiene que enviar la pensión de la universidad y lo necesario para sus alimentos y otros gastos.Es así, que no puede dejar de trabajar hasta que sus hijos concluyan con éxito sus estudios. Víctor sale muy de mañana en compañía de su caballo quien hace que el recorrido hasta sus terrenos sea menos cansado.Ahora, él desea incrementar su producción y para ello necesita de semillas y de abono para su tierra, dinero que le solicita como préstamo con el fin de poder incrementar sus ingresos y cubrir las necesidades de su hogar.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer for land.

loans.name: Abdurakhmon

texts.en:
A. Abdurakhmon is 48 years old and is married with three children. Abdurakhmon has been a farmer since 2003. He grows vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. When it is growing season, he works in the field from early morning till late evening. Five years ago, Abdurakhmon started growing vegetables on a plot that was 0.10 hectares (about 1/4 acre). Currently he is growing onions on 0.50 hectares (about 1 1/4 acres). Now, when the business is stable, Abdurakhmon believes that it shall be the main income for him. He foresees additional expenses as his dearest children are growing up, and accordingly their expenses are rising.

His beloved wife does whatever she can to help him, and together they have decided to increase the number of crops they plant so that they can generate a larger income. For this reason, Abdurakhmon requests 1000 Somoni (300 US dollars) for the term of 8 months. He is planning to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and combustive-lubricating materials for tools for growing his business. Abdurakhmon thanks everyone who trusts and supports him. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, combustive-lubricating materials.

loans.name: Thavy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thavy M., 35, is the leader of a small group and she works for the Catholic Temple in Ratanak Commune, Battambang Province, Cambodia. She has been working since 2000 and earns approximately US $3.20 per day. Her husband is a provincial policeman and earns around US $1.20 per day. They have one young child. To increase her family's income, Thavy runs a business selling rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice to resell.

The picture shows Thavy and her group members: Mrs. Sarorn R., who is requesting a loan to purchase the materials to make cakes to sell, Mrs. Khorn C., who is requesting a loan to use as capital for her fish-selling business, and Mr. Chamroen N., who is requesting a loan to use for his business selling soft drinks.

loans.use: To purchase rice to resell

loans.name: Ramona Justina's Group

texts.es: La señora Ramona es una señora de 58 años de edad, es casada, no tiene hijos menores de edad, ya estan casados, su esposo es taxista. Su proposito es poder continuar trabajando, mantener su actividad economica que es lo que le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su familia,Su actividad economica es la venta de carne en su casa de habitacion hasta donde llegan los proveedores a entregarle dicho producto, en esta actividad tiene mas de 20 años de desarrollarla, la cual se ha quedado ejerciendo desde que inicio como producto de la necesidad de tener un empleo y en ese momento las condicones se lo permitian ya que su esposo es matarife es decir trabajo en el rastro municipal de la localidad en el destace de res, y vio una alternativa de ayudar y mantener un empleo. En la actualidad tiene ademas de la venta de carne en su domicilio tambien es propieatria de una unidad de transporte taxi que es la que opera su esposo. Doña Ramona es una mujer emprendedora y espera seguir contando con el apoyo de los diferentes programas que le puedan hacer realidad sus ideas como microempresaria
texts.en:
Ramona is 58 years old and married without any young children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her goal is to be able to continue working, maintaining the economic activity that has helped her family to get ahead. The aforementioned economic activity consists of meat sales from her home, which is where suppliers deliver her product to her. She has more than 20 years of experience in this field,which she began doing out of the necessity to be employed. At the time, her husband was a "matarife," or a person who worked in the town's cattle headquarters, and she saw an alternative means of helping him and also maintaining employment. In reality, she does more than just sell meat from her home. She is also the owner of a taxi transport unit that her husband operates. Ramona is an enterprising woman and hopes to continue counting on the help of various programs that can make her microindustrialist ideas a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Kayi

texts.fr: Agée de 38 ans, Madame A. Kayi est une revendeuse de céréales très dynamique et dévouée. L’année dernière, elle a sollicité et obtenu un crédit qu’elle a déjà soldé. Grâce au bénéfice qu’elle a dégagé de son activité de stockage et de vente de céréales, elle a pu assurer la formation de sa fille, la scolarisation de ses enfants et entreprendre des travaux de construction sur un terrain qu’elle avait acquis. Dans le souci d’offrir des conditions de vie meilleures aux membres de son ménage, Madame Kayi décide d’augmenter son pouvoir d’achat. C’est pour cette raison qu’elle sollicite un crédit qui lui servira de fonds de roulement indispensable à la rentabilité de son affaire.
texts.en:
Mrs. Kayi A. is a very energetic and devoted cereals reseller. Last year, she asked for, and was granted, a loan that she has already repaid. With the profit she made from her business stocking and selling cereals, she was able to provide for her daughter education, send her children to school and start construction work on a lot she bought. Anxious to offer better living conditions to the members of her household, Mrs. Kayi wants to increase her purchasing power. For this reason, she's seeking a loan to be used as the working capital indispensable to the profitability of her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cereals stocking and resale

loans.name: Musarat M.tahir Baig Group

texts.en:
My name is Musarat and I reside in Lahore, Pakistan. I have been living in this city for the past 14 years. I completed my education until the 8th standard and couldn’t study further because of my father’s low income. My husband's name is M. B. who has a decorative embroidery business. My husband has been teaching me the skill and art of embroidery and I am involved in the business. We both handle taking orders from the market. I have five sons. My elder son has a utensils selling business. The others are enrolled in a local school in the neighborhood. I have repaid my three loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now I am requesting a loan to buy materials (colored threads and beads) needed to expand our decorative embroidery business.

I am a group leader of a few more members of my locality. Najma baji is requesting a loan to buy beams for her shuttering business. Zaitoon baji is requesting a loan to buy material (lentils, cooking oil and spices) for her food business. Parveen baji is requesting a loan to buy a sewing machine to sew clothes. Maqbool baji is requesting a loan to buy a buffalo for her milk selling business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee each others loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible for the repayment of the entire loan.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business.

loans.name: Chinda

texts.en:
Mrs. Chinda P., age 25, and her husband, Mr. Socheat Chab, age 28, were married in 2003 and have two children: one son and one daughter. The children are still very young. The family lives along the No. 1 national road, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Chinda has been selling fruit for five years. She buys them in her village and then resells them at the Derm Kor market. Her husband has been a mason for one year. They dream that someday their children will become doctors.

Chinda is applying for a loan of $500 to purchase one motorbike to transport her fruits to the market.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to transport fruits to sell.

loans.name: Adejoke

texts.en:
Adejoke is 30 years old. She is married with 2 children.

Adejoke is a fashion designer. She also sells tailoring materials. She owns 2 sewing machines.

Adejoke is a client of LAPO. She needs a loan of N50,000 to purchase more tailoring materials to sell. She is very happy with Kiva lenders and prays that God will continuously bless them.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials

loans.name: May

texts.en: Mr. M. is 38 years old a resident of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. He has been operating a workshop next to his house for along time, providing a service for repairing motorbikes and bicycles. He currently makes an income of $4 per day to support his family's daily expense. M. is married to Pheap, 22, who is a good house wife and who makes a living planting a little vegetable patch on her own farmland. M. is asking for a loan to buy more motorcycle accessories to fulfill his customers' needs.

loans.use: To buy more motorcycle accessories for his repair shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, natural de Iquitos, reside en la ciudad de Lima hace 20 años, vive con su hijo de 26 años en su casa propia. Se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de productos variados, como adornos de porcelana, canicas, botones, etc., en una pequeña tienda que puso en su casa, en la cual atiende a sus vecinos, quienes son sus principales clientes. A Mary le gusta mucho su trabajo, ya que es muy tranquilo y le permite generar ganancias para su manutención, pero algunas veces el trabajo le resulta cansado, debido a que por las mañanas trabaja como empleada del hogar en la casa donde viven los sacerdotes, al costado de la parroquia, y a partir de las 2 de la tarde se dedica de lleno a su negocio propio hasta promediar las 10 de la noche. Mary quiere generar mayores ingresos para poder dedicarse exclusívamente a su tienda y ser más independiente, es por eso que quiere un espacio más grande para comprar mayores productos y equipar mejor su tienda. Con el dinero que solicita comprará material de construcción como ladrillos, cemento, etc., para la ampliación de su tienda, vender más, obtener más ganancias y pronto dedicarse sólo a su negocio.
texts.en:
Mary is 49 years old, a single mother and native of Iquitos. She has lived in the city of Lima for 20 years. She lives with her 26-year-old son in her own house. For three years, she has sold various products like porcelain decorations, marbles and buttons in a small store she put in her house. She attends to her neighbors, who are her primary customers. Mary really enjoys her work, as it is very laid-back and allows her to generate an income to support herself. But sometimes her work leaves her tired because in the morning she works as a maid in the priests' house next to the parrish, and then works in her own business from 2 o'clock in the afternoon until about 10 at night. Mary wants to generate a better income so she can devote herself exclusively to her store and be more independent. For this reason, she wants a larger space so she can buy more products and better-equip her store. With this loan, she will buy construction materials such as bricks, cement, etc. to expand her store, sell more, obtain a better wage and soon devote herself solely to her business.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand shop space

loans.name: Judith Akinyi

texts.en: Judith Akinyi A. is a 24-year-old mother of two children aged 9 and 3. They are both in school. She sells dry maize and chips. To make the chips, she peels potatoes, heats oil and then dips the potatoes in hot oil before draining the oil. She serves the chips with a little salad. Her husband is a tailor. She is asking for 15,000 KSH to purchase more dry maize and potatoes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy dry maize and potatoes

loans.name: Zuhura

texts.en:
Zuhura D. is a poultry keeper. She runs the business at Yombo Buza ward in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania.

She keeps both broilers and layers in her poultry cages. Broilers take only four months to be sold, but layers take six months to produce the first eggs. During the first six months a lot of funds are consumed for treatment and feeding. Thus, income from selling the broilers is used to meet the cost of raising the layers.

Zuhura needs a loan of Tshs 800,000 to extend the business by constructing more poultry cages and buying more chicks.

loans.use: To construct more poultry cages and buy more chicks

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is 47 years old. She is married with three children – two sons and a daughter – all of whom are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a busy fishing and commercial town called Mankessim, near Cape Coast, in the central region of Ghana. 

Cecilia works to help her husband provide for the family. Her husband is a commercial driver and Cecilia is a trader. She sells cereals such as maize,rice, beans, etc., at the local market to food vendors and retailers. She procures her cereals all the way from Ejura in the northern sector.

Cecilia has been in business for over eight years. She is requesting for a loan to increase her working capital to procure cereals in bulk. She is hoping to improve her income to provide a more decent life for family and also to sponsor her kids in school.

loans.use: To procure cereals

loans.name: Ndanyela Group

texts.en:
Queen is a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Ndanyela group loan (Group code 2019). Daily she works at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale, to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Queen is 40 years old, married, and has five children: ages 22, 19, 17, 15, and 12. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Neema, who has her own small business selling charcoal in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale, to expand her business

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en: Vaqif

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Nive

texts.en: Nive S., 41, is married with six children.  She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public two days per week. She has had two previous loans with SPBD, a Kiva partner.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (about $145). SPBD loans are Nive’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase sacks of fertilizers, a wheelbarrow and weed killer

loans.name: Muidinkhoja

texts.en:
O. Muidinkhoja is 27 years old. He is in the business of selling DVD disks. He tries to have all the latest movies, concerts of the popular actors, singers and others. He also sells cell phones produced in China. Being the owner of the business, Muidinkhoja  travels to the neighboring country, China, to purchase newer and modern cell phones at wholesale prices. For that reason, the retail prices of his products are lower than his competitors, allowing him to maintain a large clientele in this market. Today, Muidinkhoja is requesting a loan of $2000 USD. He is planning to purchase a large supple of DVD disks and cell phones to increase the quantity and variety of his goods. Muidinkhoja thanks all for supporting him and promises to be diligent in his loan payment.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a large supply of DVD disks and cell phones

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie P. is from the village of Curvada, Tukuran, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 40 years old. Elsie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Elsie owns and operates a pedicab transport service business. Elsie is just starting this business.

In 2009, Elsie joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsie is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional vehicles for the business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elsie from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase vehicles for her transportation business

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a member of the Makongoro borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 33 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 2 children.Her children are aged 5 and 1 years.

Fatuma started her own clothing business selling clothes 4 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 450,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Fatuma`s second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 250,000 Tsh in order to buy more clothes for sale.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Fatuma hopes to save more money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Carla Patricia

texts.es: La joven de nombre Carla Patricia L. Dávila tiene la edad de 27 años, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos todos son menores de edad. Sus propósitos son de mantener su negocio activo por lo que tiene que sacar adelante a su familia ya que son su mayor prioridad. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es una pulpería, la ubicación de su negocio es en su casa de habitación hace mas 5años que se dedica este medio de vida. Sus inicios se dan con otro tipo de negocio ella inicia vendiendo refrescos ya que tenía que hacerse cargo de sus hijos ya que no tenía ninguna ayuda de parte d su esposo, pero no le gustaba salir y dejar a sus hijos por lo que decide establecer una pulpería en su casa de habitación y fue con la ayuda Dios que salió adelante. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar las compras de los productos como son granos básicos, golosinas y otros productos que son necesarios por sus clientes.

loans.use: capital de trabajo

loans.name: Lung

texts.en:
Lung B. is married with two children. He lives with his wife in Battambong Province. To make a living, he operates his motor taxi in the town and other nearby markets, typically earning US $6 per day. His wife is involved in a business of selling vegetables at the market, earning an income of US $9 per day. Both of them have to work hard every day to ensure a good living for the family and especially the children.

Therefore, B. is seeking to increase his income and improve his business. He is asking for a loan of US $800 to purchase a new motorbike which will consume less gasoline and be efficient enough to generate a better income. By doing so, he believes that he will be able to manage a good standard of living for his family.

loans.use: buy a gas-efficient motorbike

loans.name: Heang

texts.en: Heang M. is 43 years old and resides in the Takeo province with her husband and five of her children. She and her husband sell palm fruit to earn a living and are able to make US$5 of profit every day. This couple also supported by three of the children who are garment factories workers. Two of the children are in school. Heang M. would like to a loan of US$800 to make a new investment. She will take this loan to purchase a food stand at tourist resort.

loans.use: To purchase a food stand.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda D. is from the village of Danao. She is 51 years old, married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Rosenda owns and operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Rosenda has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2006, Rosenda joined Kiva partner PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. This loan was used to to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. Rosenda is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be her third from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en: Ma. Luz V. has piggeryin Norala, South Cotabato.  She is 45 years old and has two children. Her oldest child is 14 years old.  She started her piggery in 2007.  She is asking for financial support to help finance her business.  She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. requesting a loan of 6,000 PHP.  She will use the loan to buy more feed for her pigs.

loans.use: Pig feed

loans.name: Clara

texts.en:
Clara E. is from Bañaderos Ozamiz City, Philippines. She is a 55-year-old widow who has three adult-aged children. To make a living, Clara owns and operates a business venture in retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste to the local community. Clara has been engaged in her business for more than six years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2006, Clara joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services and she has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from GDMPC. Clara is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP that will be used to purchase additional additional product to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Clara from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old married man and the father of 3 young children.

He has been working as a furniture painter since 2003 in his own business, and he has 11 years of experience in this field. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy additionA. painting tools and products.

loans.use: To buy additional painting tools and products

loans.name: Elba

texts.es: Elba T. S., reside en el municipio de Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador. Debido a que sus hijos son mayores y ya están casados, ella vive sola. Es por esto que Elba posee una venta de ropa, cosméticos y perfumes, también posee una venta de minutas (hielo con sabores de frutas), para la temporada de verano, en la cual aprovecha el calor para poder vender más minutas. Dichos negocios son los que le permiten poder contar con todo lo que necesita para tener una vida digna. Ella solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar más ropa y cosméticos, así mismo comprar otros productos como zapatos. Elba desea poder aprovechar al máximo el dinero del préstamo para invertir en su negocio, ya que es este el que le permite poder seguir adelantes, teniendo todo lo necesario, gracias a su esfuerzo diario.
texts.en:
Elba T. S. lives in the town of Apopa in the department of San Salvador. Due to the fact that her children are now older and are married, she lives alone. For this reason Elba sells clothing, cosmetics and perfumes, as well as “minutas” (ice with fruit flavors) during the summer. She takes advantage of the heat to sell more minutas in the summer. These businesses are what allow Elba to have everything she needs to lead a decent life. She is asking for a loan with which to buy more clothing and cosmetics as well as purchase other products like shoes. Elba wishes to take full advantage of this loan to invest in her business since the business is what allows her to move forward in life and obtain all necessities, thanks to her daily efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Clothing and Cosmetics

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Vaaipu

texts.en:
Vaaipu  N. is 46 and married with 2 children (ages 15 and 21).  She owns a business venture, providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Vaaipu  has many years of experience in this business.  Vaaipu  needs a loan of WST $1250 to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 360 tala or US $150 per week) to pay for her children's tuition fees.

In 2008, Vaaipu  joined SPBD.  This is her 2nd loan with SPBD. SPBD's loans are Vaaipu 's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Vaaipu  N. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                2 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         1.78 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.88 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles & threads

loans.name: Islomiddin

texts.en: A. Islomiddin has been working on this farm his entire life. He lives with his wife and three children. Islomiddin relies completely on growing potatoes and processing dried apricots to feed his family, as his lands are only productive for this activity. His children help him with his business. Islomiddin has a large family and that’s why today he wishes to borrow money to buy and process dried apricots. He request 1,000 USD as this amount would help him accomplish his goals in a short time. Your generosity can change his life and that of his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase dried apricots to process and sell

loans.name: Cookery Women Group

texts.en:
These are the members of the Cookery Women Group. They are small-scale businesswomen who are based in the city of Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, to make more profit, and, consequently, to improve their standard of living.

Isatu S. I is the leader of this group. Isatu was born in Kambia in northern Sierra Leone. She is 50 years old and married to a farmer. They have three children. One child is attending secondary school, and the other two children are attending primary school. For more than 10 years now, Isatu has sold cooked rice, meat, and vegetables. With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking materials such as rice, palm oil, meat, onions, and tomatoes in large quantities.

(Please note: In the middle of the photo is a former group member who is no longer a group member.)

loans.use: To buy cooking materials such as rice, palm oil, meat, onions, and tomatoes in large quantities

loans.name: Santos Margarita

texts.es: Santos Margarita se dedica a la venta de joyas y perfumes, tiene 53 años de edad, soltera, es primer crédito que solicita, sus referencias indican que es una persona responsable y trabajadora, necesita un crédito para incrementar su capital de trabajo en la venta de joyas y perfumes, en los últimos meses sus ventas han mejorado considerablemente el crédito le ayuda surtir su venta.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita sells jewelry and perfume. She is 53 years old and single. This is the first loan she has requested. Her references indicate that she is a responsible and hard-working person. She needs the loan to increase her working capital in selling jewelry and perfume. In the last few months her sales have improved considerably. The loan helps her stock her business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy jewelry and perfume

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina I. is a young and vibrant woman. At her age of 23 years old, she can already imagine herself not just a plain housewife of her fisherman husband and a mother to their only child but as a successful businesswoman. She became more excited with her vision when she joined ASHI, a Kiva partner, recently. For her, it is not impossible to achieve because she can obtain a loan once she requests it. Despite being poor, she believes in her capacity to pay back because the loan she will be receiving will be used in a business. Aside from the fact of having her own business and profit to support the needs of her family, especially her only 3-year-old child, Gina will also be able to improve her personality by gaining high self-esteem.

The loan Gina is requesting from Kiva through ASHI will be used start up a fish vending/selling business. It was her husband and neighbors who inspired her for doing such business because she saw from them that despite small capital, they can earn income and can provide cash flow for the family. It is more salable compared to other products because food is one of the basic needs of people.

loans.use: To purchase fish to resell directly to people

loans.name: Gongor

texts.en:
Gongor is 46 years-old and lives with his wife and four children in Zavhan province, Mongolia in an apartment which they own. During the day, Gongor operates a meat trading business in his town. He sells a variety of meat at a local market called Tavan-Erdene. Gongor has been operating his business since 2000 and has steadily expanded his business over the past years. In the future,he plans to purchase a  car with his business profits. 

Gongor is optimistic about the future and hopes to grow his business to a very stable operation. His business is very important for him and he hopes his future earnings will improve his family's quality of life.  He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug (~  1407 USD) loan to purchase a large amount of meat at wholesale prices and resell them for a profit.

loans.use: To purchase meat.

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es: Agustina tiene 62 años, vive con su esposo en su casa que es propia. DesD. hace 10 años se dedica a vender leche en el mercado central D. su ciudad. Es entonces que todas las mañanas se dirige a su punto D. venta, del cual ya sus clientes la esperan para comprar le leche fresca que ofrece. Es así, que su rutina empieza con el orD.ño D. sus vacas, para luego pasar el proceso D. cuajo, siendo el producto final la leche que comercializa. Al término del día, va a su casa a cuidar D. sus demás animales que tiene. Paralelo a ello, se dedica también al cultivo D. maíz y papa, que lo utiliza para su propio consumo. El trabajo que realiza es gratificante, por lo que planea comprar más animales, además esta actividad le permite estar ocupada todo el tiempo y sentirse autosuficiente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por lo que promete ser muy responsable con sus pagos, además considera que este aporte le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su negocio. El crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. un becerro para su respectiva crianza y convertirlo en una vaca muy productiva, asimismo desea comprar sacos D. abono para sembrar alfalfa, en el que serán utilizados como forraje para sus animales.
texts.en:
Agustina is 62 years old. She lives with her husband in their own house. For the past 10 years, she has worked selling milk in her city's central market. Every morning when she goes to her sales stall, her customers are already waiting to buy the milk she offers. Her routine starts with the milking of her cows and then the process of separation to produce the milk that she sells. At the end of the day, she goes home to take care of the other animals she raises. Parallel to this, she also grows corn and potatoes, which she uses for her family's own consumption. She finds her work satisfying, and she plans to expand it by purchasing more animals. Her work also allows her to keep busy all the time and feel self-sufficient. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she promises to be very responsible with her payments. She believes this support will be very useful for the progress of her business. She will use the loan she is requesting to invest in buying a calf to raise into a highly productive milk cow. She would also like to buy sacks of fertilizer to grow alfalfa, which she will use as feed for her animals.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying a calf as well as sacks of fertilizer to grow alfalfa

loans.name: Apolonio

texts.es: Apolonio tiene 50 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa Flora  de 48 años, que es agricultora y con el menor de sus 5  hijos,  ya que son mayores e independientes. Desde muy joven, aprendió de sus padres y hermanos las técnicas agrícolas necesarias para obtener una cosecha exitosa, hoy es un gran agricultor, sembrando papa de buena calidad. En tanto su esposa e hijo menor lo ayudan en la actividad, con tal de que se desarrolle sus campos de cultivo, es por eso que están siempre vigilándolos, brindándoles el cuidado necesario con los fertilizantes y abono, para que logren recoger una buena producción. Le gusta mucho este trabajo porque sabe como lograr tener una buena cosecha, pese que es tedioso el trabajo, pero le da mucha satisfacción, para ella la vida en el campo es su vida. Cuando es tiempo de cosecha, Apolonio en compañía de su familia deben trabajar el doble, puesto que se requiere de mucho esfuerzo para recoger todas las papas listas para luego ser vendidas a los comerciantes mayoristas de la ciudad, que le ofrecen regulares ganancias económicas, permitiéndole vivir cómodamente. En adelante,  no solo desea aumentar su producción, si no también empezar a sembrar alverja, ya que el precio de esta legumbre se mantiene estable en el mercado nacional. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP por tanto promete en ser bien cumplido con sus cuotas, manifiesta además que le gusta trabajar con su grupo comunal, pues todos los integrantes son puntuales y responsables. Apolonio tiene pensado invertir el crédito en la compra de abono, pesticida y fertilizante para proteger sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Apolonio is 50 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Flora, who is 48, and with the youngest of their 5 children. The rest are grown and living independently. From a young age, Apolonio learned from his parents and his siblings the farming techniques necessary to obtain a successful harvest. Today he is a successful farmer who grows high-quality potatoes. Both his wife and his youngest son help him in this work, in order for his fields to be productive. Apolonio is always watching over his fields, caring for them as necessary with fertilizers so that they yield a good harvest. He enjoys his work because he knows how to get a good harvest. Although it can be tedious, it is satisfying to him because he enjoys this rural way of life. At harvest time, Apolonio and his family must work twice as hard, because it takes a great deal of effort to harvest all the potatoes. He then sells these to wholesalers in the city who offer him a steady income, allowing him to live comfortably. In the future, Apolonio would like to increase production and start to plant peas, because the price of peas has been stable on the national level, This is his third loan with MFP [the Kiva field partner] and he promises to be on time with his repayments. He also reports that he enjoys working with his communal bank group because all of the members are responsible and on-time in their payments. Apolonio plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides to protect his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Fountain, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and pesticides for his crops.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María tiene 35 años de edad, comparte su vida con sus cuatro hijos y juntos viven en casa de su madre. Su trabajo consiste en vender ropa de forma ambulante, actividad que viene realizando desde hace 6 años atrás, tiempo en el cual ha ganado mucha experiencia, conociendo las necesidades y gustos de la clientela. Es por ello, que al adquirir sus prendas, los hace pensando en el gusto y selección de sus compradores. María se siente contenta con su trabajo, pues le da independencia y libertad para dedicarles tiempo a sus hijos, que aún están en edad escolar. Otra de las ventajas que le da su trabajo es el poder trabajar en el mismo rubro que su madre, pues ambas venden ropa acompañándose muchas veces en la venta. En un futuro desea sacar adelante su negocio poniendo algo más fijo, pero María sabe que aún le hace falta capital y mucho trabajo para lograrlo es por ello que trabaja con tantas ganas para conseguirlo. Este es su segundo crédito con MFP y se compromete una vez más a ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará mayor cantidad de prendas de vestir para así aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
María is 35 years old and shares her life with her four children. They live together in her mother’s house. She has been selling clothing on foot for more than six years and has managed to gain lots of insight on her customers’ needs and wants. Because of this she takes her customers into account when acquiring her merchandise. María is happy with her work because it gives her some independence and allows her to spend time with her children, who are of school age. Another advantage she has is that it allows her to work in the same field as her mother. They both sell clothing and they often go out together to sell. Someday she wants to move her business ahead and establish a more permanent location, but María knows that she needs more working capital and lots of hard work, but she is anxious to make it happen. This will be her second loan through MFP and she is committed to being punctual with her payments. She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing in quantity in order to increase her income.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Joepet Jade

texts.en:
Joepet Jade D. is from the city of Las Aguadas Ozamiz City. He is 26 years old. Joepet Jade is single. To make a living, Joepet Jade owns & operates a business venture in the services sector operating transportation services. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from operating motor transport services. Joepet Jade has been engaged in his business for over 3 years and earns approximately 20000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Joepet Jade joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Joepet Jade has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15000 PHP from GDMPC. Joepet Jade is requesting a new loan of 25000 PHP which will be used to repair existing vehicle for better service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Joepet Jade from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 37 years old. He is married with 2 children, ages 1½ and 3 years old. Neither of the children is attending school. He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley Kenya. He has been farming for 2 years and has employed one person from the community. His main product is milk which he sells on the local market. He also sells tea leaves and chickens on the local market and owns a posho (cornmeal) mill in the same area. His biggest challenge in farming has been animal diseases and lack of enough animal feed.

He has requested this loan from Juhudi Kilimo for 30,000 KES to purchase and insure a dairy cow. This loan will enable him to acquire a good dairy cow that will increase his milk production and earn him enough income to cater for the family's expenses.

In future, he would like to improve his dairy farming and make it a real business by improving the quality of the dairy cows and building a modern dairy unit.

He is plans to request more funding in future and hopes for other assistance like training sessions.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús, de  22 años, es un joven soltero, que vive solo en un cuarto alquilado.Se dedica a la panadería; es un especialista en amasar y  labrar las roscas y alfajores (bocadillos dulces). El principal comprador de sus productos, es una  empresa  de transporte, a la que abastece de sus deliciosos bocadillos. Desde muy joven trabajo como ayudante, pero desde hace dos años se independizo e incursiono en el  negocio. En  la actualidad  su madre lo apoya en la labor junto a algunos ayudantes, y de esta manera  entrega a tiempo  sus pedidos. Se siente muy satisfecho con la labor que desempeña, aunque el alquiler de la panadería le absorbe gran parte de sus ganancias;  más aun porque no cuenta con un stock de insumos para cubrir al 100% sus pedidos. En adelante piensa ampliar su mercado y mejorar su servicio para abarcar nuevos mercados.Es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP, y se compromete en pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues sabe que el dinero le será muy beneficioso para aumentar el capital de su negocio.Jesús tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de  varios sacos de harina, azúcar y mantequilla, asimismo piensa realizar los tramites para regularizar  la licencia de funcionamiento de su panadería, pues desea continuar ampliando su negocio.
texts.en:
22-year old Jesús is a young man, unmarried, who lives alone in a rented room. He is a baker whose speciality is kneading dough and making bread rolls and alfajores (filled cookies). Most of his delicious products are bought by a transportation company. Ever since he was young, Jesús worked as an assistant in a bakery, but two years ago he opened his own business. Currently his mother helps him as well as several assistants so he is able to deliver orders on time. He feels very satisfied with this work although the cost of renting the bakery takes a large part of his earnings. Another problem is that the ingredients that he stocks are not enough to cover 100% of the orders. In the future Jesús is thinking of expanding his customer base and improving service so he can move into other markets. This is his first loan with Kiva partner MFP and he promises to make his repayments on time because he knows that the money will be very beneficial in increasing the amount of capital available to him. Jesús is planning to use the loan to buy sacks of flour, sugar, and butter. He also wants to complete the necessary paperwork and obtain a business licence, and continue expanding the bakery.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients and a business licence

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Satos es de 51 años de edad es soltera, tiene un hijo varón, se dedica a confeccionar playeras, en la actividad tiene aproximadamente cuatro años de experiencia, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar dos maquinas lo que le ayuda a mejora y aumentar su producción de playeras, sus referencias personales indican que es un apersona responsables y trabajador, con la ayuda de su hijo podrá realizar los pagos mensuales.
texts.en:
Santos, 51, is single and has a son. She manufactures t-shirts. She has been in this line of work for about 4 years. She is asking for her first loan to buy two sewing machines that will help her improve and increase t-shirt production. Her personal references indicate she’s a responsible and hardworking person. Her son will help her meet her monthly payments.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase roofing materials: zinc sheets, perlins and labor

loans.name: Anarkul's Group

texts.en:
Anarkul B. is the leader of this group. She is thirty-three and married. She has two children of thirteen and eleven years old. Both of them go to school. Her husband is school teacher. Anarkul is also a school teacher. However, they also breed cattle. They started cattle breeding from a purchase of cattle with money that was obtained through sale of vegetables from their garden. They increased the number of cattle to seven. They started cattle breeding six years ago with an initial investment of 6000 soms. Anarkul applied for the loan to buy cattle in order to further increase their number. In the near future, they are planning to make capital repairs to their house with the profits from their business.  

Group members:

Sairagul M. is the treasurer of the group. She is thirty-two and married. She has three children: her son is fifteen and her daughters are twelve and six years old. All of them got to school. Her husband is a builder. Sairagul is a school teacher. Together with her husband, she started cattle breeding from a purchase of cattle with the first salary of her husband. Now, they have been almost four years in cattle breeding and they have significantly increased their herd. Now, they make at least 1000 soms each month on cattle breeding. They are applying for a loan in order to make capital repairs to their house before the winter period. In the future, with the profits from cattle breeding, they are planning to expand their herd as much as possible.

Nuriila R. is thirty-eight and married. She has four children. Her eldest child got married and lives independently. Her younger three children go to school and live with her. She is a teacher of Russian language and Literature at the local school. Her husband breeds cattle. They started cattle breeding with the help of a loan in the amount of 5000 soms. From that moment, they have significantly increased their herd. They have already been  in the cattle breeding business for seven years. They are applying for a loan in order to pay for their son’s education. 

Aidai Z. is thirty-nine and a widow. She has three children. Her elderst child got married and lives independently. Her younger children live with her. They go to school. She is a teacher at the local school. She combines her job as a teacher with cattle breeding. She started cattle breeding fifteen years ago with her husband using money from his salary in the amount of 3000 soms. Now, she is applying for a loan in order to buy cattle for fattening. In the future, she is planning to build a house and buy a car for her family. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

 This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is a 39-year-old father of six school-aged children. He is a dairy farmer from Litein town in Rift Valley, Kenya. He has been farming for the last five years and employs one farmhand. He sells his milk to local hotels and individuals. He also earns income from his small-scale farming of tea which he sells through Kenya Tea Development Authority.

Johnstone has requested this loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. By purchasing an extra dairy cow, he feels that his income will increase and in turn improve the living conditions of his family. However, he faces the challenge of animal diseases and poor market prices for his milk. He still hopes that in the future he will be able to buy more dairy cows and build a dairy unit that will accommodate his high quality dairy cows. He is grateful to Juhudi for advancing loan facilities.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Poach

texts.en:
Poach S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known for being a cross-border business area with Vietnam. 

S. is a farmer and grows rice for an income of $3 US per day. Her husband is an ice-cream seller, earning an income of $5 per day.  S. is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase a motorbike for the family's use.

 In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buying a motorbike

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa H. started her business, Las Misiones Arts and Crafts, after she met a representative of ACCION Texas-Louisiana at a flea market a year ago.
