Elsa would sell crafts at several different venues, including the flea market, festivals, fairs and celebratory events. However, she only sold crafts on the weekends and could not secure a steady income. Therefore, when she was approached by an ACCION representative a year ago, she jumped on the opportunity to start her own business, something that she had always dreamed of!

Elsa will use this loan to buy inventory like pottery, paintings, statues, fountains, and Aztec and Mayan art to sell at her store. All of her inventory is bought throughout Mexico, with an emphasis on items from Guadalajara. Elsa hopes to eventually start more businesses in the El Paso area and to continue to improve her English. Her advice to people unemployed and looking for a job is, “Keep trying. There is help. You just have to keep looking.”

loans.use: To purchase inventory: pottery, paintings, statues, fountains, and Aztec and Mayan art

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane Q. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 46 years old. Mary Jane is married and has three children. To make a living, Mary Jane plants and harvests rice for sale. Mary Jane also runs a small sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells soy sauce, biscuits and other kinds of products.

Mary Jane joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jane has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Mary Jane is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 32 year-old married man.  He runs a cafeteria to earn a living.  He was previously employed before he went into business.  He has been able to employ two people in his business.  He hopes to own a chain of hotels in five years.  

He has been guaranteed a loan of 30,000 Kes by Mayo Kenya group in Faulu Kenya.  This is his first loan from Faulu Kenya and he plans to add stock of maize flour and cereals. The photo has been taken in his busy cafeteria.

loans.use: To buy maize flour and cereals

loans.name: Gulbar's Group

texts.en:
Gulbar M., 49, is the leader of this friendly and ambitious group. She’s a resident of a small Southern town: Kadamjai. Since early childhood, Gulbar watched her parents raise cattle. They later realized that they had to pass on the family business to Gulbar. Gulbar’s parents have been breeding cattle for years and distributing their product to many local buyers. The business was started with only 500 soms, and eighteen years ago Gulbar took charge of it. Small investments brought some profit. At the moment she has two dairy cows and two young calves. She keeps herself busy every day. 

Gulbar is married; her husband is an expert in a local firm. He also tries to help Gulbar with business. They thank their lucky stars for succeeding in this business because it helped them to provide a good education for their children. Their oldest son works in the US; their second son makes a living in Turkey. Unfortunately, the youngest son has physical disabilities and stays at home with his parents. 

Eighteen years of cattle breeding generated proceeds to arrange a nice wedding ceremony for their daughter. Now they are working on the construction of their own filling station. Cattle breeding brings only 3000 soms a month, which is not enough for purchasing the required construction materials. The family hopes to get this loan to finish construction of the gas station. Traffic is always busy in their town, so they are sure that the filling station will always be full of customers and that they will be able to repay the loan. 


--- Where Did This Loan Come From? --- 

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase two tons of cement

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna O. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 41 years old, married, and has three children. To make a living, Erna raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Erna also owns and manages a sari-sari store where she sells a variety of different products.

Erna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Erna has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Erna is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase piglets and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase piglets and feeds

loans.name: José Daniel

texts.es:
José tiene 25 años de edad, es soltero y reside en casa de su madre, su vivienda se encuentra situada en el distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar como ayudante en una peluquería ubicada en la zona donde reside, el brinda todo tipo de servicios a sus clientes: cortes de cabello, peinados, entre otros, el negocio es su única fuente de ingreso y siempre da lo mejor de si para obtener más clientes. Con algunas de sus ganancias ayuda a su madre a mejorar su calidad de vida.

José es una persona bastante responsable y que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante. Actualmente desea adquirir algunos implementos para sacar adelante su negocio, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
José is 25 years old.  He is single and lives in his mother's house in Chepén district.  This is an agricultural area, with quite a lot of commercial activity, which is located more than one hour from the city of Chiclayo

José works as an assistant in a hairdressing salon in his area.  He provides all kinds of services for his customers: haircuts, hairdos, etc.  The business is his only source of income and he always provides the best of himself in order to attract more customers.  José uses some of his profits to help his mother to improve her quality of life.

José is quite a responsible person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.  He would currently like to acquire some tools to keep his business going.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan for 800 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To acquire some tools to keep his business going

loans.name: Donatille

texts.en: Donatille is 35 years old, married and has five children who range in age from four to 15 years old. Her husband is nurse, and they both work hard to meet their family's basic needs. Donatille owns a small store where she sells various products, but is hampered by a lack of capital. She finds this frustrating because she works very hard -- from 7 a.m. to 5:30 p.m. -- and is very skilled at what she does. She is applying for this loan to buy more products to sell, to attract more customers and to increase her profits.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Miguel's Group

texts.en: To make a living, Miguel R. raises pigs for breeding. He is 41 years old, married and has five school-aged children. They are from the village of Little Tadian. Miguel has been in his business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2010, Miguel joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Miguel is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be his first loan from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of his children. Miguel is the leader of a seven member group accessing a loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members, if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is "Miguel R. Group". About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Rodny Ariel

texts.es:
Rodny Ariel M.  de 27 años de edad es casado con la Sra. Thelma Martinez, con quien tiene dos hijos que se encuentran estudiando en primaria; ella se encarga del cuido de la casa y la familia.  Rodny labora para la Alcaldia Municipal de Juigalpa  desde hace tres años actualmente se desempeña como Responsable de Programacion de Poyectos.  

Esta solicitando su segundo credito con el objetivo de construir el pantri de su casa.
Su mayor sueño es brindarle todas las comodidades a su familia el cual hará poco a poco con la Ayuda que le brinda afodenic y kiva a quien agradece mucho
texts.en:
Rodny Ariel M. is 27 years old and married to Thelma Martinez, with whom he has two children, currently elementary school students. Thelma works taking care of the household and family. Rodny has worked for three years for the Municipality of Juigalpa, in the position of Project Planning Manager.   

He is requesting his second loan, with the aim of constructing a pantry in his house. 

His greatest dream is to provide his family with all of the household conveniences, which he will do little by little with the help provided by Afodenic and Kiva, to whom he is very grateful.

loans.use: Improving his home

loans.name: Trabajando Hacia El Bienestar 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Ana is the coordinator of her group, "Trabajando hacia el Bienestar" 2 & 3 (Working towards Well-being). She makes her home in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her goal is to work to enable her children to have better living conditions. In the meantime she plans to continue serving her family and others.

Ana is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza. She has been doing business taking different loans, and now she feels stable having Esperanza´s loans. She plans to use this one to invest in her clothing sales, purchasing all kind of clothes. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because she needed capital to develop her business and increase her household income. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's other Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Samana, a lush, rugged peninsuL. with a nascent tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable electricity and running water (none of which is potable).

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Betty

texts.en: Betty is currently in the business of selling electronics.  She is 30 years old, married to a driver,  and has 3 children -- all of whom go to school. Betty borrowed a loan to stock more electronics products to sell.  She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits in the future.

loans.use: To stock electronics products to sell

loans.name: Mujeres Cumbeñas (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Mujeres Cumbeñas está formado por 8 mujeres y 1 hombre quienes laboran en diferentes actividades para aportar  la economía familiar, son gente luchadora, trabajadora y muy carismática. Viven entre las parroquias de la Victoria del Portete y Cumbe, las mismas que se caracterizan por ser de clima frió, su gente se dedica a la cría de animales y a la agricultura, muchos de sus habitantes han migrado en busca de un mejor trabajo.

La Señora. Magali T. vive en la comunidad 24 de Mayo en la parroquia de Cumbe, tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y ha concebido 3 hijos de 11, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primera hija estudia en una escuela de la comunidad. Su esposo labora como carpintero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

Doña Magali se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y al cuidado de sus hijos, algunas veces también trabaja lavando ropa. En su casa cría pollos, chanchos y becerros a los cuales los vende en su propia comunidad.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y  lo va a invertir en la compra de más animales para crecer en este negocio. Su meta es culminar sus estudios de la secundaria.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Cumbeñas” communal bank is composed of eight women and one man who work in different activities to provide family income.  They are tenacious, hard working, very charismatic people.  They live among the Victoria del Portete and Cumbe Parishes which are characterized by having cold climate.  Their residents raise animals and farm; many of the residents have emigrated in search of better employment. 

Mrs. Magali T. lives in Cumbe Parish’s 24 de Mayo community.  She’s 27 years old, married and has had three children who are 11, 4 and 2 years of age.  Her first daughter goes to a local school.  Her husband works as a Carpenter.  They do not have a house of their own; they rent.

Magali is a housewife and tends to her children.  Sometimes she takes in laundry.  She raises chickens, pigs and calves at home which she then sells in her community.

This is her second loan with the communal bank. She will use it to buy more animals so that her business will grow.  Her goal is to finish secondary school.

loans.use: to buy chickens, pigs and calves.

loans.name: Sabeti

texts.en:
Sabeti is a widow with six children.   One attends school and the others graduated from school. They own a house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees, food and clothing. For the past five years, she has operated a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby.

Sabeti faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future. With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal and pay for transport. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 20 sacks of charcoal and pay for transport.

loans.name: Abalo

texts.en: M. is currently in business selling beans and maize flour. She is 28 years old, with five children and four of them go to school. M. borrowed a loan to stock more beans and maize flour to sell. She hopes to pay for her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more beans and maize flour to sell.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda S. is from the village of Kandiis, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. She is 47 years old. Nilda is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling snack foods, candies, biscuits and beverages in the local community. She also operates her videoke services during evening hours. Nilda has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Nilda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Nilda is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba has been buying and selling sacks of maize in Brasi, a village near Cape Coast, for 4 years. Aba has received senior high education. She is married to a farmer and has eight dependent children. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills.

Aba's loan will be used to buy additional sacks of maize to increase her supply. She hopes to reinvest the new profit. At the time of the visit, Aba was yet to receive her new consignment. She is standing in front of the store where she keeps the maize.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of maize.

loans.name: Argedis

texts.es:
Argedis es un hombre trabajador de 29 años de edad, él vive con su esposa e hijo en una pequeña comunidad rural perteneciente al distrito de Tambogrande – Piura.

Argedis se dedica a la crianza de ovinos y a la agricultura. Cuenta con terreno agrícola en el cual siembra limón y mango que cosecha semanalmente y asiste diariamente. Argedis tiene clientela establecida en su zona, para ambos negocios. La venta de animales y de sus frutos le permite a Argedis darle ciertas comodidades a su familia. Sin embargo, él tiene muchos deseos de darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Argedis solicita a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles que invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales. Así como, para comprar fertilizantes para que sus cultivos den una mejor calidad de fruto y por lo tanto le genere mayores ganancias.
 
Argedis tiene muchos deseos de superación y tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales.
texts.en:
Argedis is a hardworking 29 year old. He lives with his wife and son in a small rural community in the district of Tambogrande-Piura. 
Argedis works raising sheep and crops. He has agricultural land where he has lemon and mango trees that he harvests weekly and tends daily. Argedis has established customers in his area for both businesses. Selling animals and his fruits enables Argedis to give his family some home comforts. However, he has a strong desire to give his family a better standard of living. 
Argedis is requesting a loan of $375 from Edpyme Alternativa to buy good food for his animals and to buy fertilizer so that his trees will have better quality fruit and therefore generate more income.
Argedis is eager to succeed and has good personal and work references.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Sinourn

texts.en:
Sinourn, age 30, is married and resides in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She is engaged in a business of selling fruits, earning an income of $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. She also raises cows at home to generate more income. 

Sinourn is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase a motorbike to transport fruits to sell in the city. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fruits to resell.

loans.name: Marceline

texts.en:
Marceline is 44 years old and married. She sells bricks. Her business is well organized and she has three years' experience. She currently employs four people to help her. The hours of her business are from 7 am to 5 pm every day except Sunday.  

Marceline has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more bricks to sell. Marceline will reinvest the profit in her business and save money for her family.

loans.use: to fabricate more bricks to sell.

loans.name: Bertha Amalia

texts.es:
Bertha es socia del  Banco Comunal “Virgen de la Asunción”, ubicado en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos.  Cuenta con educación primaria.
Desde hace tres años trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  su primer préstamo  fue por la suma  de  S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, dinero que invirtió en su negocio de venta de prendas de vestir, también se dedica a la venta de motos, accesorios, verduras, frutas, los vende en las ferias de la localidad.
Bertha solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/ 3000.00 nuevo soles, con el cual comprará dos motos para luego venderlas en Desaguadero, Ilave y en Yunguyo.  En el negocio trabaja sola y a veces le ayuda una señora.
Su sueño es seguir con  el negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la reunión con las socias y la facilidad del préstamo.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de La Asunción” which is located in the District and Province of Yunguyo, Department of Puno. She is 39 years old and a single mother with three children. Bertha has an elementary school education.

She has worked with Manuela Ramos for three years. Her first loan was in the amount of 500 PEN and the money was invested in her business of selling clothes. She also sells motorcycles, accessories, vegetables, and fruits at the fairs in her town.

Bertha is requesting a new loan of 3000 PEN so that she can buy two motorcycles to sell later in Desaguadero, Ilave, or Yunguyo. She works alone in business, but occasionally she receives help from another woman.

Her dream is to continue with her business and improve her income. What she likes about the Communal Bank are the meetings with the other members and the convenience of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase two motorcycles for resale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony  is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Anthony  has a shop that sells dried fish of different types. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy stock of dried fish.

Anthony  is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Anthony  hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en:
Ly is a 59-year-old fisherman who is a widow with seven children. He lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia. Three of his children are married and live separately, another two are single and live with him, and the youngest two attend school. One of Ly’s sons helps generate income by running a motor taxi and one of his daughters sells vegetables and earns about 3 USD daily selling her produce in the local market. 

Ly is always considering how to create more income to support his family. He is requesting a loan to invest in his daughter’s business. The increased income will help improve his family’s standard of living.

loans.use: to invest in his daughter's business

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a single mother of six children: two boys and four girls. She lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, electricity and clothing.

For the past 15 years, she has operated a tailoring business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors in the area. Rehema dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase a sewing machine. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel de 56 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 57 años y sus 3 hijas las cuales se encuentran estudiando. Daniel se dedica  a la venta sorbetes y minutas en los alrededores de la zona donde el habita. Ha logrado establecer una buena clientela los cuales lo prefieren por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable e higiénico. Daniel desea poder dar a sus hijos el estudio y algún día poder verlos convertidos en profesionales con mejores oportunidades de vida. Esto es lo que impulsa a Daniel a trabajar duramente para poder lograr su sueño y poder dar a su familia lo mejor posible. Ha decidido hacer este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de la materia prima necesaria para la elaboración de minutas como: agua, jarabes, limones, chile, sal, desechables y variedad de paletas de tal modo que su negocio mejore y por consecuencia su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Daniel is 56 years old and lives in his own house with his family, which consists of his 57 year-old wife and three daughters who are studying.  Daniel sells sorbets and shaved ice snacks around the area where he lives.  He has established good clientele who prefer him for being a hardworking, responsible, and hygienic man.  Daniel hopes to be able to give his children an education and one day see them become professionals with better opportunities in life.  This is what drives Daniel to work hard to achieve his dream and give his family the best.  He has decided to request this loan with INTEGRAL to invest in his business and buy the raw materials necessary for the preparation of shaved ice snacks including water, syrups, lemons, chiles, salt, disposable cups and a variety of popsicles, so that his business improves and as a result, so does the quality of life for himself and his family.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials necessary for the preparation of shaved ice snacks including water, syrups, lemons, chiles, salt, disposable cups and a variety of popsicles.

loans.name: Sokhea

texts.en:
Sokhea (pictured here) and her husband, Than, live in a suburb approximately twenty-five kilometers from Phnom Penh City. The couple has been married for almost ten years and have three children: a son and two daughters. All of the children are in school. 

Sokhea used to be a garment worker, but now she is a tailor. Her husband is a soldier. She is requesting her second loan of 1,000 USD to buy another kind of sewing machine and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.use: To buy another kind of sewing machine and fabric for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Anweri

texts.en:
Anweri has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her husband’s corner juice business. He has a shop located in the market through which he sells different fruit juices. His juices are very popular among his customers and he makes good profits every month. 

Anweri is a housewife and performs her household duties by staying at home. She has given birth to 5 children. Her 2 elder sons work with their father, while the others are getting their education.  

With this loan, Anweri's husband will buy more juicer machines and also fresh fruits to serve many more customers without waiting.  He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past 10 years. 

Anweri hopes that this investment will help her husband make more profits and her family will be able to live a better life as a result.  Anweri is a regular loan user of Asasah's and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting.

loans.use: buy juicer machines & fruits

loans.name: Juditha

texts.en:
Juditha is from Lusot, Baliangao, Mis. Occ., Philippines. She is 38 years of age and has three children. Her children are in school. Juditha has an agricultural business producing rice. After the harvest, she sells her rice to her general store. With this business, she earns a monthly return of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Juditha has been in this business for four years. She is requesting a loan amount of 7,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers for her rice farm. 

Juditha joined GDMPC in 2010 and is in her second loan cycle. She hopes to buy her own farm equipment, like a hand "truck-tor," so she won't have to rent anymore.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her rice farm

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es: El sr. Luis vive en la zona del plan 3000 en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus cuatro hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, el se dedica al transporte publico desde hace 10 años en su vehículo propio. Su esposa se dedica a la venta de sabanas y almohadas. El sr. Luis esta en su tercer crédito con la institución, su esposa también es cliente de emprender pero ella trabaja con bancos de emprendimiento donde ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material de construcción  para terminar de construir el piso de su domicilio. El sr. Luis es una persona responsable al igual que su esposa y con muchas ganas de superación, se siente agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Luis lives in the Plan 3000 zone in his own house with his wife and four children who are school age.  He has worked in public transportation for the last 10 years using his own vehicle.  His wife sells sheets and pillows.  Luis is in his third loan with the institution and his wife’s also an Emprender client but she works with communal banks where she’s demonstrated good payment behavior.  

The loan he’s requesting is to buy building materials and supplies to finish building the floor in his house.  Luis is a responsible person like his wife who very much wants to get ahead in life.  He is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies to finish installing flooring.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a hardworking businesswoman, age 32. She is married and blessed with two children, both of whom attend school. For the last three years, she has been rearing poultry to support her family. Lucy has been able to retain her business because of her good reputation with her customers. In the next five years, she wants to expand her business. She has requested a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy chicken. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, she has been able to improve her business with a previous loan.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Djibril

texts.fr:
DJIBRIL AGE 43 ANS HABITE DANS REGION DU SUD AU SENEGAL,MARIE AVEC 3 ENFANTS SONT TOUS A L'ECOLE , LES DEUX PLUS GRANDS SONT AUX COLLEGE ET LE PLUS A L'ECOLE PRIMAIRE.AVEC CE CREDIT ' IL ACHETE DES POUSSINS POUR RENFORCER SON POULAILLER.
DJIBRIL A TRAVAILLE DANS L'AVICULTURE DEPUIS SON ENFANCE CAR C'EST UN METIER QU'IL A TROUVE DANS LA FAMILLE AVANT SA NAISSANCE.DJIBRIL ACHETE DES POUSSINS A DAKAR ET LES NOURRIE PUIS REVENDRE A L'AGE 45 A 60 JOURS A 3500F OU 4000F A L'AGE DE 45 A 60 JOURS.AVEC L'AVICULTURE,DJIBRIL ASSURE TOUTES LES CHARGES DE LA FAMILLE
DJIBRIL DANS L'AVENIR , IL VEUT SON ACTIVITE , DIVERSIFIER SES PROJETS.
texts.en:
Djibril, aged 43, lives in the south of Sénégal.  He is married and has three children, all of whom attend school. The two older children are in middle school and the youngest is in primary school.  With his loan, he will buy chicks to add to his chicken coop.  

Djibril has raised poultry from childhood because his family has been doing this work since before he was born.  Djibril buys his chicks in Dakar, feeds them, then resells them when they are 45 to 60 days old for 3500 to 4000F.  With his poultry business, Djibril meets all the needs of his family.  

In the future, he would like to diversify his work.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Vladimir

texts.es: El señor Vladimir es una persona sola que se dedica al servicio de transporte trabajando en su propio vehículo de día y de noche  el señor trabaja duro para poder comprarse su casita o su lote de terreno para poder así tener un techo donde vivir en caso de que más adelante quiera formar una familia  y así no vivir en anticrético ni alquileres por la incomodidad de vivir así el a solicitado el crédito para poder comprar un tanque de gas y así bajar sus costos en relación al consumo de combustible ya que trabajar todo el día hace que se gaste más combustible es por este motivo que el quiere salir adelante en esta vida mejorando su calidad de vida y abaratando sus gastos ya que el gas es un combustible mas liviano y más barato.
texts.en: Vladimir is a single man.  He owns a car that he uses to operate a taxi service.  He's working day and night to pay for a small house that he wants in case he decides to have a family one day.  Without a house, he and any family that he has would have to live in an "anticretico" [a rental-purchase arrangement common in Bolivia] or a rented house.  He is applying for a loan to buy a large supply of gasoline, something that will allow him to reduce his fuel costs.  Gasoline prices are more expensive by the day, so buying a wholesale supply of gasoline will allow him to reduce his costs, increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy gasoline wholesale

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 60 years old and he is married. He takes care of four relatives. Joseph has four years' experience breeding cows. The hours of his business are from 8am to 2pm, daily. 

Joseph has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to expand his breeding by buying cows for resale. With profits from the loan, Joseph would like to satisfy his family's basic needs and start saving for his future.

loans.use: to expand his breeding by buying cows for resale.

loans.name: Sokhon

texts.en:
Sokhon and her husband are rice farmers. In addition, her husband also sells ice-cream when he is free from farming. They have been married since 1995 and have three sons. One is a garment worker and the others are attending school. 

Sokhon is requesting her first loan in the amount of $1,000 buy a motorcycle for her son, the garment worker, to get work.

In the photo, Sokhon is at home, not at the farm.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for her son to get work.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia nació en la provincia de Urubamba pero vive en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja. Este pueblo se localiza en el distrito de Urubamba, provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco, Perú. 

Sonia tiene 29 años edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de animales menores y a la venta de verduras y frutas, ella lleva a vender sus productos a la ciudad del Cusco y tiene un puesto de venta en unos mercados más populares de la misma ciudad. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que el trabajo. En esta oportunidad Sonia requiere el préstamo para comprar más verduras y frutas.  
 
Sonia es integrante del grupo “Los Girasoles de Rumichaca Baja” lo conforman 19 socios que viven en el poblado de Rumichaca Baja y donde realizan sus actividades económicas.
texts.en: Sonia was born in the province of Urubamba but lives in the village of Rumichaca Baja. This village is located in the district of Urubamba, Urubamba province and department of Cusco, Peru. Sonia is 29 years old, married and from this beautiful relationship has three children.  She raises small animals and sells vegetables and fruits in the city of Cusco and has a sales position in one of the popular markets in the same city. It is already several years working in this business and doing very well thanks to the work effort.  In this opportunity Sonia requires the loan to buy more vegetables and fruits.  Sonia is a member of the group "The Baja Rumichaca Sunflowers" which is made up of 19 members living in the town of Rumichaca Baja and where they conduct their economic activities.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: 060203-Tiền Phong-Hoằng Châu-Hoằng Hoá Group

texts.en:
Vang is 47 years old and married with two children.  She lives and works in Hoang Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province.   Vang is the leader of a 7-member group, the 030807-Tây Xuân Vi-Hoằng Thanh-Hoằng Hoá solidarity group.  She raises poultry and cattle, a business that she has been involved in for 10 years. The main hardship that Vang faces is the lack of business capital.   

In 2007, Vang joined Kiva partner the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) to improve her  business.   She has successfully repaid four previous loans.  Vang requests another loan to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.  In the future, Vang hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and to be able to buy more business supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to purchase poultry and cattle to raise.

loans.name: Rocio Elizabeth

texts.es: Roció Elizabeth de 47 años es divorciada tiene 4 hijos, trabaja en maquiladora como operadora en línea haciendo arneses para automóviles desde hace un año.  Esto con el fin de ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, aparte una de sus hijas que es la mayor aporta dinero para ayudarla con los gastos del hogar. Para Roció es muy importante tener su casa en buenas condiciones ya que es el patrimonio que les puede ofrecer a sus hijos. La casa es de interés social y ya hace varios años que no le ha hecho mejoras por lo que en algunas de las paredes ya se ven manchadas por la humedad, por tal motivo quiere comprar pintura, brochas para pintarla y que se vea bien.
texts.en:
Roció Elizabeth is 47, divorced, and has four children. She has been working for a year in a maquiladora (assembly plant), as a line operator making automobile harnesses.

She does this with the aim of providing her children with a better quality of life. In addition, one of her daughters, who is the eldest, contributes money to help her with the household expenses. 

For Rocío, it is very important to have a house in good condition, because it is the legacy she can give her children. She lives in subsidized housing, and improvements have not been done for several years; so on some of the walls you can now see moisture stains. For this reason, she wants to buy paint and paintbrushes, so that she can paint it and have it look good.

loans.use: To buy painting supplies.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: In the photo above is Zainab, a small scale entrepreneur in the Eastern city of Kemema. Zainab was born in Kenema city 28 years ago. She is married to a businessman the couple has 3 children who are attending primary and secondary schools. Zainab has been a businesswoman for 7 years now. She sells jewelries, (such as chains, bracelets, necklaces, etc.) and cosmetics. Zainab has approached SMT, a partner of Kiva.org to apply for a loan of SLL6,000,000.00. With the help of this loan, she will be able to buy a large quantity of jewelries to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of jewelries to add to her current stock

loans.name: Basma

texts.en:
Basma is a 36 year old Lebanese young lady living with her husband and three children in an owned apartment in Mount Lebanon. 
In 1999, Basma opened a beauty salon next to her house. She has her own loyal clients in the area where she lives and also from other villages as they appreciate her professionalism and taste in work. In her salon, Basma provide her client's with all types of beauty related services which is contributing to her success.
Basma's husband has multiple sources of income in order to provide for his family. In fact, he works as in interior designer and also owns a grocery store next to his wife's salon. 
For the first time, Basma is asking for 2,827,840 Lebanese pounds loan from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She needs to buy new makeup products and a tattoo machine for her beauty salon. 
Basma and her husband both have a very good reputation in the area. Basma's ambition is to see her salon grow and is working hard to achieve that goal.

loans.use: to buy makeup and a tattoo machine for her beauty salon

loans.name: Blanca Olga

texts.en:
I am Blanca P., I have a local grocery store in which I sell soups, bread, sugar, drinks, chicken, and other products for daily need. I have the store for fourteen years, my clients ask me to sell meat; which would be profitable because in this area there are no butcher shops and my clients have to go all the way to the market. With my earnings I help care for my four children, who also help in the store.

Descripción del Negocio: Yo soy Blanca P., tengo una pulpería en la que vendo sopas caseras, pan, azúcar, refrescos, pollos y otros productos de consumo diario. Lo tengo desde hace 14 años, mis clientes me piden que venda carne; que seria rentable ya que en esta zona no hay carnicerías y tienen que ir hasta el mercado. Con las ganancias que obtengo ayudo a sostener a mis cuatro hijos los cuales también colaboran en el negocio.

loans.use: Buying Botelled refreshments, sausages, chicken, juices, milk, 				toilet paper, sugar, basic grains.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Mrs. Alice A., nicknamed Mrs. "Golden Juice," is a master of creating juice from a variety of fruits highly valued in her area. Born in 1970 in Lomé, she is married and has three (03) children. Her fruit juice business allows her to help her unemployed husband in meeting the needs of their large family. With the couple live their children, six (06) nephews and nieces, and cousins from both sides of the family. The fabrication of fruit juice is a very profitable business, but it necessitates lots of material and effort.

Currently, Mrs. Alice A. is asking for a loan of $700 to buy a new freezer and to increase the production of quality juice. The income from this business will allow her to take care of her family better and to attend to their socio-economic well-being.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame A. Alice, surnommée Madame « Jus d’or » est une maîtresse dans la concoction de jus de fruits de tout genre très apprécié dans sa localité. Née en 1970 à Lomé, elle est mariée et mère de trois (3) enfants. Son commerce de jus de fruits lui permet d’aider son époux désœuvré à subvenir aux besoins de leur grande famille. Avec le couple, vivent leurs enfants, six (06) neveux et nièces et des cousins des deux familles. La fabrication de jus de fruits est une activité très rentable mais qui nécessite beaucoup de moyens et d’efforts.

Aujourd’hui, Madame A. Alice sollicite un crédit de $700 pour acheter un nouveau congélateur et augmenter sa production en jus de qualité. Le revenu de ce commerce lui permettra de mieux s’occuper de sa famille et de veiller à son bien-être socio-économique

loans.use: To buy a new freezer and to increase the production of good quality juice

loans.name: Manuel

texts.en:
Mr. Vélez provides services for the maintenance and repair of air conditioning units. He has been self-employed for 2 years, and has one employee helping him. "In the time I've been self-employed I have brought in a lot of new clients. Little by little I an buying the tools I need for my work, but there are expensive pieces of equipment that I have not yet been able to purchase. To buy them I need a loan of $1200".

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva Volunteer.

El Sr. Vélez presta los servicios para el mantenimiento y reparación del clima artificial, el lleva 2 años trabajando por su cuenta y le apoya una persona. "En el tiempo que llevo de autoempleado he generado una buena cantidad de clientes poco a poco voy comprando la herramienta necesaria para desempeñar mi labor pero hay equipos de costos mayores que no puedo adquirir, por eso necesito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls".

loans.use: To buy equipment

loans.name: Loeung

texts.en: Mrs. Loeung N. is 29 years old and lives in Siem Reap with her husband and their 2 young children.  They earn a living by painting cars, and they can typically earn about $6/day in this business.  Loeung N. is seeking this loan so that she can buy more paint in order to increase her business.  She would like to keep expanding this business, possibly by hiring one more staff.  She also hopes that she can support her children's education until they are old enough to get jobs.

loans.use: Buying paint for her business

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir V. is 30-year-old father of three children.  He lives with his family in Bilasuvar, the southern part of Azerbaijan. He is internally displaced person form Nagorniy Karabakh who fled to Bilasuvar during Azerbaijani-Armenian conflict.  Zakir has seven year experience in animal breeding.  He started his small business borrowing money form his friends. He purchased one milky cow. When his livestock brought him income he returned the debts and purchased one calf. He sells milk and yogurt to local people, this is his income. Children grow up and covering family needs become harder and harder, so Zakir, applied for 1200 USD to purchase one additional milky cow and a calf.

loans.use: Going to purchase one cow and one calf

loans.name: Teresa

texts.pt:
Teresa is a widow and she works for a private insurance business. She started the loan program after her husband died in 2005. She has 5 children in school. Teresa wants to use the loan money to buy some home electronics/appliances. She has a small business selling vegetables. If all goes well, she hopes to diversify her business to earn more profit and be able to repair her home once she buys some small appliances with this loan.

Translated by Bianca Vargas, Kiva Volunteer.

Teresa e vivuva e trabalha para uma Empresa Privada de Seguranca como Vigilante.Entrou para o Programa desde que o marido morreu em 2005.Ela tem 5 filhos e todos estao a estudar.Teresa quer usar o dinheiro para comprar alguns electrodomesticos para a sua casa.Ela faz um pequenos negocio da venda de verduras. Se tudo correr bem pensa diversificar um pouco o seu negocio para poder ter mais rendimentos para reabilitar a sua residencia uma vez que desta vez vai comprar electrodomesticos.

loans.use: To buy home electronics.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is 40 years old and married with 3 children. The family lives in Benin City.

Dorcas' business deals in foodstuffs and other provisions. She is asking for a loan of $475 to enable her to improve her business. Dorcas learnt the business for 3 months and then opened her own 1996.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and foodstuffs for sale

loans.name: Claudia Mercedes

texts.es:
Mrs. Rodríguez’ business is selling food; she prepares it in her home very early, and then proceeds to sell it in the market. To conduct her business, she buys her ingredients on credit, and pays for them weekly; whenever she has the opportunity, she buys them in cash.

Claudia has 20 years of experience in her business, beginning with a C$1000 loan from a moneylender.

She began her business with her grandmother; they had many difficulties as they sold the food in the doorway of their home on a large wooden table. Later, they decided to sell their food through the streets, carrying all their heavy belongings with them so that they could improve their economic situation.

Ceprodel has brought them financial support for a year and a half with 17 requested credits. These credits have been very useful for the business, and there has been a growth in demand for her food. She is now able to meet her needs by buying ingredients for her food, and she has also been able to attain a sales stand in the dining area of the central market.

It’s important to highlight that Mrs. Claudia Rodríguez is a single mother and has two infant children that she must support.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

El negocio de la Sra. Rodríguez es la venta de comida la cual la prepara muy temprano en su casa para después proceder a su venta en el mercado. Para poder realizar este negocio, ella compra productos (ingredientes) al crédito pagándolos a la semana y cuando tiene la oportunidad, realiza su compra de contado.

La Sra. Claudia tiene 20 años de tener su e inicio con C$1.000.00 producto del préstamo que realizó a un prestamista.

El negocio inició con su abuela con grandes dificultades ya que ofrecía comida en la puerta de su casa en una mesita de madera y luego decidieron comenzar a vender los alimentos en las calles, cargando con todos los pesados enseres y todo esto para poder salir adelante en su situación económica.

Ceprodel le brindó apoyo por medio de financiamiento por año y medio con 17 créditos otorgados siendo el impacto que han tenido estos créditos de mucha utilidad para su negocio por lo que ha habido un crecimiento en la demanda en su comida ya que ha podido suplir sus necesidades en la compra de los ingredientes de la comida y a la vez ha podido alcanzar un puesto de venta en el sector de las comiderías del mercado central.

Es de mucha importancia destacar que la señora Claudia Rodríguez es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos en la etapa de infancia a los que tiene que mantener.

loans.use: Purchase of goods and materials for a restaurant

loans.name: Kouamivi

texts.fr:
Born in 1963 in Assomé in the Zio region, Mr L. Kouamivi is married and takes care of four children. He completed his primary education and then continued his education with a masonry apprenticeship. Without a job, he travelled to Nigeria to find work. Having returned to his country, he would like to buy a motor bike for transportation. His wife resells various products, but earns little income to help with the family's needs. Dynamic and honest, he works very hard in order to meet the needs of his family. He is asking for a loan of $1000 which will enable him to buy a motor bike for transport, which will in turn help him earn more money and take better care of himself and his family.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva Translator

Né en 1963 à Assomé dans la préfecture du Zio, Monsieur L. Kouamivi est marié et a en charge quatre enfants. Il a fait les études primaires, avant de suivre une formation en maçonnerie. Ne trouvant pas de marché, il a voyagé sur Nigeria pour exercer son métier. De retour dans son pays, il souhaite acquérir des motos pour le transport. Sa femme revendeuse de produits divers, gagne très peu pour l’aider dans les charges de la famille. Dynamique et de bonne moralité, il fait beaucoup d’effort pour subvenir aux besoins de la famille. Pour permettre à la famille de subvenir à leurs besoins, il sollicite un crédit de $1000 qui va lui permettre d’acheter une moto pour le transport. Il pourra ainsi avoir plus de revenu et s’occuper plus de lui-même et de sa famille.

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle for transport

loans.name: Reina

texts.en: Reina G. is a 47-year-old mother who is married to Miguel Aquino. Reina and Miguel have four children who are all in elementary school. Reina and Miguel are traveling merchants who prepare foods (e.g., they bake empanadas and other Paraguayan delicacies) and sell them to their loyal and dedicated customers. Reina and Miguel work extremely hard to meet their family's needs and to constantly improve upon their standard of living; in fact, with their current income, the family is both strong and happy. They are seeking a loan to purchase additional bags, which will be used to store their food before they can sell the food to their customers. If their business continues to prosper, they would like to construct their own house.

loans.use: To buy bags for food storage

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is a living example of a hard-working woman with the desire to better herself. Actually, in spite of her blindness, Juana has been able to become a great entrepreneur and currently she has one of the most well-established mini-markets in the Río Arriba community of Baní. Each day, thousands of people visit her mini market to purchase goods such as vegetables, milk, beer, rice, and the like. A brother of hers helps her to attend to the customers.

Juana is still single and lives with Mom. She explains that the business helps her support herself and her mother. “This business is my sustenance," she says.

With her loan, Juana plans to buy another freezer to keep beverages cold. She’ll also buy other supplies for her market. The entrepreneur says that she’d like to see her business grow to the point where she can buy a new locale, and "turn the mini-market into a Big Store with millions of products".

loans.use: Purchase of products for her little grocery store

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is 33 years old, married, and has three children. Her children are 15, 8, and 4 years old. Aisha owns a small salon and a shop where she sells juice, which she began in 2006. Everyday, she works from 8 AM and closes at 6 PM, and earns a monthly profit or around $250 from her sales.

Aisha now hopes for a loan to purchase more salon items and materials to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more salon items,juice and shop items for her buseness.

loans.name: Mahsuda

texts.en: A. Mahsuda is 56 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband is currently unemployed and her business is the main source of income for her family. Mahsuda has been running her business for twelve years. She is selling fabrics for the national dresses. Her daughter helps her with the business. The national dresses in Tajikistan are a very popular and important item of the dowry of any girl. Mahsuda has her trading place in the central local market of Gafurov city. Being very polite with her clients and having good taste, Mahsuda has many customers. All the fabrics are supplied from the neighboring city, Istaravshan. Mahsuda is trying to have wide range of goods in order to able to meet the requirements of her customers. Mahsuda requests a loan of $800 dollars for the purpose of purchasing a new stock of fabrics for the summer season. She promises to repay the loan within 6 months. Your support will really help her. Be an important part of the growth of Mahsuda’s business.

loans.use: Purchasing of new fabrics

loans.name: Ishmanayamba Group

texts.en:
Finna T. is the group leader of Ishmanayamba and one of the first Kiva clients in Sierra Leone. She is thirty-eight years old, married and with four children. Her business is the main source of income for the family. Finna sells palm oil and other food items. She would like to purchase 60 gallons of palm oil to increase her inventory and income.

Mohamed and Tury both own kiosks in the same town and would like to expand their businesses, too. The group is therefore requesting a loan of Le.1,800,000 ($US625).

loans.use: Purchase palm oil and inventory for general store.

loans.name: Adjowa

texts.fr:
Born in Attitogon in 1974, Adjowa A. is married and the mother of eight children. Adjowa engages in the production of gari, a West African food made from cassava tubers, and it is through this venture that she is able to support those in her care. Having noted the considerable demand in the marketplace, she sought this avenue to request a loan to purchase cassava to be processed and ground into flour. After its sale she will repay her loan and direct whatever is left over to the needs of her family.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Née à Attitogon en 1974, Madame A. Adjowa est mariée et mère de huit enfants, A. Adjowa exerce une activité principale : la production du gari. C’est d’ailleurs de cette activité qu’elle arrive à supporter les personnes à sa charge. Ayant remarqué, que la demande est devenue importante sur le marché, elle a voulu passer par ce canal pour solliciter ce crédit afin de s’acheter de manioc qu’elle transformera en farine. Après, vente, elle remboursera son crédit et orientera le reste aux besoins familiaux.

loans.use: Purchase of cassava to make into gari

loans.name: Akuété

texts.fr:
Monsieur A. Akuété Lazare est né en 1977 à Logodomé dans la préfecture de Vo. Marié et père de trois enfants, il mène comme activité génératrice de revenu, l’agriculture et l’élevage.

Il est également un meunier. Il faut dire que Monsieur A. est très dynamique et plein d’initiatives. Ayant trouvé que le porc est un animal dont l’élevage génère beaucoup de revenu dans son milieu, il sollicite un crédit pour en acheter et élever.

 La réalisation de ce projet lui permettra d’améliorer son revenu et les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akuété Lazare A. was born in 1977 in Logodomé (Vo Prefecture). Married and the father of three children, he works in the areas of agriculture and livestock to earn an income. He is also a cabinet-maker. It should be said that Mr. A. is very energetic and full of initiative. Having found that raising pigs generates a lot of income in his area, he is requesting a loan to buy some and raise them. Realizing this project will enable him to improve his income and the living conditions of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and raise pigs

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok R. is a villager in Chi Chrap Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who faces a problem because her rice field now is infertile soil; thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizers to support the rice to produce a better crop. Her husband, Mr. Yi Sam Art, helps her in the rice field. Mrs. Sok R. is 38 years old and the mother of two children one of whom is employed in a garment factoR. while the other is attending school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Delidia

texts.es:
La señora Delidia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de Rosario”, vive en la región y provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui. Se dedica  a la crianza  de  aves de corral, entre ellos pavos, gallinas, patos en la huerta de su casa y lo vende en el mercado central de la cuidad a las amas de casa y dueños de restaurantes.

Con este crédito de S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  gallinas, patos, pavos, alimento balanceado para criar sus aves, así como vacunas para prevenir las enfermedades y así mantenerlos en buen estado para tener buenas ventas, obtener mejores ganancias y que sus clientes queden satisfechos.

La señora Delidia tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposo y sus 04 hijos. Es una mujer responsable y sobre todo preocupada por la educación de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Delidia belongs to the Our Lady of the Rosary Communal Bank and lives in the region and province of Mariscal Caceres in the district of Juanjui. She raises poultry, including turkeys, chickens, and ducks in her garden and sells them at the city's central market to housewives and restaurant owners. With this $500 loan, which she will repay in six months, she will buy chickens, ducks, turkeys, balanced feed to raise her poultry, as well as vaccinations to prevent illness and maintain their health for good sales, better earnings, and client satisfaction. Delidia is 35 years old, lives with her husband and her four children. She is a responsible woman and above all worried about her children's education.

Translated from Spanish by Amani Roland, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens, ducks, turkeys, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Maida

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 34-year-old Maida M. from Mwanza. She is married with two children, ages five and 14. Maida has been running a household products stand since 2006. Vendors that sell household products in Tanzania either sell them on a blanket on the street or in a store. The items they sell vary from ladles to dishwashing racks to soap. She works at the business for nine hours per day, six days per week and is assisted by her husband. Maida currently earns about 150 USD from her business. She is requesting a loan of 325 USD in order to buy more stock in bulk in order to resell them. Maida thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of household items in bulk

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en: Augusta O. is 44 years old and married with 5 children. Augusta sells woods to people building houses. She needs the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more woods to sell to her customers. She says thanks to all that make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more woods to sell

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es:
La señorita  Zoila es socia del Banco Comunal “Virgen D. Cancharani” D. la provincia D. Puno, en el departamento D. Puno. Tiene 57 años D. edad, es soltera y madre D. 5 hijos. Con su primer préstamo D. S/. 300 compró golosinas para venderlas. Tiene casi 7 años  trabajando con el banco. Nos cuenta que vive con 2 hijos actualmente y a parte D. vender golosina venD. quesanas.
Con este préstamo D. S/.2000 que pagará en 6 cuotas comprará productos D. campaña naviD.ña.
Zoila desea continuar trabajando para tener una tienda D. ropa.
texts.en:
Ms. Zoila is a member of the “Virgen D. Cancharani” microfinance institute in the province and department of Puno. She is a 57-year-old single mother with 5 children. With her first loan of 300.00 PEN, she purchased candy for resale. She has been working with the microfinance institute for almost 7 years. She states that she currently lives with two of her children. AsiD. from selling candy, she also sells bulrush mats.

With this 2,000.00 PEN loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will purchase seasonal items.

Zoila hopes to continue working so that she can open up her own clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase holiday items

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel C. es padre de familia, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos que están estudiando.
El está solicitando un préstamo porque tiene un problema de salud, en su trabajo tuvo un accidente y se lastimó la cintura, debido a esto tiene que realizarse unos análisis médicos y comprar un medicamento que le recetaron, el cual es muy costoso. Por el momento no cuenta con el capital necesario para poder solventar estos gastos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Ángel C. lives with his wife and two children, who are attending school. He is requesting a loan because he has a health problem; at work he had an accident and injured his lower back. The loan will be used to pay for medical care and medications that he is prescribed. At this time, he does not have the money to cover these expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Jordan Shanker, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Medical expenses

loans.name: Oikhol

texts.en:
Y. Oikhol is a farmer and believes that working in fields brings her a lot of satisfaction. For more than three years, she and her husband have been living off of their agricultural profits and efforts. Yakuboya currently grows a wide range of vegetables, including carrot, potato, and tomato which she sells to earn a stable income. Yakuboya works hard in order to provide her children with the necessary education they need to survive. She believes that her children’s future and success is critical in achieving their dreams.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing farming tools and fertilizer to increase profits

loans.name: Sara Miguelina

texts.es:
R. R. SARA MIGUELINA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Almendras” con domicilio en el Jr. Manco Capac N° 270 del distrito de Calería, tiene 63 años, 01 hijo, y su cónyuge tiene trabajo eventual independiente.

El primer préstamo fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con el que inició un trabajo en cuero, tales como carteras, sandalias, zapatos, y otros a pedido del cliente.

El préstamo que recibirá e de S/.1500. Nuevos Soles, con el que le servirá para refaccionar unos cuartos, dándole el acabado y seguridad respectiva para alquilarlos, por lo que invertirá en cemento, arena fina, chapas y cerrojos. Además piensa implementarse con gaseosas, galletas y golosinas para los inquilinos y transeúntes.

Muy agradecida comenta que Manuela Ramos es un buen programa que saca de muchos apuros a las mujeres de Ucayali, dándoles la oportunidad de emprender un negocio.
texts.en:
Sara Miguelina R. R. is a member of the "Las Almendras" community bank. She lives on Jr. Manco Capac in the district of Calería. She is 63 years old, has one son and her spouse has his own independent source of income. Her first loan for S/.300 soles was used to start a leather business making items such as wallets, sandals, shoes and such at the request of her customers. This loan for S/.1,500 soles will be used to refurbish some rooms to give them the finish and security to be able to rent them. She will buy cement, fine sand, finger plates and bolts. She is also thinking of stocking up on soft drinks, cookies and candies for the tenants and passersby. She is very grateful and mentions that Manuela Ramos is a good programme which gets a lot of the women of Ucayali out of trouble, giving them the opportunity to open a business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To refurbish some rooms; she will invest in cement, fine sand, finger plates and bolts.  She will set herself up with soft drinks and cookies for the tenants

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is a 38-year-old married woman with two children. She sells palm oil, both wholesale and retail, to her customers, and has been in this business for a long time.

Mary is requesting a loan of 70 000 NGN to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thank you to everyone who makes this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional oil, fish and other foodstuffs for cooking and selling

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery es una joven de 23 años, muy trabajadora y decidida, vive en la casa que le cedieron  sus padres y espera con su trabajo poder salir adelante. Su puesto de artesanías está ubicado en el mercado San José (mercado Importante de la ciudad de Juliaca), el cual es muy concurrido debido a los modelos llamativos y novedosos que teje, ella siempre recibe a sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son turistas, con una sonrisa y les muestra muy amablemente las artesanías que vende. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer, ya que desde muy niña tuvo mucha pasión por realizar este arte. Lleva 5 años en este trabajo y lo más difícil es trasladar las artesanías desde su taller hasta su puesto, debido a que son muchos los fardos que lleva. Para el futuro, espera tener una tienda más grande donde pueda vender con mayor tranquilidad sus prendas. Este es el segundo préstamo de Mery con MFP y al igual como hizo con su primer préstamo, está dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es muy responsable, ya que siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en el grupo. Con los 1000 soles comprará más lana para incrementar la cantidad de prendas que teje y aumentar el stock de su puesto.
texts.en:
Mery is a 23 year old young woman who is very hard working and dedicated. She lives in the house that she inherited from her parents and hopes to be able to get ahead with her work. Her craft stand is located in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca), which is very busy due to the attractive and original models that she weaves. She always receives her clients, who are primarily tourists, with a smile and she very happily shows them the crafts that she sells. What she likes most about her work is to weave as since she was a young girl she has had a lot of passion for this art. She has been doing this work for 5 years and the most difficult part is to transport her crafts from her workshop to her stand as there are many bundles that she brings. In the future she hopes to have a larger store where she can sell her items with greater ease. This is Mery's second loan with MFP and like she did with her first loan she is prepared to make all of her payments on time. In her communal bank she is very responsible as she is always up to date on the agreements at which the group arrives. With the 1000 soles she will buy more wool to increase the quantity of items that she weaves and increase her stand's stock.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. has 1-hectare rice farm. She is 34 years old, widowed with no children. She would like to grow her farm. She dreams of buying another farm as well as farming equipment someday. Her husband, Albino, is already dead. She has been managing her rice farm closely monitored to achieve her expected harvest.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase Ammonium sulfate, complete fertilizers, and herbicides. The loan will also help to start a new business.

CEVI helps people to start up and run their businesses. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase Ammonium sulfate, complete fertilizers, and herbicides

loans.name: Ndaté

texts.fr: Ndaté K. est âgée de 46 ans, mariée et à en charge 10 enfants. Elle vend des tissus teintés et en meme temps fait un commerce d’huile de palme. Ce prêt lui permettra de maintenir cette activité et d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ndaté K., 46, is married and raising 10 children. She sells dyed cloth and at the same time sells palm oil. This loan will permit her to keep this business going and improve living conditions for her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase and resale of dyed cloth

loans.name: Rotini

texts.en: Rotini L., 28, is married with 3 children.  She has one year of experience in the canteen business.  She provides services to the public 6 days per week.  Rotini has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  Rotini expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Rotini’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase snack foods, sweets and chips.

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa is a 22-year-old single man living with his parents. He has been working in computer maintenance since 2004 with a previous eight years of experience in the field. He is cooperating with his brothers to satisfy the needs of the household. Today, Mostafa is requesting to borrow $1,000 to buy tools that will help him develop his work.

loans.use: To buy tools that will help him develop his work

loans.name: Najeba Group

texts.en: Najeba is the leader of Najeba Group. There are three members in this group. Each of them wants to take a loan for expanding their businesses. Najeba wants to take a loan for her husband who has a metal working shop. Malali wants to take a loan for an embroidery business. Manizha wants to take a loan for a tailoring business. They are requesting a group of loan 38,000 AFN. And they are very happy for AFS and Kiva lenders who can support the world.

loans.use: To expand a metal working shop, embroidery business and tailoring business

loans.name: Ganesh Maiya

texts.en:
Ganesh Maiya R. opened her gift shop three years ago in the town of Tangal to improve the living standards of her family. She sells various types of gifts and decorative items in her shop. 

In Nepal, the demand for gift items is increasing constantly because Nepal is very rich in its festivals. So, to meet the demands of the customers, Mrs. Ganesh Maiya R. is requesting a Rs 30,000.00 loan to buy various types of gift items for her shop.

Ganesh Maiya R. lives in a nuclear family with her two children. Her husband, Mr. Santa Krishna R., died a few years ago. Now she has sole responsibility for her two children. Her daughter works in a local office and her son left his education and has no work.

loans.use: to buy gift items for her shop

loans.name: Jose Hernan

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Hernan N. M. tiene 38 años de edad, el radica en la colonia Buena Vista desde hace 14 años. vive en union libre con la señora Brenda Ebelia Pavon Fuentes con quien ha tenido 04 hijos,  los cuales estan en el colegio.
su compañera se dedica a su hogar y cuidar de sus hijos. 
Jose trabaja vendiendo materiales para la construccion, labor con la cual trae el sustento a su familia, el tiene su propia volqueta y necesita el prestamo para comprar materiales y almacenarlos ya que en estos tiempos de lluvia es dificil sacar el material por el monton de lodo que se hace a las orillas de los rios.
texts.en:
Mr. Jose Hernan N. M. is a 38-year-old man who has been living in the Buena Vista housing development for 14 years. He lives with his common-law spouse, Ms. Brenda Ebelia Pavon Fuentes, and their 4 school age children.

His partner is a homemaker, so she looks after the children.

Jose sells construction supplies for a living. This job is his family’s source of income. He has his own dump truck, but he needs this loan in order to purchase building materials and store them as it is difficult to extract those materials during the rainy season because of all the mud along the riverbanks.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase sand, rocks and gravel

loans.name: Nhoeb

texts.en: S., 37, had married to Jame, 48, who is a local farmer. She always helps her husband farming rice and planting rice besides her work. S. is good at making bamboo baskets for the market. She and her husband take sometimes through the village seeking for bamboos and take them home and then put them into water for almost a week after that dry them under the sunshine three days. They split the bamboos into smaller pieces after that her husband and her start making them to basket. Recently, S. is taking a loan to invest in her handicap business. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: to invest in her handicap business.

loans.name: Mengmahmat

texts.en:
B. Mengmahmat, age 49, is married with five children. Mengmahmat is a farmer. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. Thanks to his savings, he has been able to arrange for the marriage of his elder son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house.

With this loan, Mengmahmat would like to expand his irrigation system, which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Mengmahmat’s income and his family's living standards.

Mengmahmat and his family appreciate your support in helping him improve his business.

More about Tajikistan

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and being the location of the end of the rule of Alexander the Great. It is also known for its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi, and many others. The country, filled with epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, and boasts a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only 7 percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, fuels, and lubricants.

loans.name: Victorine
