What he needs now is to improve on the standard of his work and also be able to cater for all these customers. He needs to buy the necessary equipments and this is the reason why he is requesting for a loan. The number of people who require his services have also increased. This is because his only competitors got their houses demolished after their landlord selling off the land where they were operating.

Ismeal lives in Bukoto, this is the next place to Ntinda where Life in Africa is situated. He has a wife and two children living with him. He joined life in Africa in october 2005, as a trainee internet4change Uganda. He got ajob with invisible children as a bracelet maker in Febuary 2006. Before he was doing this work but since he got another job as mentioned above, his cousin will help him do the laundry work. He has already saved 100,000/= for detergents and some few things he may need to add. He will also pay his cousin 30,000/= per month for helping him. He is requesting a loan of 700,000/= payable in 12 months. He will be paying 70,000/= per month.

Below is his budget:

  • Washing Machine 500,000/=
  • Counter Board 80,000/=
  • Ironing Board 30,000/=
  • Flat iron 30,000/=
  • Polythen Covers/coat covers (12) 6,000/=
  • Metallic Hangers (12) 5,000/=
  • Installation of machine and Labour 50,000/=
  • Total 701,000/=

Ismael's loan has been reviewed and guaranteed by his community of peers at the Life in Africa WE Center in Kampala. He has designated the 25% community impact portion of the interest he pays on this loan to support LiA's Internet4Change Team. For more about Ismael, his life and his world view, visit him online at http://lifeinafrica.com/4/lubingaismael

loans.use: Buying washing machine

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has 4 years of experience in book sales. Previously she worked selling clothes and accessories. With that work she was able to support her children on her own: she separated from her husband 16 years ago. She began selling books on her own initiative and with the encouragement of her daughter. She works from Monday to Friday, 9 am to 1 pm and 3 pm to 5 pm en her home, where libraries and schools come to pick up the books they need.

Maria wants the loan in order to invest it in the business, since the school year starts in 2 months and she wants to have the products already bought, to ensure delivery and provide better service to her clients.

Maria is 55 years old. She has 3 children, 2 of whom live with her and help her in the business. She hopes to be able to expand her business with another line of books she is unable to buy at the moment, for lack of capital.

Translated by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Maria tiene una experiencia de 4 años en la venta de libros. Anterior a esto ella se dedicaba a vender ropa y bisutería con el que logro mantener a sus hijos ella sola ya que es separada de su esposo hace 16 años. Comenzaron con la venta de libro por iniciativa propia y de una hija la que le motivo a vender dicho producto. Esta labor la viene realizando de lunes a viernes en horario de 9 a.m. a 1 p.m. y de 3 a 5 p.m. en su domicilio donde recogen los pedidos de los libros que necesitan las librerías o las escuelas. Maria desea el crédito para invertir en el negocio ya que de aquí a 2 meses comienza la temporada escolar y ella desea tener el producto ya comprado y no demorarse en las entregas y con ello darle un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Maria tiene 55 años, tiene tres hijas dos de las cuales viven con ella y son las que le ayudan en el negocio. Espera poder también surtir su negocio con otra clase de libros que al momento no cuenta para la venta por falta de capital.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Invest in books in material to sell before the upcoming school year

loans.name: Umar

texts.en: Umar has 18 years of experience in trade. He buys his goods from Khujand, 30 minutes away from his town. When he started working in sales, he worked in a state-owned store. About 15 years ago he lost his job, but by that time he had developed good skills in trade. He started the business by buying milk products from farmers and selling them at the market. Over time he studied customer demand and modified his product line accordingly. Most of the goods he sells are perishable. He would use his loan to buy an additional refrigerator for them.

loans.use: Purchase of refrigerator

loans.name: Abdul Wasah

texts.en: Abdul Wasah lives in district 4 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He lives with his wife whom he married last year. He wants to advance his life successfully. He is a tailor and he wants to enlarge his shop and buy extra materials so he wants to take an individual loan to buy sewing machines and  change the design of his shop to attract more clients and make a better future for his family. He would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Monday

texts.en: Mr. Monday N. is 38 years, and old happily married with 3 children.  He is a farmer and he learned the act of farming from his father.  He specializes in the production of cassava, plantains and yams.  He is requesting the above funds for the production and maintainance of his farm.

loans.use:
To buy more suckers for planting & farm maintenance 
farm

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
Ana María is married and has one child. Her husband is a bricklayer, and as his salary is quite low for keeping a household, she decided to start her own business in order to help with costs of the house and family. She began her business about a year ago, starting her sales out of her home and later, as she grew, selling in various markets around the city. This used-clothing business has helped increase her income, and she wishes to continue with her trade and keep it growing.

Ana María is requesting a loan for $275 to purchase merchandise for her business, especially seasonal clothing, to increase sales. She is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family are very grateful for the support that you give them to move ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Ana María esta casada y tiene 1 hijo, su esposo trabaja como albañil, y el sueldo que percibe es muy bajo para la manutención del hogar, fue por esto que ella decidió poner su propio negocio con la finalidad de ayudar con los gastos de la casa y mantener a su hijo. Ella empezó con su negocio hace un año aproximadamente, iniciando sus ventas en las afueras de su domicilio y luego conforme fue creciendo empezó a vender en diferentes mercados rodantes de su ciudad. Este negocio de venta de ropa usada por pacas la ha ayudado a mejorar sus ingresos y ella desea continuar con su negocio y seguir creciendo con el mismo.

Ana María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 275 para comprar mercadería para su negocio, especialmente ropa de temporada para incrementar sus ventas, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que les das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Purchase used seasonal clothing

loans.name: Fadia

texts.en: Fadia is a 35 year old mother of three children. She owns a grocery shop and grows fruits and vegetables. Fadia has two sources of income: her shop and her agriculture. Fadia first started with A. Majmoua through the group loan and then shifted to individuA. loans. The loan she needs is to purchase merchandise for the grocery shop and to start growing a green bean crop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for the grocery shop

loans.name: Juana Jamileth

texts.es:
Mrs. Jamileth T. works selling clothes, sandals, and other wearable things like simple articles and earrings that are not fancy. Mrs. T. has been in this business for 20 years, starting with a sum of C$500.00 from her own savings.

She started her business selling out in the open, carrying her products in a small basket. Then she moved to a cardboard stand, and right now she is located in the eastern side, on the outside of the central market.

Ceprodel has offered her financial support for a period of a year and a half with a total of 10 loans that have allowed her to increase the volume and variety of merchandise she carries, and to support her children whom she has been able to offer a decent life thanks to the income generated by this business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

La actividad de la señora Jamileth T. se refiere a la venta de ropa, sandalias y artículos de vestir como prendas sencillas y aretes que no son lujosos. La señora T. tiene 20 años de estar en el negocio comenzando a trabajar con un monto de C$500.00 producto de fondos propios que tenia ahorrados.

Inició el negocio vendiendo a la intemperie en una canastita pequeña, luego paso a una caseta de cartón y actualmente esta ubicada en la orilla Este del mercado central en uno de los tramos externos..

Ceprodel le ha brindado el apoyo financiero por un periodo de año y medio con un total de 10 créditos que le han impactado de manera que ha incrementado su mercadería de todo tipo y logrado la subsistencia para sus hijos que los esta formando gracias al negocio que le genera suficiente utilidad para poder vivir dignamente.

loans.use: Buying clothes (Adquisicion de la ropa)

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Born in 1969, Akoélé A. is married and the mother of seven. Making gari (cassava flour) is her primary business, and she sells second-hand clothing as well, in order to help with household obligations. To bolster her efforts, she is requesting a loan of $200 to buy more cassava and to increase her production. This would better satisfy market demand.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva volunteer.

Née en 1969, Madame A. Akoélé est mariée et mère de sept (7) enfants. La production du gari (farine de manioc) reste son activité principale et vend également des friperies afin de mieux contribuer aux charges du ménage. Pour consolider cette activité, elle sollicite un financement de $200 pour acheter plus de manioc et augmenter sa production afin de mieux satisfaire la demande du marché.

loans.use: To buy cassava

loans.name: Elda E.

texts.es:
Elda Guzman D. G. is 72 years old. She was only able to study up until second graD.. She lives in Cuyuchugo, in the Usquil province of Peru and has three children who are no longer dependent on her

Elda works selling clothing and items for the home such as plates, cups and silverware. She travels to Barro Negro where there is a market every weekend. From the time she was young, she worked raising and selling small animals in her neighborhood. Little by little, with the savings, she had the idea to begin selling clothing and itmes for the house. Her business has slowly grown.

Thanks to an invitation from her neighbors Elda became a part of the Communal bank San Juan D. Miraflores. With her first loan she invested in more animals such as guinea pigs and hens, which she raised, cared for and then sold. With this loan, which she will repay in 4 months, she will purchase more plates and cups and utensils to sell. Her dream is to one day have a small restaurant in her own house.

La señora Elda E. G. D. García tiene 72 años D. edad, estudió sólo hasta el segundo grado D. primaria. Tiene 3 hijos que ya no dependen D. ella. Vive en el caserío D. Cuyuchugo, provincia D. Usquil departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. ropa además D. yanques, sandalias y utensilios para el hogar tales como: platos, cucharas, tazas, sartenes, etc. Viaja al caserío D. Barro Negro en donD. hay negocio todos los fines D. semana, este lugar está ubicado en la provincia D. Julcán departamento D. La Libertad – Perú. DesD. que era joven se dedicaba a crianza y venta D. animales menores en su comunidad, poco a poco con sus ganancias tuvo la idea D. vender ropa, lentamente ha ido incrementando su mercadería y la ha variado conforme era necesario para vender sus productos. Gracias a la invitación que recibió D. sus vecinas ella integra el Banco Comunal “San Juan D. Miraflores” en su primer préstamo recibió S/. 300.00, el cual lo invirtió en comprar animales menores tales como: Cuyes y gallinas los que cría, cuida y posteriormente venD.. Con el préstamo D. S/.800.00, el cual pagara en 4 meses comprará una docena D. platos, cucharas, tazas, cucharones y ollas. La señora Elda sueña con poner una bodega en su casa.

loans.use: TO PURCHASE PLATES, CUPS, UTENSILS AND OTHER ITEMS TO SELL.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch S., 31, is a garment worker and raises pigs from her house in Chomkar Khpob Village in Kompong Cham Province. She earns up to $4 per day and has two children, both of whom are students. Her husband, Mr. Long Nhor, is a 37-year-old bricklayer who earns about $2.50 per day. In order to upgrade her pig-raising business, she now requests a $300 loan to buy three more pigs and to grow vegetable crops.

loans.use: To buy three more pigs and to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Uliya

texts.en:
Uliya is a single mother from Simferopol, Ukraine who supports herself with a business offering employment finding services. Employment agencies such as Uliya’s are good for both employers and employees, connecting those needing help with those looking for work. Uliya has a good location for her business near the center of town. She has gained many good contacts over the four years that she has been in business which helps her offer better services. Uliya has one daughter still at home who is seventeen. One of her goals is to help her daughter with her upcoming college expenses.

Uliya has requested a loan of 2500 Ukrainian Griven to purchase online advertising for her employment business. She has worked hard to establish a stable, profitable business. We are glad to be able to assist her with further expansion and success.

loans.use: Uliya would like to purchase online advertising for her employment agency services.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song O. is a fisherman who lives in Taream Village, Siem Reap Province. He has been fishing for four years in Tonle Sap Lake and earns about $2.66 per day. His wife, Mrs. ChO. Nun, 32, is a farmer and purchases rice to stock for resale. Nun can earn about $3 per day. They have one small child. Now O. is seeking a loan of $700 to purchase fishing tools to expand their fishing business. They hope this loan will help to improve their family’s income and living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fishing tools to expand their fishing business.

loans.name: Gretel Yanitza

texts.es:
Mrs. Gretel P. works at a market. She attends to the neighbors of the region of Chinandega. She is a lady who has fought to advance in life for many years.

Commited to the well-being of her two kids, she works very hard every day to improve her business and add more goods to her inventory. Because of this situation, she hopes to purchase more goods and be able to offer them to her clients and this way improve her way of life.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Peterson, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gretel P. se dedica al negocio de pulpería atendiéndola en su comunidad en Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega. Es una dama que por mucho tiempo ha luchado para salir adelante y para mejorar las condiciones de su negocio.

Comprometida con el bienestar de sus dos pequeños hijos, ella a diario se esfuerza para mejorar el negocio y adquirir mayores cantidades de productos para comercializarlos. Por esta situación es que busca el apoyo en Ceprodel para obtener el crédito con el cual comprar su mercadería para ofrecerla a sus clientes y así mejorar su condición.

loans.use: Purchase of goods

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora N. Quispe has a business of cosmetics and the sale of clothes. She sells them from her home and sometimes she does not have anyone with whom to leave her small daughter. She also has a place in an open air market in the neighborhood of Tembladerani . She has worked with our institution for almost a year. This client has a good history of fulfilling her credit obligations, and she is very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer.

LA SEÑORA FLORA N. QUISPE CUENTA CON EL NEGOCIO DE COSMETICOS Y VENTA DE ROPA SU MERCADERIA LA ADMINISTRA EN SU CASA YA QUE AVECES NO TIENE CON QUIEN DEJAR A SU PEQUEÑA HIJA, TIENE APARTE UN PUESTO AMBULANTE EN LA ZONA DE TEMBLADERANI Y TRABAJA CON NUESTRA INSTITUCIÓN CASI UN AÑO, ESTA CLIENTE TIENE UN BUEN HISTORIAL CREDITICIO DE CUMPLIMIENTO Y ES MUY RESPONSA

loans.use: To increase working capital

loans.name: Vonolia

texts.fr: Madame G. Vonolia  est née en 1948, mariée, est mère d’un (1) enfant. Elle fait preuve de son dynamisme par sa participation dans les charges du foyer. Bonne gestionnaire et maîtrisant bien son activité, elle sollicite un financement qui va lui permettre de renforcer son commerce de produits alimentaires divers. Par ceci, elle pourra augmenter ses revenus afin de contribuer davantage dans l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Madame Vonolia G. was born in 1948. She is married and the mother of one child. She demonstrates dynamism by helping meet the financial needs of her household. She is a skilled manager with her business well in hand, and is requesting subsidization to allow her to strengthen her food-selling business. In so doing, she will be able to increase her income, and thereby contribute more to the improvement of her family's living conditions.

Translated from French by Jonah Durning-Hammond, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Retail sales

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Mrs. Kong S. is a villager in Kraing Bonteay Village in Takeo Province. She is a farmer who cultivates twice a year. Now, it is the rainy season and she needs to cultivate rice; unfortunately, she cannot do this plantation because she does not have enough animals to plow.

Thus, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow to add to the one she already has in order to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Pon Paol, is a blacksmith who can make US$ 5 per day to support his family. Mrs. Kong S. is 36 years old and the mother of four children who are all enrolled in the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: to buy one more cow  in order to plow the field

loans.name: Herlinda

texts.es:
La señora Herlinda es socia del BC “La Esperanza”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres y distrito D. Juanjui. Se dedica a la venta D. comida y anticuchos D. carne D. pollo asados al carbón, juanes, arroz chaufa. Desarrolla el negocio en las afueras D. su casa, situado en la Carretera Marginal Km. 01 del mismo distrito donD. vive. DeciD. iniciar esta actividad porque su casa está en un lugar muy estratégico, donD. hay mucha afluencia D. gente por los talleres que están por esa zona. Sus clientes son los transportistas, trabajadores D. los talleres  y transeúntes.

Con este crédito D. S/.2,000, el cual será cancelado en un plazo D. 6 meses, comprará los insumos para la preparación D. los alimentos como, arroz, azúcar, carnes D. res, pollo, cerdo, cecina, chorizo, los cuales le permitirá variar los platos a ofertar y atender la petición D. sus clientes.
 
Herlinda es una mujer entusiasta D. 57 años D. edad, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en sus momentos libres. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y su meta es la D. arreglar su casa para mejorar la imagen D. su negocio, porque en el día venD. menú y por las noches sus anticuchos y juanes.
texts.en:
Herlinda is a member of the group BC “The Hope”. She lives in the San Martin region and the province of Mariscal Caceres district of Juanjui. She is dedicated to the sale of food like grilled chicken shish kabobs, Juanes (a typical Amazonian food prepared insiD. of a tropical leaf), and a type of stir fried rice. Her business is located outsiD. of her house on the siD. of the road. She decided to begin this activity because he home is located in a very strategic place where there is much affluence as a result of the factories. Her clients are the commuters, and works of the surrounding industries. With this loan, which she will repay in 6 monthly installments, she will buy ingredients of the food she prepares like rice, sugar, meet, chicken, pork, dried meet, and sausage. All of this will permit her to diversify what she offers and supply the demand of her clients. Herlinda is 57 years old and very enthusiastic. She lives with her husband, who helps out in his free time. She is a hard working woman and her goal is to fix up her house to improve the image of her business.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rice, sugar, meet, chicken, pork, dried meet, and sausage

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi: Chị Đào Thị Tươi năm nay 42 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2001. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ thu nhập của gia đình chị chủ yếu dựa vào chăn nuôi trồng trọt và buôn bán gạo. Đến nay qua 7 năm tham gia Quỹ tình thương kinh tế gia đình chị đã có nhiều sự đổi thay . Với việc sử dụng vốn vay hiệu quả gia đình chị đã đầu tư mua thêm được máy sát gạo phục vụ nhu cầu của bà con địa phương. Hiện tại thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt  3.000.000đ/ tháng. Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để đầu tư mua 2 tấn thóc phục vụ cho công việc buôn bán gạo của gia đình
texts.en:
Mrs Đào Thị Tươi is 42 years old. She joined the Fund in 2001. Before joining the Fund, the family's income was essentially relying on farming, planting vegetables and selling rice. Over the last 7 years with the Fund, the family's economy has evolved considerably. With the profits from the loans, the family was able to invest into a rice processing machine, serving the needs of the farmers in the area. Currently, the family's income is about 3.000.000đ per month. For the next round, she would like to borrow 9.000.000đ to invest into stock for the rice-selling business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Minh Bui, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in Rice business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: The purchase of women's clothing and accessories for a small business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia D. is forty-one years old. She is married with two children. At the moment, one has completed senior high school. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil and palm kernel oil for eight years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits and the palm kernel is a by-product of palm oil, which is produced first. The palm kernel is processed through various stages to obtain the palm kernel oil. Palm kernel is used to prepare many local dishes.

Her production is on a small scale because she has inadequate capital to buy machines for the processing. She wants to use this loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency to produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to support her husband, provide food, and finance her children’s education.

Felicia belongs to a community group called Nyame Nhyira, meaning God Blessing Trust Group. Her picture was taking during their group meeting. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loans. She said she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy more palm nuts fruits and a small milling machine.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is thirty-eight years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all girls. All of her children are currently in school. Some are in junior high school while the last born is currently in the elementary stage. She lives with her husband and family in a business/farming town called Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Most of the inhabitants are engaged in commercial and farming activities.

Lydia says her husband is a farmer who cultivates maize, cassava and other foodstuffs. Lydia deals in cooking utensils. Lydia says she procures her goods from big shops in Kumasi. She sells in a small shop in the local market and also hawks house-to-house in her community. She has been in business for fourteen years. Lydia desires to use the loan to expand her business by buying utensils in bulk to be able to trek to nearby markets to do business. She aspires to send her children all the way to the university level of education.

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for re-sale

loans.name: Saida

texts.en:
Saida A. is 19 years old. She is living with her parents. Two years ago her father bought tailoring machine for her and since than she has been providing tailoring services in her house. Before then, she worked at tailoring shop and there she learned the skills necessary for a successful business. Saida now has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order the national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. She is requesting a loan of $ 500 USD for the term of 9 months to purchase a new modern tailoring machine for sewing dresses. Saida and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.  

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key place along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and the birthplace of the great Persian poet Rudaki and the most famous Islamic philosopher Ibn Sina (Avicenna). The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, and Central Asian traditions. 
But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new modern tailoring machine for sewing dresses.

loans.name: María Consuelo

texts.es:
En el mercado Central de la ciudad de Chinandega el negocio de la señora María C. es la venta de bolsas plásticas las cuales ella comercializa con el propósito de beneficiar a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.

Vende todo tipo de bolsas en todos los tamaños y para toda actividad. La razón por la cual hoy en día ella hace uso de Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las bolsas ya que al agotársele requiere volver a llenar su estante para su comercialización.
texts.en:
In the Chinandega city Central market Mrs. María C. sells plastic bags in order to support her family. She sells all types of bags in various sizes for all kinds of activities. The reason today she seeks a loan from Ceprodel is to buy bags because upon selling all her supply she needs to restock her stand in order to continue selling.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bags

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama I. is 37 years old. She is married with four children. All are in school - junior high and primary school. Her husband is a farmer while she is a food vendor. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in Mampong, in the Ashanti region of Ghana.

She cooks rice and stew in her house and sells at the community centre in the mornings. She buys bags of rice and other ingredients from wholesalers in her community. Mariama has been in this business for nineteen years.

Mariama wants a loan to procure more bags of rice and other ingredients. She hopes to sponsor her children in school to higher levels.

loans.use: Procure bags of rice.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es: Luisa es una joven que desea salir adelante, tiene 26 años y vive en la casa de sus padres, a quienes desea ayudar con los gastos familiares. Desde que tenía 15 años decidió trabajar para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar, actualmente trabaja para una empresa de transportes, ella es la encargada de vender los boletos a los usuarios de la empresa. Es una vendedora muy alegre y siempre les saca una sonrisa a las personas que adquieren un boleto. Luisa disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y aconsejarles sobre donde irán más cómodos en el viaje, lleva 2 años en esta actividad y anhela poner una tienda de abarrotes en su casa para que sus padres la puedan administrar, lo que menos le gusta de su trabajo es que la mayoría de veces se tiene que amanecer vendiendo los pasajes, ya que la empresa brinda servicio las 24 horas del día. Este es el tercer préstamo de Luisa con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en sus pagos y espera serlo ahora también, en su banco comunal es una de las socias más activas y solidarias. Con el dinero que solicita planea incrementar sus ahorros para poder instalar la tienda en su casa.
texts.en:
Luisa is a young woman who wants to move forward in life. She is 26 years old and lives in her parents' house, who she wants to help with the family expenses. Since she was 15 years old she has worked to help her parents with expenses of the home, right now she works in transportation. She sells tickets to the customers of the business. She is a very friendly salesperson and always has a smile for the customers. Luisa enjoys having conversations with her customers and helps them have a comfortable trip. She has done this for 2 years and longs to have a grocery store in her house that her parents can manage. What she likes least about her job is that most of the time she has to arrive at the break of day to help customers, because the business runs 24 hours. This is Luisa's 3rd loan with MFP, she has always been very punctual with her payments and hopes to do so now as well. In her community bank she is one of the most active and independent members. With this money she plans to increase her savings in order to be able to start a store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of funds for starting a store

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda tiene 37 años, vive con Jesús, su esposo y su hijo Yomar de 6 en su casa propia. Ambos se dedican a la compra y venta de madera, desde hace un año para cubrir los gastos de su pequeño Yomar, nombre que le pusieron en honor a su negocio, el cual les arroja bueno resultados gracias a todo el empeño que le ponen, ya que Jesús viaja constantemente a otras provincias para dejar los pedidos que le hacen. Este negocio le resulta muy rentable, siendo sus servicios muy cotizados y obteniendo un buen dinero por todas sus ventas. A Hilda siempre le ha gustado su negocio y aunque a veces hay cosas feas como que la gente no paga a tiempo sus pedidos y tiene que estar detrás para cobrarles, siempre ha puesto mucha energía y ganas a su trabajo, ya que no está sola, cuenta con su esposo, y porque no, el pequeño Yomar también la apoya en todas las labores que tienen que realizar, haciendo un buen equipo con el cual espera salir adelante en bien de su porvenir. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP y se compromete a ser muy puntual y responsable en todos sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita es para comprar mayor cantidad de madera para vender en otras provincias y aumentar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Hilda is 37 years old. She lives with her husband, Jesús, and her son Yomar, age 6, in a house that they own. For the past year, Hilda and her husband have been buying and selling wood to cover the expenses of little Yomar. They named their business after Yomar, and it has delivered good results thanks to the hard work that they put into it. Jesus travels constantly to other provinces to delver the orders that they receive. This business has been very profitable, and their services in high demand, and they earn good money on each of their sales. Hilda has always liked sales. Even though she sometimes has to deal with unfortunate situations, like clients who don't pay for their orders on time and have to be reminded constantly to pay, she has always put a lot of energy and desire into her work. She is not alone, she has her husband, and, why not - little Yomar who support her in all of the work she undertakes. They make a good team and hope to get ahead and improve their future prospects. This is Hilda's first loan with MFP and she promises to be very punctual and responsible for all of her payments. With the money she is requesting she plans to buy a larger quantity of wood to sell in other provinces and increase their sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michele Magrino, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more product to sell

loans.name: Vumilia

texts.en:
Vumilia has owned a small grocery store in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya for three years. She belongs to the Maendeleo group loan. Every day, she works at her business for six hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania, a Kiva partner, so that she can buy more grocery items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Vumilia is 27 years old and married with a 3-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to add her current stock for the improvement of her business

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
C. Nguyễn Thị (1824071472) is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Đô Lương. She is married and has one adult child.

C. owns and operates a business selling home products, primarily selling home furniture to tourists and local community members. She has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2007, C. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding her business.

C. is now requesting a new loan of 12,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be her 3rd from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en: Nunu L., 24, is married with 1 child.  She has 3 years of experience in the handicrafts business.  She sells to the general public and tourists 3 days per week.  Nunu has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 200 Tala.  SPBD loans are Nunu’s only access to capital because she is not able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.  Nunu's husband helps by carving and engraving the crafts that are sold.  Her business is doing very well

loans.use: Purchase electric chainsaw, chisel set, sand paper.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a 33-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and the mother of five children who are currently in school. She prepares and serves local food like banku and omotuo with soup and other local dishes. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Omotuo is prepared from rice and it is also taken with any kind of soup. 

She started her local food production four years ago and sells in her neighborhood. She is working very hard to provide for the educational needs of her children. She says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production expenditure. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine G. is from the village of Panta-on, Ozamiz City. She is 42 years old. Josephine is married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business planting & harvesting corn and bananas for sale. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from GDMPC. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Josephine from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo Jorge de 58 años, el cual es chofer, y con sus hijos Savela de 25, Rocío de 22 y Jorge Luis de 21. Desde hace casi 2 años se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, tiempo en el cual ha podido aprender del negocio y “agarrarle el truco” como ella lo dice. Ahora, con la experiencia ganada ha logrado obtener buenos ingresos, los cuales le son de mucha ayuda, ya que el sueldo de chofer de su esposo no alcanza para todos los gastos de la familia. Además a Noemí siempre le gustó ser independiente y ganar su propio dinero para poder disponer ella misma. Es por eso que está muy contenta con su trabajo, ya que le permite tener disponibilidad de tiempo, aprovechando de realizar las labores domésticas en su hogar y el resto del tiempo en ofrecer sus productos de belleza a sus amigas, vecinas y familiares. Pues además de venderles, realiza visitas muy amenas, ya que también aconseja sobre los colores, tonos y productos que más le favorecen a sus clientas. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP y está muy contenta con su grupo, ya que todas son buenas amigas y cumplen con todos los pagos. Con el dinero que viene solicitando comprar más productos para tener en stock y así poco a poco convertir su negocio en algo más grande y rentable.
texts.en:
Noemi is 46 years old and lives with her husband, Jorge who is 58 and a chauffeur, and with their sons, Savela who is 25, Rocio who is 22, and Jorge Luis who is 21. For almost 2 years she has sold beauty products. During that time she has been able to learn the business and ‘get the trick of it’ as she says. Now, with the experience gained, she has been earning a good income, which is a big help because the salary of a chauffeur is not enough for all the family expenses. Additionally, Noemi has always liked to be independent and earn her own money to provide for herself. That is why she is very happy with a job that permits her to have time available to do her household chores at home and the rest of the time to offer her beauty products to her friends, neighbors, and relatives. She enjoys the visits as well as selling her products because she also gives advice about colors, tones and products that favor her customers.

This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very happy with her group. They are all very good friends and meet all payments. With the money she has asked to buy more products to have in stock to slowly turn her business into something larger and more profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Machelle Wilson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increase in merchandise

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 31 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, en su casa propia. Hace un año implementó en casa un espacio para la venta de comida, negocio que atiende sólo por las noches y ofrece platillos al paso acompañados de bebidas gaseosas. La rentabilidad de esta actividad se debe a su casa está ubicada en una muy transitada y todas las noches vende todas las porciones esperadas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes trabaja con su esposo en su taller de carpintería, donde fabrican diversos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El deseo de Rosa para el futuro es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa (platillo muy popular en la región) a estos establecimientos se les llama “pollerías”.
Con MFP, ya tiene 7 préstamos, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus pagos y prima el respeto entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará utensilios de cocina; también invertirá en el taller de carpintería, comprando mayor cantidad de madera para fabricar los muebles últimamente solicitados.
texts.en:
Rosa tiene 31 años, es madre de una niña de 3 añitos y vive con su esposo, quien es profesor, en su casa propia. Hace un año implementó en casa un espacio para la venta de comida, negocio que atiende sólo por las noches y ofrece platillos al paso acompañados de bebidas gaseosas. La rentabilidad de esta actividad se debe a su casa está ubicada en una muy transitada y todas las noches vende todas las porciones esperadas. Adicionalmente, por las tardes trabaja con su esposo en su taller de carpintería, donde fabrican diversos muebles a solicitud de sus clientes. El deseo de Rosa para el futuro es lograr ahorrar lo necesario para tener un restaurante especializado en pollo a la brasa (platillo muy popular en la región) a estos establecimientos se les llama “pollerías”. Con MFP, ya tiene 7 préstamos, y está muy contenta de ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus compañeros son cumplidos con sus pagos y prima el respeto entre todos. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará utensilios de cocina; también invertirá en el taller de carpintería, comprando mayor cantidad de madera para fabricar los muebles últimamente solicitados. Rosa is 31, mother of a 3-year old daughter, and lives in her own home with her husband, a teacher. A year ago she set aside a space in her home to sell take home food and soft drinks in the evenings. The profitability of this business is due to the the location of her home in a heavily trafficked area. Every night she sells all the food that she prepares. Additionally, in the afternoons she works with her husband in his carpentry shop, where they make different types of furniture to order. Rosa's wish for the future is to be able to save enough money to have a restaurant that specializes in roasted chickens (a popular dish in her area)-they are called "pollerias" (roast chicken shops). With MFP, she has already had 7 loans. She is very happy to be part of her community bank because all of the members are reliable with their payments and the respect they show for each other. With the money that she is currently requesting she will buy kitchen utensils; also she will invest in the carpentry shop, buying a larger amount of wood to make the furniture that has been ordered recently.

Translated from Spanish by Miriam Palacio, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy kitchen utensils for her take out food business and wood for her husband's carpentry shop

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is engaged in hog raising business. She believes that managing the business is of big help towards the fulfillment of her family goals in life. She is already 34 years old and is married to Eddie M. Sr. They are living in the simple village of Old Centro 1 San Mateo, Isabela. The couple is blessed with two children who are Eddie M. Jr., nine years old who is now in grade IV and Earl Tristan, five years old. The couple is doing everything to further supply all the needs of their children.

According to her, she needed additional capital for the needed feeds supplies of her hog raising business. Vilma hopes that she could buy a stock of feeds for the daily foods of her livestock. On this regard, she would like to avail a loan amounting PHP5, 000 from KIVA lenders for the business maintenance and further development. She really hopes that she could avail the loan amount she is requesting for her to generate bigger income as her children also grows same with their daily necessities in life.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
Veronicah used to run a salon in Naivasha town and due to her other commitments, she had to stop her salon operations.  She now wants to revive the business again and that is why she is applying for this loan from KADET.  Her neighbor, who is also a client, introduced her to KADET.

She is 36 years old, married to Michael Ndungu and has 4 school-age children. 

She is planning to revive the salon and make it be as profitable as it once was.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To revive her salon business

loans.name: Peter Maina

texts.en:
Peter is married to Rosemary and they have one child: Shantel. Peter was introduced to KADET through existing clients, and he has no previous credit history. He has been in the taxi business for one year and will use this loan to buy another motorbike for his transportation business.  His area of business is in a town center and he gets many customers who use motorbikes for short distance travel. With the extra profits, Peter willl purchase a piece of land and build rental houses as he aspires to be a landlord. He believes he is very determined and hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for taxi services.

loans.name: Sokunthea

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokunthea S. lives in Thlose Village in Takeo Province. She is 30 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is enrolled in a local school; the other child is still too young. 

Mrs. Sokunthea Some grows rice on a plot of land that she owns and she breeds ducks. Since her poultry business is going well, she wants to expand it by purchasing 1000 more ducklings and duck food. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions. Her husband, Mr. Pak Kok, is a construction worker. (Mr. Pak Kok appears with Mrs. Sokunthea Some in the photo.)

loans.use: To buy 1000 more ducklings and duck food

loans.name: Khan

texts.en: Khan C. S., 29, is married with two school-age children. Her children are enrolled at a local primary school. She resides in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia with her husband (pictured) and children. To make a living, she sells a few types of fish that she usually buys from local farmers, earning approximately an income of US $4 per day. Her husband operates a business of renting discs of movies and karaoke songs to her new and existing customers at a local market, earning an income of US $5 per day to help cover the family expenses. S. and her husband are seeking to improve their standard of living and generate a better income. Therefore, S. is asking for a loan of US $1000 to purchase more discs to stock her husband’s disc shop.

loans.use: To buy more discs to stock the store

loans.name: Linah Chelatan

texts.en: Linah sells household products such as sugar, milk, tea leaves, and eggs to residents at the Barracks soldier camp which is near Thika town. She has one employee and has been in the business for two years now. Her business challenge is a lack of proper storage for milk. She will use the loan of KES 20,000 to restock goods she sells. Her goal in life is to become a wholesaler and own a boutique. Linah is married to a soldier and has three children. She is hardworking, social and a caring mother.

loans.use: To restock goods and buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Melania Veronica

texts.es: La señora Melania se dedica a vender mercadería en general. Ella tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, sus esfuerzos de sacar a su hijos adelante es su prioridad  por lo que fue su motivación con este negocio. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante. Ella inicio  este negocio debido a la necesidad de mantenerse porque buscaba trabajo y no encontraba, y con mucho sacrificio tenía que encontrar la forma de mejorar su condición. Por lo que así logro dedicarse obteniendo muy buenos resultados. El crédito será invertido en la compra de mercaderías tales como cremas, perfumes, ropa interior, pantalones, camisas ya que se acerca la temporada navideña.  Ella posee el sueño de mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Melania has a business selling general merchandise. She has 2 children in her care, and her struggle to advance her children is her priority and was her motivation for starting this business. She sells her merchandise in the streets. She started the business owing to the necessity of supporting herself because she was looking for work and not finding it, and with a lot of sacrifice she had to find a way of improving her condition. So in this way she managed to dedicate herself to her business, obtaining very good results. This loan will be invested in the purchase of merchandise such as creams, perfumes, underwear, pants, and shirts as we approach the Christmas season. She has a dream of improving the condition of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital (to purchase creams, perfumes, underwear, pants, and shirts)

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita C. is from the village of Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 35 years old, is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lita owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling souvenirs like  bracelets, necklaces, T-shirts, etc. in the local community. Lita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Lita is requesting a new loan of 11000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the third loan Lita has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Berebedwa

texts.en:
Berebedwa A. M. is fifty years old, single, and has five children. Her business is located at Mukumu near a hospital and a busy market in Kakamega.

For the last fifteen years, Berebedwa has been engaged in her business of selling doughnuts and chips (french fries) to the local people. Her major challenge has been the low purchasing power of her customers. However she is using her loan to purchase milk for sale as well as more potatoes and chips.

Berebedwa hopes to expand her business and catch a larger market. She also hopes to purchase a plot for herself. She is a hardworking and visionary woman.

loans.use: To buy baking flour, potatoes and milk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of palm nuts to make red oil.

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en: Leonardo P. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. He is 40 years old, is separated from his spouse, and has three school-aged children. Leonardo owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 18,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Leonardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be his first from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of his family. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn V. is from Barangay Nangalisan, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya Province. She is 41 years old. Evelyn is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Evelyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale. Evelyn has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,200 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Evelyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Evelyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to to purchase fertilizers, such as manure. Evelyn is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This loan will be her sixth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Gina's Group

texts.en:
Gina P., from the village of Tru-Cut Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental, is the 21-year-old group leader of a three-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Tundan.

Married with four school-aged children, Gina owns and operates a business venture providing manicure and pedicure services in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 2560 PHP a month.

In 2010, Gina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase materials needed to provide service, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Bianeth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Bianeth de 31 años de edad, es soltera  labora como Responsable de la Univesidad URCCAN desde hace 9 años,  tiene una bebe de 2 años y y seis meses,su compañero de vida labora como albañil el cual la ayuda con los gastos familiares.

Esta solicitando su 4to crèdito  para comprar materiales de construcciòn y asi construir una habitaciòn para su bebita, y asi tener mejor comodidad en el hogar,este es el segundo credito que tramita con el fondo kiva y expresa sentirse muy agradecida por el apoyo brindado.

Su sueño es ir mejorando poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y seguir estudiando para ser una profesinal con mucha experiencia.
texts.en:
Bianeth, 31, is single and has been employed as a supervisor at URACCAN University for the last 9 years; she has a two-and-a-half year old daughter. Her life partner works as a bricklayer and contributes to family expenses. She is requesting her 4th loan to buy building materials to build a bedroom for her baby so that the home will be more comfortable. This is her 2nd loan with Kiva funds and she states that she is very grateful for the support provided. Her dream is to gradually improve her living conditions and to continue to study to become an experienced professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For building materials and supplies.

loans.name: Nilmini

texts.en:
Nilmini is a 42-year-old married woman who lives with her husband, daughter and son (ages 23 and 20).  She lives in the town of Hikkaduwa. She wants to earn some income, because she doesn't like to depend on others. She does not even like to depend on her husband for financial assistance.  Her son is an army officer and her daughter is helping with coir making.

Nilmini has a coir (coconut-shell fiber) business, in which she takes the fibers of local coconuts and weaves them into household items like string, rope, and floor mats. She has two years of experience in this field. 

Nilmini has requested a 55,000-rupee (LKR) loan from BRAC to buy some coir for the coir business. Currently she does not have the financial capital necessary to grow.

Thank you for taking the time to consider supporting this Sri Lankan loan!

loans.use: To buy coir

loans.name: Ashrafi's Group

texts.en:
Ashrafi is a resident of the mid-sized city of Riwind in Pakistan. She owns a small house with two rooms. She has been living in it with her family for over ten years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he is involved in a dairy business. He has a dairy cow from which he gets milk to sell to the local community. His income helps him to manage the financial expenses of the family. 


On seeing the hard work and devotion of her husband, Ashrafi decided to share the financial burden with him and started sewing clothes three years ago. Originally she made her relatives use her to sew their clothes and, seeing the satisfactory results, they have now paid her and given her more of their clothes to sew. She also, now, receives orders from her neighbors and charges them Pak Rs. 100 to 150. Now they can both manage their financial expenses efficiently using their earnings. 


Ashrafi is applying for a loan from Asasah to invest capital in her husband’s business so he can purchase another dairy cow and increases his profits.

loans.use: to purchase another dairy cow to increase profit

loans.name: Byambajav

texts.en: Byambajav T. is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in Zavhan province in western Mongolia in a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, known as a ger. He has made a living by running a mobile phone and spare parts business for the last three years and now has quite a few clients. Byambajav wishes to expand his business as well as open a mobile phone store and trading center. He is modest but confident and optimistic about achieving the goal. He is requesting a loan for 4,000,000 loan to buy mobile phones and spare parts from China.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and spare parts

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea was born in 1967 and is a widow with four children aged between 8 and 18. Lea has business selling various products which is interesting in her residence place. Lea is known in the village where she lives which is an advantage for her, because she attracts more customers from various areas. The hours of her business are from 6 in the morning to 8 in the evening every day.

Lea has enough experience because this is her second loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company. With this loan Lea wishes to expand her business through purchasing more products especially foodstuffs. With the extra money Lea will be able to save and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: Expanding her businesss

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa tiene 42 años D. edad, resiD. en el Municipio del tránsito, departamento D. San Miguel, es casada,  tiene tres hijos D. las edades D. 15,13 y 8 respectivamente, se dedica a la venta D. tortillas y pupusas (tortilla D. maíz con queso y carne D. cerdo).
Inicialmente María, vendía frutas, y hace ocho años tiene su negocio D. venta D. tortillas y pupusas, tiene un puesto en el mercado municipal del Tránsito, la mayoría D. los clientes son amigos y personas que visitan el mercado, el negocio lo atienD. todos los días en un horario D. 7.00 am – 5:00 pm, la ventaja es que tiene mucha gente que la conoce. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra D. materia prima como son: Maíz, carne D. cerdo, queso, cal, aceite, condimentos y gas propano. Este inversión le ayudara a que ella continúe con el negocio y pueda generar  ingresos para solventar necesidades económicas D. la familia.
Las aspiraciones D. María son mantener el negocio y generar  ingresos para invertir en la educación D. los hijos, para que se conviertan en personas profesionales
texts.en:
María Teresa, 42, lives in the city of Tránsito, San Miguel department. She’s married and has three children who are 15, 13, and 8 years of age respectively. She’s a tortilla and pupusa (corn tortilla stuffed with cheese and pork) merchant. At first, María was a fruit vendor but she has had her tortilla and pupusa sales business for the last 8 years. She has a stall in the Tránsito Municipal Market. Most of her customers are friends and people who visit the market. She is open for business daily from 7am to 5pm. She has an advantage because she’s very well known by many people. She is asking for funds to buy raw materials like: corn, pork, cheese, lime powder, cooking oil, condiments and propane gas. This investment will help her continue with her work and produce income to meet the family’s economic needs. María’s aspirations are to keep her business to generate income to pay for her children’s education so that they may become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, pork, cheese, lime powder, cooking oil, condiments and propane gas.

loans.name: Maria De Lourdes

texts.es:
Doña Maria es una mujer que se ha esforzado en su trabajo un cafetín que logro ubicarse hace varios años, en donde hace una variedad de alimentos. El cual ha apoyado a su esposo en cubrir los gastos básicos, el trabaja de cadete de taxi, en donde hay días con pocos clientes.

Es por eso toma la iniciativa de trabajar para obtener ingresos. A través de los años ha venido mejorando su casa el cual lo ha logrado con el apoyo de la institución mediante el financiamiento ya que es el único medio para poder construir por que todo esta caro.
Lo que hará con este préstamo es la construcción de un cuarto, logrando privacidad. Y mejor comodidad ya que la casa es pequeña.
Comprara: piedra, diez láminas de zinc, diez bolsas de cemento, hierro, estribo y otros para comenzar la obra.
Sus planes es seguir trabajando, y lograr el equilibrio económico para cubrir sus pagos.
texts.en:
Maria is a woman who is dedicated to her work in a cafe. She was able to establish the cafe several years ago, and she makes a variety of food for it. This has helped her husband to cover the basic expenses. He is a taxi driver, and there are days when he has few customers. That is why she took the initiative to work in order to get income. Through the years she has been improving her house. She has done that with the help of a loan through the institution. It is the only way to be able to build because everything is expensive. She will use the loan to build a room for privacy and to be more comfortable. Her house is small. She will buy stone, ten zinc sheets, ten bags of cement, iron, buttresses, and other things to start the work. Her plans are to keep working and to achieve economic equilibrium to cover her payments.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a room for privacy and to be more comfortable - buy stone, ten zinc sheets, ten bags of cement, iron, buttresses, and other things

loans.name: Saroeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Saroeun M. (in the photo) and her husband, Mr. Thry Chan, have been married since 1977. They have six children: three sons and three daughters. Four of them are married and live outside the family home and the other two are garment-factory workers. They live along National Road Number Five about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Saroeun and her husband catch fish. They fish from the river and lake near their house. Saroeun is asking for loan of $800 to purchase a boat and fishing materials for her fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and fishing materials for her fishing business

loans.name: David Kiptarbey

texts.en:
David Kiptarbey M. is general store keeper in Eldoret two. He has been in this business for the past five years. M. is 43 years old, married and with one child aged 3 years. He also supports three family members who solely depend on him as a guardian. He is able to make a profit of Kenya shillings 35,000 per month.

David is currently accessing his 8th loan term with KADET. He plans to use the money given to him to buy bales of maize meal, baking flour, 10 bags of sugar, 12 containers of cooking oil, dozens of containers of body oil and hair oil. He will use the profits to finish the construction of the hotel building next to his shop. 

His future dream is to construct business premises which have a steady income  to support members of his family.

loans.use: To add items of stock like maize flour, baking flour, fertilizers, dry maize, cosmetics, cooking oil, and sugar

loans.name: Yao

texts.fr: yao a ouvert en 2007 son restaurant qu'il a appelé "MA PART", il a ouvert son restaurant près d'un carrefour, ainsi il attire plus de clientèle. il a déjà sollicité et obtenu de WAGES un crédit qu'il a bien remboursé. il sollicite son deuxième crédit pour se réapprovisionner avec 16 cartons de pâtes alimentaires, 12 cartons de couscous, 6 cartons de petits pois, 8 cartons de tomates en boîtes de conserve, de l'huile , du café et divers.
texts.en:
Yao has opened his restaurant in 2007 and named “Ma Part “ [My share]. His restaurant is next to an intersection, which is why attracts more customers. Yao had already obtained a loan from WAGES in the past and repaid it well. He is now seeking a new loan in order to replenish his food stock by purchasing 16 boxes of pasta, 12 boxes of couscous, 6 cartons of peas, 8 cartons of canned tomatoes as well as oil, coffee, etc.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing foods necessary for his restaurant

loans.name: Angelique

texts.en:
Angelique is 57 years old and married.  Angelique has owned a small shop where she sells beverages and some pastries.  She has been in this business for about three years and the business hours are from early in the morning until late in the evening.

Although Angelique has been in this business for a long time, her capital is still too low to expand meaningfully.  To end this, she needs to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company.  With the use of this loan, Angelique will hopefully earn more profit, which in turn will allow her to start saving for a better future and continue taking care of her family.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Vangie

texts.en:
Vangie P., 33 years old, is a loving and self-sacrificing mother of three children, all of them young and in need of her support. Vangie harbors a strong desire in her heart to increase her capital in order to acquire a larger inventory of fish in her stall, thereby creating more revenue for her family. Above all, she hopes to offer a better quality of life for her beloved children. Vangie is requesting a loan of 45,000 PHP to pay for a pump boat for her husband to use to catch more fish and, with the remaining money, to purchase inventories of fish to sell in the market place. Let’s get together behind this devoted mother to help her bring well-being and security to the members of her family. Vangie believes that her business will help her family rise up and fight against poverty and will provide for the family's needs, especially in educating her three children. Her eldest child is a junior high school student and the other two are elementary students. Vangie is very grateful to ASHI and KIVA for their continuous support.

As a loyal member of Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a Kiva microfinance partner in the Philippines, since 1998, Vangie is thankful for secured access to capital and loans to support her entrepreneurial dreams. She hopes to diversify her revenue in the long term to support her family's basic needs. The support of ASHI and Kiva lenders will enable Vangie to finally reach her dreams in life: to have a growing business, to invest in her home and to have a good life and a happy family. Despite various trials in her life, Vangie has never given up in her struggle against poverty.

loans.use: to pay for a pump boat and to purchase fish

loans.name: Mavlyuda

texts.en:
Mavlyuda is married. She sells clothing at one of the small markets in Tursunzade city. Mavlyuda has been in this business for 2 years. She enjoys selling women's shoes very much. Her clients see that and come back. Mavlyuda would like to borrow $1,500 USD to increase her assortment of shoes. Her goal is to develop her business further and open a second location.
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj .

loans.use: To purchase new goods to sell increase the range of goods.

loans.name: Esther Esi Kuwah

texts.en: Esther Esi kuwah N. sells maize in both smaller and larger quantities at Elmina. She has no educational background. She is married. She assists in the upkeep of the home. Her loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to distribute to her increasing number of customers. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock onions and tomatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elizabeth

texts.en: Ma. Elizabeth C. is from the town of Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 41 years old. Ma. Elizabeth is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Ma. Elizabeth owns & operates a restaurant. The main source of income for the business comes from serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. Ma. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Ma. Elizabeth joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ma. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be the first loan taken out by Ma. Elizabeth from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en:
Victorina R. is from the village of Agusan Canyon, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. She is 59 years old. Victorina is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells snacks and other delicacies like shakoy (or "butsi" - fried dough sprinkled with sugar) in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately $200 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Victorina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
This member belongs to the “Virgen Asunta de Oropesa” cooperative bank, which is located in the Oropesa district of the province of Quispicanchi in the department of Cusco, Peru.

Her name is Anabel and she is 33 years old.  Anabel has a common-law husband and three children.  She is requesting the loan to invest in her restaurant in Oropesa.  She is planning on purchasing more meat, rice, sugar, vegetables, and potatoes to create typical Peruvian dishes to sell in her restaurant.

She is very happy with the loan granted and commits to making her payments within the established time frame.

loans.use: Invest in her restaurant

loans.name: Jerold

texts.en:
Jerold V. is from the village of Aurora. He is 30 years old, married, and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Jerold owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting, harvesting and selling rice. Jerold has been involved in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jerold joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to improve his living situation and his ability to engage in business activities.
