Jerold is requesting a new loan of 21000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the first loan taken out by Jerold from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay tuition fees for his children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es: José Luis Pérez Ávila es un hombre  muy trabajador, desde hace un año se dedica al transporte urbano como chofer de taxi, llevando a sus clientes a su destino por un bajo costo. Para tener mejores ganancias el trabaja día y noche de esta manera ayuda a su esposa con los gastos del hogar. Es padre de dos pequeños por quienes sale adelante para ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. El préstamo que solicita es para comprar una nueva unidad para seguir ofreciendo su servicio.
texts.en: José Luis Pérez Ávila is a hard-working man who for the past year has been dedicated to working as a city taxi driver, transporting customers to their destinations for a low price.  In order to generate more income, he works days and nights to help his wife with the household expenses.  He is the father of two young children, for whom he tries to get ahead and wants to be able to provide them with a higher standard of living.  The loan he is requesting is to buy a new unit in order to continue offering his services.

loans.use: To purchase a transportation unit.

loans.name: Delicia

texts.es: La Sra.  Delicia de edad de 46 años oriunda de Santa Cruz de la provincia San  José Andrés Ibáñez  actualmente vive en la zona de San José  hace 30 años, su actividad se dedica a la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir hace 13 años y como segunda actividad venta de patasca sábado y domingo cuenta con este negocio hace 2 años vende en su domicilio.                                                                                                    Estado civil Convive con el señor Fanor hace  30 años y cuenta con la actividad de sastre hace 15 años en la zona de la 7 calles los señores cuentan con 3 hijos que se e encuentran estudiando en la universidad, con el dinero del crédito comprara telas e hilos para la confección de uniformes escolares ya que tiene un pedido.  La señora se siente agradecida con nuestra entidad financiera por haber confiado en ella nuevamente.
texts.en: Delicia is 46 years old and she is originally from Santa Cruz, of the San Jose Andres Ibanez province. She has lived in the region of San Jose for 30 years. She has a business where she makes clothing and provides alteration services. She has had her business for 2 years and she sells from her home. She has been married common-law with Fanor for 30 years. She has been a seamstress for 15 years in the region of 7 Calles. They have 3 children together and they are all attending university. With the funds from the loan she will purchase fabrics and threads to make school uniforms, an order that has been placed. She is thankful to the financial organization to have imparted their trust on her once again.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics and threads.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Vann C. is a seventy-year-old married woman from the province of Kompong Cham.  She earns a living by growing rice. She has been farming since 1979 and makes approximately $1 per day to support her family.  Her husband assists her in the same business. This couple has six children -- three are single and three are married. Two of their children are working at a garment factory as sewing workers. Vann C. is looking for a loan to buy a cow because her old cow can no longer support her field work.

loans.use: To buy a cow to replace the old one for field work

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Ramatu. She is married and has one child, age 12. She has five additional dependents. In 2009, Ramatu established her cooked-food (cookery) business. She began her business so that she can help her husband cover some of the household expenses. She opens her business six days a week and nine hours a day. She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. Ramatu requires a loan in order to buy more foodstuff for her cookery business. In the future, Ramatu plans to help her son through his education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuff for her business

loans.name: Janeth Amparo

texts.es:
Janeth, tiene 31 años de edad, reside en San Carlos, departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposo don José, sus hijos José Jeremías de 6 años de edad, José Irineo de 3 años y medio; Janeth se dedica a la venta de tortillas, las realiza en su vivienda y las vende con sus vecinos.

Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz y leña, estos materiales son muy necesarios, ya que son la materia prima para que ella pueda realizar sus ventas.

El propósito de ella es trabajar para sus hijos, proveerles lo necesario en alimentación, y que un día logren ser profesionales.
texts.en:
Janeth, 31, lives in San Carlos, Morazán Department with her husband, José, and their children, José Jeremías, 6, and José Irineo, 3.  Janeth sells home-made tortillas to her neighbors.

She is asking for a loan to buy corn and firewood.  These are very necessary supplies because they are the raw materials that will make her sales possible.

Her goal is to work for her children, to provide nourishment for them and one day they manage to become professionals.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood.

loans.name: Nene

texts.en: Nene is currently in business selling greens. She is 26 years old, married, with two children and both of them go to school. Nene borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. She hopes to pay for her children in school with extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita G. is from the village of Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 62 years old. Merlita is married and has two adult children. To make a living, Merlita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Merlita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & biscuits. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Merlita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & biscuits

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in Abura, near Basi. Abena has been selling wakye (rice and beans cooked together) for seven years. Abena uses her income to assist her husband to pay the utility bills and other household expenses. She will use the loan to purchase more rice, beans, and other ingredients for cooking wakye. With the new profits from her expanded business, Abena plans to build a kiosk to sell her food from.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, beans, and other ingredients for cooking wakye.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUNAY TIKA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 28 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo de docente del nivel inicial, ella enseña a niños de 3,4 y 5 años de edad en el distrito de Urubamba, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar en su trabajo como profesora y también quiere terminar de construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como mayólicas, cemento y arena.
                                                                  
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the "Munay Tika" community bank which is located in Urubamba district, in Urubamba province, in Cusco department.

Sonia is 28 years old, married, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her work as a teacher.  She teaches children aged 3, 4 and 5, in Urubamba district.  Through her work, Sonia gets her own children ahead in life.  She would like to improve in her work as a teacher and would also like to finish building her house.  She is requesting this loan to buy construction supplies such as 'maiolicas' (glazed, ceramic tiles), cement and sand.

Sonia is happy to be receiving her loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies such as 'maiolica' (glazed, ceramic tiles), cement and sand

loans.name: Arline

texts.en:
Arline is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with six children. 

Arline has a retail shop that makes and sells brooms. She has had this business for two years. She has requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy raw materials needed for the making of her brooms.

Arline is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Arline hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the making of brooms.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a married man with two children, one of whom attends school while the other is too young. He owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

For the past two years Ali has operated a vegetable stall, selling his produce at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge from other vegetable stall operators in the area.

Ali decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve his livelihood. With his 20,000 KES loan he wants to purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, green vegetables and oranges. He dreams of expanding his business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase tomatoes, onions, potatoes, green vegetables and oranges for his stall.

loans.name: Ana Estela

texts.es: Ana Estela de 55 años de edad, es madre soltera y habita en casa familiar con sus dos hijas que ya son mayores de edad. Durante mucho tiempo Ana ha trabajado duramente para sacar adelante a su  querida familia y con grandes dificultades ha logrado que uno de sus hijos asista a la universidad. Ella quiere ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y con mejores oportunidades a las que ella ha tenido.  Ana posee una pequeña tienda en su hogar de residencia en la cual vende principalmente bebidas y golosinas. La zona es muy tranquila y de fácil acceso para muchas personas que habitan alrededor de su casa. Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el objetivo de invertir en su negocio en la compra de diferentes tipos de  bebidas que es lo que más vende en su pequeña tienda. Con esto espera incrementar su nivel de ventas y por ende su nivel de ingresos que le permitan aspirar a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Estela, 55, is a single mother and lives in a relative's house with her two daughters who are adults.  Ana has had to work very hard for a long time to help her dear family get ahead.  With great difficulty she was able to put one of her children through college.  She wants her children to have professional careers so they can have better opportunities than what she has had.

Ana has a small store set up where she lives and mainly sells beverages and sweets.  The area is quiet and has easy access for many people who live nearby.  She has decided to request a loan through INTEGRAL in order to buy different types of beverages, which is what she sells most in her small business.  This way she hopes to increase sales and income in order to lead a better lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy different types of beverages.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and is a married woman with six children. Most of her children are adults and already married.

Erlinda is a farmer working in the town of Trinidad, Bohol. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. Erlinda works hard to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for the labor of those who help till her farm. Erlinda said this loan will be very helpful for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor.

loans.name: Jayson

texts.en:
Jayson is 29 years old and is single. He has been in the hog raising business for almost four years. Jayson is grateful for his business because he can help his parents pay their household costs through his earnings.
Jayson wanted to maintain his business to extend his financial assistance to his parents. He is asking for a loan of P20,000 to buy additional piglets to raise in order to maintain his business. He believes that this loan is a big help for him as he continues to operates his business and generate higher income.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent is 35 years old and is from Migori.  She is married with three school age children.

Millicent has a second hand clothing business that she has been running for the past four years.  She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD to enable her buy more clothes to add to her stock.  The profits made from this business will be used to cater for her family's needs.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Luis Manuel

texts.es:
En  la ciudad de Managua EL señor Luis Manuel
 se dedica a laborar como conductor en una empresa de esta cuidad  dedicándose  a esta labor desde hace 5 años .es casado y con dos pequeño hijos a las que tiene que proporcionarles las condiciones necesarias para que se desarrollen. 
Una de las necesidades que el señor atraviesa hoy en día es que debe mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda debido a que ha estado en malas condiciones por lo que ha tomado la sabia decisión  de iniciar la obra de mejora . es por este motivo que acude a ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines .para iniciar la la mejora de la vivienda realizando el cambio de techo. por medio de esta obra brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a sus hijos y esposa .
Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporciona a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias
texts.en:
In the city of Managua, Mr. Luis Manuel works as a driver for a local company. He has done this for five years. He is married with two small children to whom he must provide everything they need for their development.
One of his needs at the moment is to improve his home's conditions because it is in bad shape. So, he has made the wise decision to start the repair work. For this reason, he has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of construction materials such as zinc and perline boards to start making home improvements by changing the roof. Through this work, he will offer his children and wife better living conditions.
It is important to emphasize that through this work he will offer his family a dignified roof over their heads and all the necessary living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Ndeye Adama

texts.fr: Madame Ndeye habite au Sénégal. Elle est âgée  de 43 ans et évolue dans le domaine de l’aviculture. Elle a choisi cette activité par nécessité  dans le but de diversifier ses revenus. Elle est membre d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis 8 ans. Elle sollicite un crédit de 200 000 frs. L’objet du prêt est destiné a payer une commande de poussins pour les besoins de son activité. Ce financement lui permettra d’améliorer  sa situation sociale et d’aider ses proches.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ndeye is 43 years old, and she lives in Senegal. She is a poultry farmer. She chose this activity out of necessity in order to diversify her income. 
She has been a member of a U-IMCEC branch for eight years. 

She is seeking a loan of 200,000 francs to pay for chicks that she ordered for business purposes. This credit will allow her to improve her social standing and help her family.

loans.use: to buy chicks for her poultry farming business

loans.name: Ghazwan

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 22 years old, single and lives with two family members.

Ghazwan has been the owner of a bakery since 2007.  He produces and sells flour-based food baked in an oven, such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has four years of experience in this field and a good reputation.  His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to purchase a large electric dough machine.  He aims to increase profits and provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: purchase a large electric dough machine.

loans.name: Umoja Group

texts.en:
Greetings from Umoja Group in Western Kenya! Joan is the facilitator of the Umoja group. This  group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Joan takes care of two children at home. She joined One Acre Fund in order to access fertilizer and hybrid seeds and ensure food security for her family. In the recent 2011 season, Joan had an excellent maize yield harvesting 16 bags on 1 acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Joan was only able to harvest 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Joan and her group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from maize sales, Joan will repair her home and ensure food security.

In 2012, the members of Umoja group will each plant  between ½ and 1 acre of maize.

Joan is pictured in the photograph together with her group members and the Field Officer at the far left.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Peter

texts.ru:
Петр женат, у него двое взрослых детей. Петр – из Ивано-Франковска. С детства у него были золотые руки и он мог смастерить что угодно из дерева. В свое время Петр работал водителем, экспедитором на спиртзаводе. Потом, последовав совету товарища, решил начать свое дело. Уже 7 лет Петр занимается изготовлением корпусной мебели из ДСП на заказ. У него всегда есть заказы за счет постоянных клиентов и качественного исполнения работ. На данный момент его ежемесячный доход составляет 5 000 гривен. У Петра есть 1 наемный работник. В бизнесе во многом помогает то, что есть и свое транспортное средство (грузо-пассажирское авто - газель 1999 года).

Петр планирует вложить сумму кредита в 8 000 гривен в закупку необходимых материалов для производства мебели, а именно в приобретение плиты и мебельной фурнитуры. В ближайшем будущем Петр надеется приобрести новую легковую машину, чтобы удобнее и быстрее было ездить на встречу с клиентами. Петр очень любит свою семью и много вкладывает в благосостояние своих родных. Одним из интересных фактов может стать то, что совсем недавно дочь Петра стала призером чемпионата мира по легкой атлетике (бег на 200 метров и эстафета 4X100м).  

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en: Peter is married and has two adult children.  Peter is from Ivano-Frankivsk.  Since childhood, he has had "golden hands" and was able to make anything from wood.  At another time, Peter worked as a driver, expediter at a spirits plant.  Then, after taking his friend's advise, he started his own business.  Peter has been involved in making furniture out of chipboard to-order for seven years.  He always has work orders due to having loyal customers and producing quality work.  Currently, his monthly income is 5,000 hryvnia.  Peter has one hired worker.  Having a means of transportation (a 1999 Gazel passenger van) also helps a lot in the business.  Peter plans to invest a loan in the sum of 8,000 hryvnia into a purchase of necessary materials for making furniture, specifically purchasing chipboard and furniture accessories.  In the near future, Peter hopes to buy a new passenger, so that it is easier for him to meet with clients.  Peter loves his family very much and invests a lot into the well-being of his relatives.  One of the interesting facts could be that recently Peter's daughter won a prize at a world championship in track and field (200 meter run and a 4x100 meter relay).

loans.use: purchase necessary materials for making furniture, specifically purchasing chipboard and furniture accessories

loans.name: Euphrasie

texts.en:
Euphrasie is 57 years old and is married with four children between the ages of 12 and 31. She takes care of two children. Euphrasie owns a business selling various goods, such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt, cosmetics, soap, biscuits, etc. This is her 13th successful year in this business and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 8.30 pm every day. She currently employs 2 people to help her.

Euphrasie has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods for the business, such as cooking oil, rice, sugar, salt, cosmetics, soap, biscuits, etc. to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as cosmetics, bread, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Yeggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité yeggo a été crée depuis la fondation du Banc villageois.
Il est composé de 15 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village et d un même groupement.
Pour montrer leur affinité elles ont donné au groupe le nom "entente" suite à leur  bon voisinage.
Madame Anthia responsable de ce groupe debout à droite de la photo est mère de famille marié âge de 43 ans .
Elle est mère de 3 enfants et n'a aucun enfant en charge, elle est membre du banc villageois depuis sa création.
Son activité reste le commerce de détails dans la vente de produits divers.
Avec son  nouveau prêt elle va acheter 4 sacs de mil  3 sacs d arachides,2 sacs mais et 2 paquets savons.
Ses bénéfices lui permettront de participer dans la prise en charge de sa famille ( achats riz huile vêtements, médicaments ...)
texts.en:
The solidarity group Yeggo was created at the same time as the Banc Villageois.
It is made up of 15 women who all come from the same village and the same group.
To show their affinity, they have given the group the name “agreement” because of their good relationships.

Madame Anthia, the leader of this group who is standing to the right in the photo, is 43 years old, married and a mother. 
She is the mother of three children but does not have any of them in her care.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois since it was created.
She is a retail merchant who sells various products. 
With her new loan she will buy four sacks of millet, three sacks of peanuts, two sacks of corn and two packs of soap.
Her profits will allow her to contribute to meeting the family’s needs by buying rice, oil, clothing, medicine, etc.

loans.use: to buy millet, peanuts, corn and soap.

loans.name: Mark Jhon

texts.en:
Mark Jhon is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Mark Jhon provides motorcycle or habal-habal services. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 7,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Mark Jhon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Mark Jhon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es: Madre cabeza de familia, Luz Dary hace ocho años trabajaba en cafeterías contando con toda la experiencia para poder montar su propio negocio, así como lo hizo hace ya tres años y con el cual está muy contenta y saliendo adelante. Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su cafetería y surtirla mucho más de bebidas, licores y algunos comestibles que le piden los clientes constantemente. Prestar un mejor servicio y que los ingresos aumenten para poder seguir pagándole los estudios a su hijo menor es un anhelo muy grande que tiene.
texts.en: Luz Dary is a mother and is the head of her household.  She worked in cafes for 8 years, and with all of this experience she was able to start up her own business 3 years ago.  She is now very pleased with this business and is making progress with it.  Her main dream is to be able to expand her cafe and stock it with more drinks, liquors, and some food items that her customers are frequently asking for.   Her greatest desire is to provide better service and have more income, so that she can continue to pay for the education of her youngest child.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to stock her cafe

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a forty-year-old, married woman with four children all of whom are in school.  She has had a business selling charcoal in Yei, South Sudan for two years.

Christine is requesting this loan through BRAC, South Sudan to purchase charcoal.  She will use her extra income from this investment to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 48 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y empeñosa, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente con Luis quien es chofer, asimismo vive en compañía de sus hijos de 29, 28, 23 y 18 años de edad, instalados cómodamente en su casa propia. El negocio que tiene Rosa es una tienda de ventas de lubricantes para motos y motocarros, contando para eso con un local alquilado en una avenida muy transitada de su ciudad. Dicho negocio se inició con un pequeño préstamo hace 02 años, eso le ayudo a abastecer de poco productos, con el tiempo logró aumentar y ahora tener en stock cantidad de mercadería. Asimismo cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y un sobrino al que paga por semana de trabajo. Le gusta su negocio pues fue concebido por una idea propia, logrando verlo concretizado y viendo los buenos resultados. Ahora desea incursionar en otro negocio que es la pesca, para eso ha comprado un bote de pesca artesanal, de esa manera estará logrando aumentar sus ingresos e ir creciendo como empresaria. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida por contar con una línea de crédito para avanzar con sus planes y por ello se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de lubricantes a precio por mayor  para así tener mayores ganancias.
texts.en: Rosa is 48 and is a hard-working woman.  She is also happy and sociable.  She lives with her partner, Luis, who is a chauffeur.  She also lives with her children, who are 29, 28, 23, and 18.  They live comfortably in their own home.  Rosa has a business selling lubricants for motorcycles and motorcycle rickshaws.  She has a rented location on a very frequented avenue in her city.  She started her business with a small loan two years ago.  This helped her supply a few products.  With time, she managed to grow and now she has a large quantity of merchandise in stock.  She also has the support of her children and a nephew whom she pays weekly for their work.  She likes her business which was conceived from her own idea, and she has seen it come to life and have good results.  Now she hopes to start another business, which is fishing.  She has bought a handmade fishing boat, and in this way, she will increase her income and grow as a businesswoman.  This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma.  She is thankful to have a line of credit to advance her plans, and this is why she promises to make her payments on time.  With the requested amount of 800 PEN, she will invest in the wholesale purchase of lubricants so she can make better profits.

loans.use: to buy more lubricants.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.ru: Насиба на протяжении 14 лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур. Она замужем имеет двоих детей. Муж помогает по бизнесу. Она выращивает картофель, пшеницу, морковь. Других источников дохода у нее нет. Она хочет получить займ в размере 7000 сомони для приобретения семян, рассады и минеральных удобрений. Она хочет обработать землю и подготовить к весеннему посеву. Она надеется на вашу помощь и заранее благодарна за поддержку.
texts.en: Nasiba has been farming for fourteen years. She is married with two children. Her husband helps with the business. She grows potatoes, wheat and carrots. She has no other source of income. She wants to get a loan of 7000 TJS to buy seeds, seedlings, and fertilizer. She wants to process and prepare the ground for spring planting. She is hoping for your help and thanks you in advance for the support

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is a married woman who has six children. Anita is 40 years old and resides at Kahayagan West, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Anita buys and sells livestock for their living and she's been five years in this business. Each month, she earns 5,000 PHP doing this type of business. She requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.
 
In 2010, Anita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Anita hopes improve their living conditions further.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.

location.town: Kahayagan West, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Fig Plus Light Group

texts.en:
This group is part of Nuru International group of six farmers called Fig Plus Light, based within Kuria West District. The members of the group came together in order to grow socially and economically through agriculture. Francis, raising up his hand, has been a member of this group for two years now. He is 24 years old and married with two children.

With the loan from Kiva, Francis plans to buy hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet on a one acre farm. The harvest which he hopes will be very good will provide food security for his household. He plans to sell the surplus and invest the money in a business to increase the family’s income.

loans.use: To purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize, sorghum and millet.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en: Innocent is a farmer who deals in the buying and selling of clean coffee, he works six days in a week and started this business five years ago. He is a twenty seven year old, married man with two children aged 5 & 7 years and also looks after 3 dependent children who are all in school. He says that his greatest dream is to have all the five children educated so that they will be able to enjoy the goodness of the earth and that through it they will have the best employment opportunities. Innocent is requesting for a loan to buy more coffee for his produce business.  With the profits he hopes to have enough income to give his children a quality education and buy a car in future although he is limited by capital.

loans.use: to buy more coffee for his produce business.

loans.name: Kurte

texts.en:
Kurte is a vocalist from the Roma minority in Bulgaria.    He began his career with a local group, the Kitka Orchestra.  He then moved around, working with the Lulugi, Melodia and now the Kozar Orchestras.     

Kurte’s dream is to record his own solo album with the songs he has written.  This money is going to be used for the costs of producing his new album.  The costs include studio time, CD pressing and licensing for the covers he will record. 

Lenders interested in learning more about the Roma culture in Bulgaria might find “Bury Me Standing: The Gypsies and Their Journey” by Isabel Fonseca to be helpful.  The book was published in 1995 and is widely available.

loans.use: Album recording

loans.name: Faasiu

texts.en: Faasiu F. grew up in a family of six, both her parents were unemployed but they worked hard in developing their taro plantation (starchy rootcrop which serves as staple food in Samoa,  like rice in the Asia or potatoes in other countries). Her parents couldn’t afford to send their kids to school and so Faasiu never had to chance to attend school. She’s now 54 years old, also married with 5 children. From the taro plantation they had, Faasiu always encourage her husband to start up a cattle farm, which now belongs to her and her children only. This business helped out Faasiu so much in financing her 5 children’s schooling needs. Her daughter in now working for a travel agent company, but with her two sons, they have decided to help out their parents with the business, because they believe with their business, they will have a successful future.

loans.use: To expand her cattle farm by buying four (4) additional cattle to be fattened.

loans.name: In

texts.en: In P. currently sells vegetables out of her home and at the local market.  She plans to use this loan to buy the necessary equipment for making different types of juices to sell in addition to vegetables.  In P. lives in Phnom Penh with her husband and their 2 children.  Her husband is a construction worker and earns $6-7/day.  One of her children works at a garment factory, and the other is a constuction worker just like his father.  With this loan, In P. will begin selling two different types of products at the market, but she hopes to extend this to all kinds of sweets.

loans.use: Buy equipment to produce sweet juice and mixed fruit juice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand his bicycle transport business

loans.name: Yesico Elizabeth

texts.en:
Yesica Elizabeth A. Q., 31, sells new clothes by either walking in the streets or going house to house knocking on doors. She goes to Guatemala City or as they call it here “Guate” to buy new clothes to sell. With this loan she will be able to restock her selection, which is very low because she has sold out of everything. The first loan was so successful in starting her new business that she's pleased to be moving on to a second loan.

She and the other members of her group just finished paying off their first 6 month loan. They all paid up in full and on time, something to be proud of and not something all groups are able to achieve.

She is married and has two children, both in school. When asked how much schooling she has had she was shy to admit that she had only finished the sixth grade. But she knows how important school is. Her dream is to continue with her own schooling to become a nurse and help her husband finish schooling as an electronics repairman in radios and televisions. Her health and her family's health are not particularly robust. Her children suffer from asthma and her own health has been only fair.

Written by Nancy Lewis and Randy Fay, Kiva Fellows

loans.use: Purchase new clothes for resale

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
Hello my name is Oscar and my main activity is selling bakery products (bread and donuts) as a street vendor in the city of El Paraíso. I’ve been doing it for a year and it’s the activity that allows me to maintain my family. Thanks to this business I can give an education to my children.

Translated from Spanish by Augusto Salazar, Kiva volunteer.

Hola mi nombre es Oscar, mi actividad principal es la venta de Ornado (Pan de casa y roquillas, las que distribuyo de manera ambulantes en la ciudad de El Paraíso, cuento con un año de dedicarme a este tipo de actividad, la que me genera ingresos para los gastos de mi familia y otros compromisos, gracias a este negocio puedo dar educación a mis hijos.

loans.use: Purchase of bread, donuts, quesadillas and culin.

loans.name: Tranquilina

texts.es:
Tranquilina is 60 years old, married, with 3 married grown children. Her husband is 63 year old Máximo Fretes, a businessman, and together they run a mini-market.

Tranquilina worked as a vendor from a very young age, and today she owns her own business where she sells all kinds of basic necessities, such as fruit, vegetables, oil, flour, rices, pop, candy, items for the home, etc.

They have had the mini-market for 3 years and it is going well, they have a solid clientele and ample stock of merchandise with good prices.

She says thanks to the loans she has been able to maintain her business well stocked and obtain the best prices by buying in large quantitites. She is asking fo ra loan to buy merchandise in large quantities, such as sugar, tea, noodles, flour, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Tranquilina tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y tiene 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, casados y que viven con sus respectivas parejas. Su marido es el señor Máximo Fretes de 63 años, es comerciante y juntos atienden un mini mercado que tienen.

Tranquilina trabajo desde muy joven como vendedora, hoy día ella posee su propio comercio donde vende todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, tales como frutas, verduras, aceite, harina, arroz, gaseosas, golosinas, artículos para el hogar, etc.

Hace ya tres años que mantienen dicho negocio y por lo que cuenta le va muy bien, tiene buena clientela formada y un surtido stock de mercaderías con muy buenos precios.

Ella dice que gracias a los créditos obtenidos ha podido mantener su negocio bien surtido y obtiene mejores precios al comprar en grandes cantidades. Solicita el crédito para comprar mercaderías en grandes cantidades, tales como azúcar, yerba, fideo, harina, etc.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in large quantities, including sugar, tea, noodles, flour, etc.

loans.name: Ester's Group

texts.en:
Ester N. wants to expand her business to wholesale sales rather than being a retail trader. She wants to use the loan to expand her premises. She wants to open a supermarket and import products at cheaper prices to generate higher profits. She wants to become a wholesaler to various retail shops in the area.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To expand to wholesale sales

loans.name: Gladys Ernestina

texts.es:
Food and drink sales are very common in the city of León, especially in markets such as la Terminal. Cognizant of this, Mrs. Gladys Ernestina A. has been working in this business for 20 years in order to both cover the household expenses and pay for her children’s education.

She started her business with a capital of $200.00 USD. She has been working with Ceprodel, obtaining loans that have greatly benefited her business, causing her sales to increase by acquiring greater amounts of products to prepare her dishes and make her delicious drinks that only she can prepare.

She has obtained 18 loans from Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

La venta de comida y refrescos es un negocio muy común en la ciudad de León específicamente en los mercados como la Terminal. Consiente de esto, la señora Gladys Ernestina A. se dedica desde hace 20 años a este negocio para apoyar a sus hijos en las necesidades del hogar y el pago de los estudios

Inició su negocio con un capital de U$ 200 y desde hace tres años ha trabajado con Ceprodel obteniendo créditos que han beneficiado grandemente su negocio por lo que ha aumentado sus ganancias y adquirido mayores volúmenes de materia prima para elaborar los alimentos y de igual manera para elaborar sus deliciosos refrescos que solo ella sabe preparar.

Su record crediticio actual es de 18 créditos con Ceprodel

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients to prepare food and drinks

loans.name: Raúl Rodolfo

texts.es:
Thank you for the first loan. With that loan, I was able to buy the tools I needed. I am currently requesting a loan of $1,200.00 USD in order to buy electrical goods to sell in my business, thus increasing my inventory and offering new electronics to my customers.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Gracias por el primer préstamo con el pode comprar las herramientas que me estaban haciendo falta. Ahora estoy solicitando un préstamo de $1,200.00 Dlls. Para compra de aparatos eléctricos para vender en el negocio y así tener más inventario y también ofrecerles este tipo de servicios a mis clientes de venta de los aparatos eléctricos nuevos.

loans.use: Purchase of electrical goods

loans.name: Sukarti

texts.en: Sukarti adalah seorang pemulung yang setiaphari aktifitasnya mencari barang-barang bekas. Tinggal di jalan Bedahulu dengan mengontrak sebuah kamar dengan harga 150.000/bulan. Dengan menggunakan gerobaknya Sukarti menjalankan aktifitasnya sebagai seorang pemulung. Dengan menyusuri lorong-lorong perumahan, pasar, gedung-gedung dengan tujuan untuk mendapatkan barang-barang bekas, lebih sering Sukarti membeli barang-barang bekas dari para ibu-ibu rumah tangga yang suka mengumpulkan barang yang sudah tidak terpakai lagi. Barang-barang bekas tersebut ditimbang dan dihargai sesuai dengan kualitas barang. Dana yang didapat dari DINARI digunakan sebagai modal untuk membeli barang bekas dari para pengepul. Harapannya bersama keluarga semoga keadaan ekonomi keluarga mereka semakin membaik di masa yang akan datang.

loans.use: modal untuk membeli barang-barang bekas

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria Toleda is a calm, honest and very hardworking woman who started her own business in order to supplement her income after the death of her husband, since the money she received from his pension wasn't enough to provide for her two children. She started working for herself in February of 1993, when the family owned a taco stand at their local market, started thanks to a loan they had received. But after her husband passed away, Gloria wasn't able to maintain the business on her own and had to sell it. Afterwards, she worked selling various products in order to support her children. Then a friend invited her to take a craft class, which she really enjoyed. This led her to start her own craft business, with her friend sending her customers. So far, her customers have been very satisfied with her work and have been recommending her products to relatives and other friends, allowing Gloria's business to keep growing.

Now Gloria is seeking a $450 loan, to be repaid in 5 months, in order to buy the basic materials that she uses to make her products and be able to fill all of her orders. Your generosity will help Gloria continue to move forward with her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Chegezy, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria T. es una persona tranquila, honesta y muy trabajadora inició el negocio por la necesidad de tener otro ingreso, ya que su esposo falleció y la pensión que le dejó no me era suficiente. Necesitaba tener un ingreso que le permitiera sacar adelante a sus hijos ya que tuvo que hacerse cargo de sus hijos. Comenzó en Febrero de 1993, antes de fallecer su esposo tenían una taquería en el mercado que habían puesto gracias a un crédito que obtuvieron, pero después de fallecer yo ya no pudo atenderla por lo cual tuvo que traspasarla y se dedico a vender diversas cosas para sostener a sus hijos, fue entonces que una amiga la invitó a tomar un curso de manualidades el cual le gustó mucho, animándose a poner su negocio y su amiga le comenzó a enviar clientes, los cuales quedaban contentos con su trabajo y la iban recomendando entre sus familiares y amistades y desde entonces le ha ido muy bien.

Ahora solicita un crédito por US $450 que pagara en 5 meses para comprar materia prima que le permita seguir elaborando adornos y poder surtir los pedidos de sus clientes. Con tu ayuda Gloria seguirá adelante.

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Sithat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sithat M., 43, and her husband, Mr. Yat Choen, were married in 2000 and have two sons, one of whom is in school. The family lives on an island on the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. Yat is a silk weaver, a skill he learned from his wife.

Mrs. Sithat, who learned from her mother, has been a silk weaver for 21 years. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who then sells them in Phnom Penh. Mrs. Sithat is requesting a loan of $150 to purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.use: To purchase silk material for weaving.

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas S., 28, is the mother of two children and resides with her husband (pictured because Meas was not at home) in Phnom Penh. Both have obs to support their family. Meas is employed by a garment factory and her husband, Vong Saran, is a driver in a company. Collectively they earn about $8 each day. Even though they both have a job, they sometimes still face financial crisis. The inflation rate in Cambodia is currently out of control so it's hard for the low or average income makers to handle their standard of living each day. The prices of goods are extremely expensive, even rice and gasoline.

Some people have to seek another source of income in order to sustain their living. Mrs. S. and her husband are trying to seek another source of income by requesting a loan from KIVA to purchase a motor-bike for her husband to operate a motor-taxi when he is available from his work. This will provide their family with an additional source of income. In the future, they plan to set up a coffee shop.

loans.use: Meas would like to purchase a motor-bike to operate a motor-taxi.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
Nancy, a diligent 23 years old, became a mother at the age of seventeen and to support her child, and without hesitation, she started a business selling CDs and DVDs in the town of Santa Lucia. Due to her ability and customer care, her business is growing steadily and customer orders are increasing.

She would like to expand her business and fulfil her existing orders. She therefore requires your financial support in the form of a loan, repayable over six months, to purchase CDs and DVDs.

Translated from Spanish by MuseAndThinker, Kiva Volunteer

Nancy fue madre a los 17 años, desde entonces sin pensarlo dos veces decidió emprender su negocio de venta de CDs y DVDs, negocio ubicado en el pueblito de Santa Lucía, gracias a su predisposición para este negocio y a la amabilidad con las que atiende a sus clientes, su negocio poco a poco va creciendo, aumentando cada vez sus pedidos, los cuales Nancy desea complacer.En estos momentos esta diligente madre, ya de 23 años desea ampliar e implementar su negocio, para ello requiere de vuestro apoyo económico para la compra de CD y DVD, dinero que será rembolsado en un lapso no mayor de los 6 meses.

loans.use: Purchase of stock for her business of selling CDs and DVDs

loans.name: Taku Ligueye De Thiaroye 2 Group

texts.fr: Nous femmes du Gie Taku LiG., sommes très reconnaissantes et satisfaites de kiva. Nous n’avons jamais bénéficié de prêt avant  l’arrivée de Kiva. Avec  le premier prêt, nous avons acheté des  produits d’entretien et de nettoyage à bas prix (eau de javel,  balai, détergents etc... ) que nous avons revendu sur le marché et avons travaillé même avec d’autres associations de femmes pour une bonne distribution des produits. La vente à été bonne. Ce qui nous a permis de collecter des bénéfices nous permettant de payer à temps et même avant l'échéance du contrat de prêt. Grâce à ce premier prêt, nous avons pu faire face à de nombreux problèmes d’ordre familial, social. De ce fait, nous sollicitons un 2e prêt afin de pouvoir continuer, diversifier nos activités de commerce et améliorer notre rendement.
texts.en:
We, the women of the economic interest group Taku LiG., are very grateful for and satisfied with Kiva. We have never benefited from a loan before Kiva’s arrival. With the first loan, we purchased maintenance and cleaning products (bleach, brooms, detergents, etc….) at low prices that we brought to the marketplace and have even worked with other women’s associations for the right distribution of these products. Sales have been good. This enables us to collect some profit, allowing us to make our payments on time, per the loan contract, and even to make them ahead of time. Thanks to this initial loan, we have been able to cope with numerous social and family-related problems. Given this, we are requesting a second loan to continue and to diversify our work in commerce and to improve our returns.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell maintenance and cleaning products for the home

loans.name: Soklay's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Soklay C. (shown in the picture on the right with his wife and group members) was selected to be a group leader for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including him. All the group's members live along National Road Number Two, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

1-Mr. Soklay C., 53, and his wife, Mrs. Nara Sor, 47, were married in 1983 and have four children: one son and three daughters. One of their children was married and lives away from the family, two children have full time employment and the youngest studies in the local school. Soklay has been a motor taxi driver for twenty years, while his wife stays at home. Soklay is requesting a $300 loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace his old one, to be used as a taxi.

2-Mr. Rithy S., 43, and his wife, Mrs. Sopheap Keo, 37, were married in 1987 and have two sons and two daughters. Rithy has been a motor taxi driver for ten years. His wife stays at home and takes care of their children. Rithy is requesting a $200 loan to build a wall for his house.

3-Mr. Senghoir T., 31, and his wife, Mrs. Srey-on Kuch, 25, were married in 2003 and have two sons. Senghoir has been a motor taxi driver for five years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for ten years. Senghoir is requesting a $200 loan to repair his motorbike and some part of his house.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle and repair house.

loans.name: Libna

texts.es:
La Señora Libna, socia del Grupo de Crédito Mientras Tanto “San Marcelo”, vive en la región  y  provincia de San Martín, distrito de Tarapoto. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, bebidas gasificadas y refrigerios. El negocio está ubicado en su propia casa en el Jr. 16 de mayo S/N, lugar donde acuden diariamente a comprar sus clientes, los cuales son mayormente trabajadores de un aserradero que está cerca de su casa.

Con el préstamo recibido de S/.800, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, comprará  productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar en saco, leche, aceite, conservas en cajas de diferentes tamaños, papel higiénico en paquetes, detergentes, jabones de diferentes marcas y tamaños, también comprará una licuadora y una vitrina que tanta falta le hace para implementar su venta de refrigerios y así poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes. 

Libna tiene 43 años, vive con su esposo y sus 02 nietas, a quienes ella atiende con mucho  gusto porque está apoyando a que su hija pueda trabajar. Es una mujer muy trabajadora  y con muchas ganas de sacar adelante su negocio, porque le gusta lo que hace y su meta  es continuar con el negocio, seguir creciendo y tenerlo bien surtido para la satisfacción de ella y la de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Libna, is a member of the group "San Marcelo." She lives in the Region and Province of San Martin in the district of Tarapoto. She sells groceries, bottled drinks and sodas. Her business is located in her own home, where she welcomes her customers on a daily basis, the majority of whom are workers who are employed at the sawmill that is close to her home. The loan of $275 will be repaid in 6 months and she will use it to buy products to resell such as rice, sugar, milk, oil and conserves in various size jars, toilet paper, detergents, different brands and size soaps. She will also buy a blender and a display case she will use to sell her refrigerated items and give a better service to her customers. Libna is 43 years old and she lives with her husband and her two grandchildren, whom she takes care of because she is helping her daughter who can't bring her children to work. She is a hard working woman who wants to see her business succeed. Her goal is to see her business continue to grow and to keep it well stocked for her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kristin Connor, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, milk, cooking oil etc.

loans.name: Emira

texts.en:
Emira was born in 1950 and lives by herself in Gračanica, a village in Bosnia. Emira has two primary businesses. She sells clothes and shoes at a local market, and she also works as an account manager, helping people to monitor their finances. She has used two microfinance loans in the past to help her develop these businesses. Emira used her first loan to buy clothes that she resold at a profit and she used her second loan to purchase a computer so she could work as an account manager from her home.

Now, Emira is hoping to develop a third business. Using her computer, she can prepare promotional materials for local businesses and schools. She requests a loan of 400KM from Women for Women, International which she will use to buy a scanner and printer to support this business venture.

loans.use: To buy a scanner and printer

loans.name: Esther Del Socorro

texts.es: La profesora Esther, soltera, de 46 años de edad, trabaja en el Colegio San Francisco de Asis de Juigalpa como docente, con 25 años de servicio, esta solicitando su 7mo credito el que utilizara para realizar mejoras en su vivienda, levantar paredes a un espacio techado que tiene para convertirlo en una cocina, ya que esta al aire libre, es una persona sin ayuda, cuenta con su salario solamente, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 20 años, no estudian ni trabajan porque son discapacitados.  Ella ha pagado con responsabilidad sus 6 creditos anteriores conservando hasta el momento la categoria "A".  Desea que le continuemos apoyando, pues considera que AFODENIC es una institucion que si esta al servicio de los desposeidos.
texts.en:
Esther is 46 years old, single, and has worked for twenty-five years as a teacher at Saint Francis of Assisi High School in Juigalpa. She is asking for her seventh loan, which she will use to make improvements to her home. She wants to put up walls in an area of her home that already has a roof in order to have an enclosed kitchen, not one open to the elements.

Esther is without additional financial support, and must rely solely on her own salary to make ends meet. She has two disabled children, ages eighteen and twenty, who are unable to work or attend school. She has responsibly repaid all six of her previous loans, and is considered an “A-list” borrower. She hopes that we will continue to support her as she considers Kiva's partner AFODENIC an institution devoted to the service of the dispossessed.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To put up walls to build a kitchen

loans.name: Irma Nidia

texts.es:
La señora Irma Nidia M. B. tiene 70 años, pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Emprendedoras II y vive en la calle Trujillo 636 del Puerto Marítimo Salaverry de la provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Estudió secundaria completa y se caso a los 20 años, tiene 4 hijos y una hija que es su socia en su negocio. Todos sus hijos están casados.
Irma se dedica a confeccionar peluches, bolsas para regalitos de cumpleaños, piñatas, etc., de acuerdo a los pedidos que le hagan, lo realiza en su casa.
El primer crédito fue de 300 soles cancelado en 4 cuotas, con lo que compró material para confeccionar peluches.
Con este crédito de 1200 soles que será cancelado en 6 cuotas comprará material para la temporada de Navidad.
Irma desea de todo corazón tener una fábrica de peluches y artesanía.
texts.en:
Mrs. Irma Nidia M. B. is 70 years old and belongs to the Community Bank "Las Emprendedoras II" (The Enterprising Women II). She lives at 636 Trujillo Street in the Salaverry Port, in the province of Trujillo, in the state of La Libertad, Peru. She completed secondary school and got married when she was 20 years old. She has 4 sons and a daughter, who is her business partner. All of her children are married. Irma works making stuffed animals, gift bags, piñatas, etc. She completes the orders people give her from her home. Her first loan of 300 soles was canceled in 4 payments. She used it to buy material to make stuffed animals. With this loan of 1200 soles, which will be repaid in 6 payments, she will buy material for the holiday season. Irma wishes with all of her heart to have an arts and crafts factory.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material for the holiday season

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia S., 46, a resident of Abofour, a farming community in the Ashanti region, is the married mother of four children, all currently attending school.

To support her family, Afia has been selling yams for five years, having previously been a farmer. She treks to farming communities such as Kintampo to buy her yam stocks, sometimes spending days in the villages just to secure sufficient quantities, thereby eliminating the need to purchase from higher-priced middlemen.

With this loan request, Afia plans to secure yams in bulk to better serve her customers and increase her profits, thus enabling her to better support her husband in funding their children’s education.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk.

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married and has a son. She works hard to be able to provide for her family and pay all the bills, especially in this time of financial crisis in Ukraine. Olena runs a small vending business selling clothing items and footwear in the central market in Belaya Tserkov. She has been in the trade for over 2 and half years. Presently, she has about 15,000 Grivnas invested in inventory. Her net profit exceeds 2,200 Grivnas.

Olena is hoping to use the loan of 5000 Grivnas to purchase additional better quality merchandise at wholesale price which would help her increase proceeds from sales. Olena could double her inventory since she had got her first loan. Moreover, profit generated would help her continue saving for her own housing which has been Olena’s dream for many years.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Maricruz

texts.es:
En el municipio de El Sauce de la ciudad de León la señora Maricruz L. se dedica a dos actividades siendo una de ellas la ama de casa el cual atiende su hogar y dedica su tiempo a su pequeño hijo en edad escolar y la otra es la venta de ropa ambulantemente en las calles del municipio.

Ella ha logrado combinnar las dos actividades y es por esto que ha logrado salira adelante en el negocio. Hoy en día se le ha agotado la ropa y para ello ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra y así continuar con su comercialización en su municipio.
texts.en:
In the municipality of El Sauce in the city of León, Mrs. Maricruz L. works two jobs: first, as a housewife, taking care of her household and spending time with her small school-aged son, and second, selling clothes on the streets. She has succeeded in combining these two activities, and because of this has succeeded in advancing her business. Now she has run out of clothing and is looking to Ceprodel for a loan so she can buy more and continue her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba A. is 46 years old. She is married and a mother with two children. Currently one is in the university and the last born is also in senior high school. Her husband works with a cocoa nut grove hotel. They live together in their hometown called Elmina in the central region of Ghana.

Araba loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her livelihood. She has been selling yams, gari (cassava grits), cassava, and plantains for twenty years to support her family. She treks to farming communities to buy her stock of food items from the farmers. This saves her the expense of middlemen who buy from the farmers and re-sell to her at higher prices.

With this loan, she wants to buy yams, gari, plantains and cassava in bulk to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to keep her children in school. Araba belongs to the village bank called ‘Nyame Beba’ meaning "God will come". She would be grateful for your assistance. She hopes to receive GHS 1000 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy yams in bulk

loans.name: Agrepina

texts.es: Agrepina tiene  51 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos menores en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta de animales, tiene un establo de ganado vacuno y ovino, cada día se  levanta temprano para atenderlos, cortar el pasto suficiente para su alimentación, y en la mayoría de las ocasiones los lleva a pastear a espacios abiertos con abundancia de pastizales, luego regresa para guardarlos en su establo. Principalmente cría ovejas y vacas, cada fin de semana, junto con su esposo, venden sus animales en las ferias y mercados ganaderos de su zona, y estas ganancias con las que cubren los gastos familiares. Agrepina y su esposo sueñan con tener un establo más grande, que les permita tener más animales, y están dispuestos a asumir un trabajo duro para lograrlo. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy contenta de formar parte de su banco comunal porque es un espacio de crecimiento económico y se compromete a ser una cliente activa y puntual. El dinero que viene solicitando es para aumentar su ganado, comprará más ovejas.
texts.en:
Agrepina is 51 years old and lives with her husband and two young children in their own house. She sells animals, and has a stable of cows and sheep. Every day she wakes up early to attend to them, to cut grass for them to eat, and usually to take them out to pasture as well before later returning them to the stable. Every weekend, she and her husband sell the animals at fairs or animal markets in the area, and these profits cover their family expenses. Agrepina and her husband dream of having a larger stable which will allow them to have more animals, and they are willing to do the work to achieve that goal. This is the first time that she has solicited a loan from MFP. She is very happy to form a part of the community bank because it is a space of economic growth, and she promises to be an active client who is regular with her payments. The money that she is requesting is for buying sheep.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sheep

loans.name: Mrs. Chreob Lim Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twenty one people living I. Sdau Kanleng village I. Kandal province comprise this village bank loan, and they will use the loan for various purposes. Mrs. Chreob L. is 31 years old and acts as village bank president. She is employed I. a garment factory and also breeds pigs. As her pigs are getting bigger and bigger and she does not have enough money to buy pig food to breed them, she has decided to request a loan for this purpose. Her husband, Mr. Chim Samnang, is a security guard and they have three children, two of whom are enrolled I. the local school, while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

Two members I. this group loan are end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s maI. product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy pig food to breed pigs.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en:
Asha has owned a small charcoal store in the Sakina neighborhood of Arusha for five years. She belongs to the Amken loan group (code 2022). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $185. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so she can buy more charcoal to add to her stock. Asha is hoping her profit will increase so she will be able to grow her business.

Asha is 23 years old, married, and has two children: ages six and five.

loans.use: Buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Maria Angelina

texts.es:
la Sra. Maria Angelina G. tiene 59 años de edad, esta casada y tienen 5 hijos de los cuales 3 de ellos dependen de ella y estan en el colegio.
ella tiene una pequeña pulperia y su fuerte es la venta de golosinas como ser tacos, enchiladas, tortillas con quesillo, burritas, baledas y refrescos.
el negocio de las golosinas le deja muy buena ganancia y con esas ganancias le esta invirtiendo dinero a la pulperia, porque ella desea tener una pulperia grande y que a la par tenga su negocio de golosinas. su meta en un futuro es tener un supermercado.
ella necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con sus negocios, nos comento que esta muy feliz ya que siente que todo le esta saliendo muy bien y que de ahora en adelante todo sera mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Angelina G. is 59 years old and married. She has five children, three of whom are still in school and depend on her financially. Maria has a small store and she also sells foods like tacos, enchiladas, tortillas with cheese, burritos, baleadas, and soft drinks. The food sales provide good earnings and Maria is using them to invest in her store. She'd like to have a large store and combined with the food sales business, build it into a supermarket. Maria needs a loan to get ahead with her businesses. She tells us that she's very happy because she feels like business is good and now that she is ahead everything will be much better.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ground beef, pork, and chicken, tomato salsas, cabbage tortillas, butter, oil, salt, cheese, and soft drinks

loans.name: Lino

texts.en:
Lino T., 47, is married with four children. She has two years of experience in her plantation business. She sells to the public and villagers four days per week and expects her weekly net cash flow to be 160 Tala (~60 USD). She has no previous loan with SPBD.

SPBD loans are Lino’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of fertilizers, a spade, axes, chemicals and knives

loans.name: Nguyễn Thị

texts.en:
A. Nguyễn Thị (1401030064) is a 43-year-old womA. living in the town of Quảng Xương. She is married and has two adult children.

A. owns and operates a manufacturing business, primarily manufacturing and selling mattresses to local businesses and community members. A. has been engaged in this business for over twenty years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month.

In 2004, A. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loA. of 9,000,000 VND from TYM Fund. This previous loA. was used to invest in expanding her business.

A. is now requesting a new loA. of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings. The loA. will be her 7th from TYM Fund. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional raw materials to expand her product offerings

loans.name: Natig

texts.en: Natig was born in 1984. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of the Azerbaijan Fuzuli region, now settled in Khirdalan town. He is single. Three years ago, he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy spare parts to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: Edgar tiene 24 años, es un joven tranquilo y trabajador, vive en la casa de su madre, a quien desea darle una vida mejor. Su trabajo es el tejido artesanal, con la ayuda de su madre realiza hermosos trabajos, para luego llevarlos a vender a su pequeño puesto en el mercado San José (mercado importante de la ciudad de Juliaca). Aunque todavía es muy joven, sabe que tiene una responsabilidad con su madre y es por eso que trabaja sin descanso. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es tejer y más a aun si son artesanías, lleva 3 años en este negocio y considera que lo más difícil es trasladar los tejidos hasta su puesto de venta, aun así sabe que ese es su trabajo y que tiene que cumplirlo. Para el futuro espera tener una tienda mejor ubicada y vender con mayor comodidad sus artesanías. Este es su cuarto préstamo con MFP, Edgar nunca ha tenido problemas en sus pagos, pues siempre ahorra para pagarlos a tiempo. En su banco comunal es muy querido, pues siempre es muy puntual y responsable. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados comprará más lana para aumentar su producción y así mejorar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Edgar is 24 years old and is a peaceful and hard-working youth. He lives with his mother, to whom he would like to provide a better life. His is a weaver and, with his mother´s help, does beautiful work, which he later takes to sell at his small stand in the San José market (an important market in the city of Juliaca). Although he is still young, he knows that he has to take care of his mother and this is why he works tirelessly. What is likes most about his work is to weave, more so if the weavings are crafts. He has been in business for 3 years and feels that the most difficult part is transporting the weavings to their point of sale, although he knows that this is his job and he has to do it. In the future he hopes to have a store with a better location so he can sell his goods in more comfortable surroundings. This is his fourth loan with MFP. Edgar has never had problems with his payments, he saves so that he can make payments on time. He is well-liked at his communal bank because he is always punctual and responsible. With the money requested he will buy more wool to increase his production and thus improve his sales.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase wool.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth A. is from the village of Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 28 years old. Ruth is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ruth owns & operates a business weaving and selling "sawali" or woven bamboo wall to local businesses and community members. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ruth joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Ruth from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
“Try and try until you succeed” is the guiding principle of Milagros M. from the village of Bonfal Proper, Bayombong, Nueva Vizcaya. She have four children who are studying in the tertiary and secondary level of education. She is a responsible mother to them and wishing them their success in the future. They wanted them to become successful in their chosen career so that they will have a bright future in return.

In this regard, she and her husband Benjamin are helping one other to earn a living and support the education of their children. They cultivate their farm by planting rice and vegetables. Furthermore, Milagros is engaged in selling dried fish and fish sauce in their village through house to house delivery. She is borrowing additional business capital of PHP18, 000 that will be used in the development of her vending business. According to her, because of patience, she is able to generate the amount of PHP900 weekly income from her business. Her business income is really of big help to the needs of her family. She hopes to improve the loan she is borrowing by investing into the development of her selling business.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Benon's Group

texts.en: Benon M. is 43 years old and is the leader of his group in Bushenyi. He is married with four children whose ages range from 17 years old to 4 years old. Mr. M. has been running a cattle business for six years. His strategy has been to buy undernourished looking cows at low costs and then to feed them hearty diets and provide them with proper care, so that they then may regain full health and be sold at higher prices.  Benon would like to use the loan to buy more medicine for his cattle, so he may further improve their health. He believes that his productivity and hard working nature will give him an edge against competitors and allow him to eventually scale his business so that he may begin selling his cattle in large quantities at local town centers. Benon hopes that his business will continue to expand so that he may better provide for his family.

loans.use: Proper Medicines for Cattle

loans.name: Djekadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Djekadi de l’association Miniankaton est composé de femmes mariées de la ville de Tominian, région de Ségou quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 25 ans et au moins  3 enfants.
Les femmes du groupe font le petit commerce d’articles divers à Tominian il y’a environ 10 ans. 
Pour rentabiliser leurs activités, les membres du groupe Djekadi de l’association Miniankaton ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui ils sont à leur premier prêt.   
Le prêt actuel sera utilisé pour l’achat  d’articles  divers de commerce.  
Ces activités sont très rentables pour ces femmes qui effectuent leur vente en détail et à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. 
Les membres du groupe Djekadi comptent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel de 10 000 FCFA à 15 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt  et les dépenses courantes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group Djekadi of the Miniankaton Association is made up of married women of Tominian town, Segou region( fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali) They live in traditional families and have average age of 25 years and at least 3 children. The women of the group do petty trading of various items in Tominian for about 10 years. To make profit on their businesses, members of group Djekadi of the Miniankaton Association decided to be part of the loan program of Soro Yiriwaso with which they are on their first loan. The current loan will be used to purchase various items for trading. These businesses are very profitable for these women who sell by retail and to mainly female customers. The members of group Djekadi intend to make a monthly profit of 10 000FCFA to 15 000FCFA each which will be used for the repayment of interest on the loan and the daily expenses of the family.

Translated from French by Cletus Kuunifaa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Firuza

texts.en:
A. Firuza is 23 years old. She is living with her parents and two sisters. She is a well-known seamstress in her community, seeing as she has been working there for more than three years.
