Firuza decided to take advantage of her reputation and bought a tailoring machine. Since than, she has been providing the services of a tailor. This entrepreneur says that she has a well-established clientele, the majority of whom are young girls who often order national dresses. In this way, she constantly adds new clients and has seen her business grow. Now she is requesting a loan of $700 US to purchase a new modern sewing machine. You can help improve the quality of life of her family. Firuza and her family are grateful for your generosity and support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase a new sewing machine

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 37 years old, married, and has two children. He has fifteen years of experience in this business and established his shop ten years ago. He has a good reputation in the market and, therefore, he has a lot of customers.

He wants to put more inventory in his shop with this loan in order to supply the needs of his customers and to increase his income.

loans.use: To develop his grocery shop

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es una trabajadora mujer que tiene 47 años, vive con su esposo (Crispín) de 52 años, quien es chofer de transporte de carga pesada; con él tiene 7 hijos, los cuales se encuentran estudiando en la capital (Lima) ,diferentes carreras y los menores en diversos colegios. 

Todos los días se levanta muy temprano y empieza la jornada laboral en sus tierras, pues tiene 40 hectáreas en las que produce café, plátano, palta y cítricos, los cuales ella misma cultiva y cuida. Cuando es tiempo de cosecha vende sus frutos a mayoristas que transportan la carga a la ciudad y este negocio le es muy rentable, pues le alcanza para vivir y ayudar a sus hijos. 
Julia se esfuerza a diario y aunque a veces se siente cansada la empuja a salir adelante el imaginar que sus hijos algún día serán profesionales. Al escucharla  hablar con orgullo que una de sus hijas estudia derecho y la otra educación cualquiera podría imaginar que esta trabajadora señora algún día descansará y tendrá una mejor calidad de vida, además se sentirá orgullosa de haberles dejado la herencia más grande que hay en esta vida, la educación. 
Julia se dedica sola a la agricultura, porque su esposo trabaja todo el día transportando carga pesada e incluso hay varios días que no logran verse, pero ambos persiguen el sueño de seguir ayudando económicamente a sus hijos.

Este es su quinto préstamo con MFP y está segura que cumplirá con cada pago puntualmente. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de abono para asegurar sus tierras y así obtener mejores cosechas futuras.
texts.en:
Julia is a hard-working woman who is 47 years old and lives with her husband (Crispín), 52, who is a truck driver. Together, they have 7 children who can be found at school in the capital city (Lima), pursuing different careers; the younger ones are in various schools. Each day, she rises very early and starts work on her farmland. She has 40 hectares on which she produces crops such as coffee, bananas, avocado and citrus fruits, that she herself plants and tends to. During harvest season, she sells her fruits to wholesalers who transport the products to the city. This business is very profitable, and provides her livelihood and allows her to help her children financially. Julia works hard each day and, even though sometimes she feels tired, she pushes herself to forge ahead with dreams of her children one day becoming professionals. At hearing her speak so proudly about one daughter who is studying law and another education, one can easily imagine that this hard-working woman will one day have a chance at some rest and a higher standard of living. In addition, she feels proud about having given them the best gift one can give in this life: an education. Julia dedicates herself to farming on her own, as her husband works in transportation and days might go by without seeing each other. However, both continue to pursue their dream of helping their children economically. This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she is sure that she will make her payments on time. She will invest the funds she is requesting into the purchase of fertilizer, to ensure that her farmland is healthy and continues to yield bountiful crops in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Mario Jose

texts.es: El señor Marlon  tiene 36 años de edad, casado, con tres hermosos hijos menores de edad, su negocio es la venta de CD, en películas, videos, música, el cual lleva once años es las ventas, vende ambulante, anteriormente vendía leña, carbón, pero se ha dedicado solo a la venta de cd, todo esto lo logro con los préstamo de la institución pues comenzó con poco y luego con la inversión aumento las ventas, con el con el financiamiento,  anterior logro aumentar su inventario, este crédito lo esta solicitando para compara parte de películas y materiales de construcción para repellar las paredes de su casa el cual comprara: arena y cemento para hacer la obra el cual esta contento por poder hacer una mejora en su casa, como en su negocio el cual espera poder tener algún día un lugar fijo
texts.en:
Marlon is 36 years and married with three beautiful young children. He has a business selling CDs, including movies, videos and music. He has run his business for 11 years now as a traveling salesman. He began with a loan, and little by little he invested to grow his business. With the previous loan he was able to increase his inventory. With the new loan, he will purchase more inventory as well as cement and sand to repair the walls in his house. He is happy to be able to make the repairs on his house, as he would like one day to run his business from a fixed location.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Charnes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase inventory for his business selling music CDs and videos, as well as sand and cement to make necessary repairs to the walls in his house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase good containers for carrying milk

loans.name: Modou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Modou S. est menuisier métallique depuis 1998 et gère son atelier avec quelques employés apprentis. Parallèlement à son activité, Monsieur S. s’active dans  l’aviculture, un secteur qu’il a embrassé depuis 2003 sous l’influence d’un de ses amis aviculteurs.
Marié récemment, Monsieur S.  compte augmenter ses revenus en renforçant l’aviculture. C’est ainsi qu’il demande un prêt de 150 000 FCFA  pour acheter 200 poussins et y gérer tous les besoins pour l’aliment des poussins.  Cependant ce jeune âgé de 26 ans  espère avec ce crédit développer et accroitre son business  afin de régler les besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
Modou S. has been a metal worker since 1998 and he manages his own workshop with the help of some trainee workers. At the same time he is also active in poultry farming. He started with this business in 2003, thanks to some friends who were already in the business. Modou S. got recently married and he hopes to enlarge his poultry business in order to increase his revenue. For this reason he requested a loan of 150 000 FCFA to buy 200 poussins and all the necessary to feed them. This young man of 26 years of age hopes that this loan will help him to develop and improve his business in order to provide for his family needs.

Translated from French by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of poussins.

loans.name: Totosa Plus Group

texts.en:
“Totosa Plus” is a group of owners of small businesses chaired by Anne L.. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Anne L. is determined to be a successful businesswoman. She sells pagnes (lengths of brightly colored African print cloth) at the market located northeast of Kinshasa. She became a microentrepreneur in 1994. Anne has already received two loans from Microfinance Institution HOPE DRC and fully repaid them. She intends to use this loan to expand her inventory. She will buy pagnes. Currently she earns a profit of $50 a week. She will seek to make more profit by importing her products herself. Anne is 48 years old, widowed and the mother of six children aged 11 to 29. One of them attends school.

loans.use: To purchase women's clothing (pagnes) to resell

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en:
Luisa B. is from the village of Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 25 years old. Luisa is married and has four infant children. To make a living, Luisa owns & operates a specialized retail store selling rice in the local community. Luisa has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luisa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luisa is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luisa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: As additional working capital

location.town: Tierra Villa Verde, Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misa

loans.name: Marieta's Group

texts.en:
Marieta A. is from the village of Bued, Calasiao, Pangasinan Province. She is 54 years old. Marieta is the group leader for a three-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Marieta is widowed and has four adult children. To make a living, Marieta owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling cosmetics, clothing and shoe products in the local community. Marieta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marieta has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Marieta is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This loan will be Marieta's seventh loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital.

loans.name: Jerry James

texts.en:
Jerry James I. is from the village of Guba Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 41 years old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Jerry James operates a transportation service. He has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 15000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Jerry James joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30000 PHP from GDMPC and is requesting a new loan of 19800 PHP which will be used to repair his vehicle for better service. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Jerry James from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle for better service

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo tiene 32 años, vive en su casa propia al lado de su esposa  Evy (28) y sus 2 menores hijos.
Desde muy joven se dedica a la agricultura, siembra con la ayuda de su esposa frutos cítricos, plátanos y otras frutas, los que luego de meses de constante trabajo y vigilancia puede llegar a cosechar. Hugo sabe que si brinda el tratamiento adecuado a sus plantaciones, éstas crecerán y podrá recoger una buena producción. Asimismo asegura que le gusta mucho su trabajo porque puede mantener a su familia y brindarles una buena calidad de vida. 
Y como es un hombre muy trabajador, que no se cansa de trabajar honradamente, para más adelante tiene planeado sembrar diversidad de frutas en mayor cantidad para lograr aumentar su producción y así obtener mayores ganancias.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y está muy agradecido con todas las personas que hicieron posible el crédito que le permitirá continuar trabajando, además menciona que su banco comunal viene trabajando adecuadamente y que nadie se atrasa en el pago de sus cuotas.

Hugo tiene pensado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de plantas para volver a sembrar, así como fertilizantes y el pago del personal que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Hugo is 32 years old and lives in his own house with his wife Evy (age 28) and their two dependent children. Since he was a young man, Hugo has been engaged in agriculture. With the help of his wife, he grows citrus fruits, bananas, and other fruits that he harvests after months of constant work and vigilance. Hugo knows that if he provides adequate treatment to his crops, then he is able to increase his production and achieve a good harvest. He also says that he enjoys his work because it allows him to support his family and provide them a good life. As a hardworking man, Hugo does not grow tired of working honestly. In order to get ahead, he plans to diversify his fruit crops in greater quantity so that he can increase his production and generate more earnings.

This is his fourth loan with MFP. He is very grateful to everyone who made this loan possible so that he can continue working. Hugo also mentions that his Communal Bank works adequately because no one is behind with their payments. The funds he requested will be invested in the purchase of plants for his new crop, as well as fertilizers. He will also pay for labor to clear his fields.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruits plants & fertilizers; pay for labor to clear his fields

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: Mrs. Seyha Puthy N. is a 27-year-old married woman who lives in Sla village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Her husband, Mr. Vos Khai, is a duck breeder. With both businesses, they can earn a small income to support their family. For duck breeding, Mrs. Seyha Puthy decided to ask for a loan to buy 500 ducks to enlarge her husband business activities. This couple has two children; one is student in the local school and the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: To buy 500 ducks

loans.name: Alejandra Cahilog Group

texts.en:
Alejandra A C. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 63 years old. Alejandra A is the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Alejandra A is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Alejandra A owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Alejandra A has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Alejandra A joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and to have the ability to engage in business activities. Alejandra A has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Alejandra A is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 12th loan taken out by Alejandra A from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en: Trinidad S. is from the village of Poblacion, Manukan. She is 57 years old, is married, and has four adult children. Trinidad owns and operates a restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month. In 2010, Trinidad joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP which will be used as additional capital for her carinderia business. This loan will be her first from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About PMPC: Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her carinderia

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es casado con la Sra. Teresa tiene 2 hijos menores que aun están en la escuela.
El tiene una despensa bien surtida en donde trabaja con su Sra. Esposa, quien la ayuda con la atención del negocio.
Se iniciaron en la actividad con un dinero que recibió el Sr., como parte de una indemnización que había recibido.
 El señor Francisco también se dedica a otras actividades ocasionales como ser venta ambulante.
Los hijos también   les ayudan  en sus horas libres con atención de la despensa.
Son personas muy trabajadoras, y solicitan el crédito para la compra de aceite, arroz, fideos, productos de limpieza y otros productos de primera necesidad.
texts.en:
Francisco is married to Teresa and has 2 young children who are still in school. He has a well-stocked store where he works with his wife, who helps him attend to the business. They started this activity with money that he received as part of compensation that he had received. Francisco also does other occasional activities such as street vending. Their children also help them with the store in their free time. They are very hard-working people, and are requesting this loan for the purchase of oil, rice, pasta, cleaning products and other staples.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of oil, sugar, pasta, rice, cleaning products, pastries and candies

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
Alicia P. is from the village of Cogon, Ozamiz City in Misamis Occidental Province.  Alicia is 58 years old and married with three adult-aged children. To make a living, Alicia owns and operates a flower shop.  The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fresh flowers in the local community. Alicia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Alicia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alicia is requesting her first loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.  She plans to use any additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of the her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a flower shop.

loans.name: Rosavelia

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Rosavelia R. le está haciendo falta más variedad de mercancía y no tiene el capital necesario para la inversión que desea para su negocio.
Este negocio es la fuente de ingresos para su familia, ya que tiene un hijo que actual mente esta estudiando y quiere lo mejor para el.
Solicita el préstamo para que la inversión que necesita su negocio y así tener mas variedad de producto.
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del su negocio.
texts.en:
The business of Ms. Rosavelia R. is lacking a greater variety of merchandise and she does not have the necessary capital to invest in her business the way she would like to. This business is the source of income for her family. She has a son who is in school and she wants the best for him. She is requesting this loan to make the investment she needs in her business, and to offer a greater variety of products. She plans to pay back the loan with the earnings she will make from her business.

Translated from Spanish by Katie Kavanagh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Urpiya's Group

texts.en:
Urpiya M. is the leader of the group. She is 36 and divorced. She has a daughter and a son, both of whom are at school. Urpiya works in the notary office and also sews national cloth and dressmaking supplies. Urpiya started to work as a notary sixteen years ago, and receives a salary in the amount of 4000 soms per month. With money received from the loan, she wants to start repairing her house. She needs money to purchase cement, bricks and other building materials. In the future, Urpiya plans to open a sewing workshop.

Aidan A., 54, is married. She has four daughters and a son. The first son is a shepherd, the second works in Russia, the third serves in the army and the fourth son is a farmer. Aidan and her husband have been breeding livestock for a long time; they have about 70 farm animals. With money received from the loan Aidan wants to purchase 250 kg of feed for livestock.

Zulaiho P. is the treasurer of the group. She is 38 years old and married. She has a daughter and two sons, all of whom are at school. Zulaiho is a dish seller and her husband works in the police department. Zulaiho started her business activities two years ago, with the initial investment of 5000 soms, and now she earns 3000 soms per month. With money received from the loan she wants to purchase a variety of dishes to increase the turnover of her business. In the future Zulaiho plans to expand her business and to save money to be able to give her children a good education. 

Bermet A., 30, is married. She has two daughters. The first daughter is at school and the second is not yet old enough for school. Bermet works in the notary office and her husband works in the police department. Bermet earns 5000 soms per month. She applied for the loan, because she needs money to purchase carpets at a low price. She plans to resell the carpets to make some money. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: To purchase building materials.

loans.name: Imad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 35 years old, is single, and lives with his parents.

In 2006 he opened a gift and stationery shop in an area filled with schools, which are his biggest customers. He has a good reputation and is known in his local community.

He is requesting a loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner, CHF-ACSI which he wants to invest in redecorating his shop and increasing his stock. He is aiming to grow his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To redecorate his shop and increase his stock

loans.name: Sister Abena

texts.en:
Sister Abena E. sells raw maize and as well banku (a local dish made from corn dough and served hot with soup) at Elmina. She is married and has six dependents. Her husband is a trader. She supports her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. She has attained a junior high level of education.

Abena’s loan will be used to buy more bags of maize to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save to build a storehouse.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira T. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 49 years old. Elvira is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Elvira owns and operates a general store. The main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elvira has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,200 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elvira joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Elvira has successfully repaid her previous loan of 15,000 PHP. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Elvira is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP that she will use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be Elvira's fifth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation. Because manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template which enables its field partners to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 30-year-old-single man living alone. He has ten years of experience working as a farmer. He has been running his own farm since 2004. He only cultivates vegetables. He uses plastic tents to grow his products. These tents also allow him to better monitor product quality as well as grow his products for more months during the year. He works independently in his business. 

Today he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase a cultivating machine for his agriculturA. work. He estimates that the loan will help him increase his profits by 15%.  In the future, he is planning to start  cultivation fruit on his land.

loans.use: purchase a cultivating machine

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos  vive en la zona de Achachicala, de la Provincia Aroma del Departamento de La Paz. Está casado y tiene dos hijos. Trabaja como chofer  de transporte de pasajeros en el area urbana de la ciudad con su automóvil, el cual precisa reparaciones de manera urgente. Vive junto a su   esposa y sus dos hijos.

El crédito que solicita es para la compra de un motor para su movilidad y continuar con su negocio que es su única fuente de ingresos. Es el primer  crédito en impro y el primero vía Kiva.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos lives in the District of Achachicala, Aroma Province, Department of La Paz. He is married and has two children. He works as a chauffeur, transporting passengers throughout the urban areas of the city in his automobile. His vehicle is in urgent need of repairs. He lives with his wife and two chidlren.

The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a motor for his vehicle so that he can continue is business, since it is his only source of income. This is his first loan with IMPRO and his first through Kiva.

loans.use: Purchase a motor for his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To complete the necessities of the wedding party

loans.name: Olga B. A.s.

texts.fr: Mariée, Olga est mère D. 2 enfants, tous scolarisés. Elle est dans sa 36ème année. Les charges du foyer reviennent au couple. Dotée d'une expérience D. 4 ans dans son domaine, Olga vend des boissons, des produits cosmétiques et des pagnes dans une boutique dans la ville D. Cotonou, la capitale économique du Bénin. Son fonds D. commerce est bien situé dans la ville D. Cotonou. Ses clients sont constitués des habitants D. sa zone et D. ses environs. Elle s'approvisionne sur place à Cotonou dans les dépôts pour les boissons et au Nigeria et au Togo, deux pays limitrophes au Bénin pour les  produits cosmétiques. Pour renforcer son fonds D. commerce D. diverses marchandises, elle a sollicité et obtenu un micro crédit à FINADEV dans le but D. mieux satisfaire ses clients qui lui sont toujours fidèles. Elle est a son 1er crédit à FINADEV. Le revenu supplémentaire généré par ce micro crédit lui permettra D. se prendre en charge et d'aider son mari dans les charges du loyer, notamment la scolarité et la santé des enfants. Olga est la responsable du groupe. Sur la photo, elle est dans un ensemble à fond blanc avec des fleurs bleues. Elle souhaiterait étendre son activité par l'ouverture d'une seconD. boutique. Elle est la caution solidaire D. EKLOUE Sylvie, qui se trouve à ses côtés dans la photo. Olga et Sylvie sont des amies D. vieilles dates. Pour bénéficier D. ce prêt, elles se sont mises ensembles, s'offrant ainsi garantie mutuelle pour le prêt.
texts.en:
Olga is married and the mother of 2 children, both of whom go to school. She is 36 years old. She and her husband both take care of the family's expenses. 

With 5 years of experience in her field, Olga sells drinks, beauty products and African cloth in a store in Cotonou, Benin's economic capital. She enjoys a good location in the city. Her customers are residents of the neighborhood and the surrounding areas. She obtains her supplies in warehouses for the drinks, and in Nigeria and Togo, countries that border Benin, for beauty products. 

To increase her working capital of various products, she has requested and received a micro-loan from FINADEV in order to better satisfy her customers, who are always loyal to her. This is her first loan from FINADEV. The extra income generated from this micro loan will allow her to meet her own needs and to help her husband with the family's expenses, such as schooling and healthcare for the children. 

Olga is the group's leader. In the photo, she is wearing an outfit with a  white background and blue flowers. She would like to expand her activity and open a second store. She is the co-guarantor for Sylvie Ekloue, who is besiD. Olga in the photo. They have been friends for a long time. To obtain the loan, they grouped together and became mutual guarantors.

loans.use: To buy African cloth, beauty products and canned juices to stock her store and meet her customers' needs.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B., age 33, owns and operates a sar-sari (variety) shop, where she offers such daily-use products as shampoo, soap, detergents, toothpaste, canned goods, and snack foods for sale to members of the local community. Elizabeth has been engaged in her business for over four years and it brings her approximately 10,000 PHP a month. She and her husband live in the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province, and have two school-aged children. 
 
In 2009, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services. She wished to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and was employed as working capital. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase snack foods, canned goods, and other additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Elizabeth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase snack foods, canned goods, and other additional products to sell

loans.name: Fidela Belgica

texts.es:
Fidela de 59 años, es una mujer trabajadora que ha trabajado desde que la abandono su esposo con sus dos hijos. Decidió vender confites  para poder solventar los gastos de la casa pero al pasar del tiempo tuvo una buena acogida por eso que comenzó a vender víveres.

Viviendo en una zona periurbana ha trabajado en una pequeña tienda que ella ha puesto en la parte delantera de su casa. En la actualidad trabaja en su pequeña tienda desde las 06h00am hasta las 21h00pm. Una de las complicaciones que tiene con el negocio es la época de lluvia y esto hace que se les dificulte a sus clientes comprar la mercadería que ella vende. Vende arroz, azúcar, enlatados, bebidas en su pequeña tienda. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar sacos de arroz, bebidas, enlatados para su tienda. En el futuro quiere que sus hijos se desempeñen profesionalmente y poder incrementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fidela is 59 years old.  She is a hard-working woman who has workedever since her husband abandoned her and their two children.  She decided to sell confectionery in order to cover her household expenses but over time her business became popular and so she started selling food products.

Fidela lives in a peri-urban area.  She works in a small store that she set up in the front part of her home.  She currently works in her small store from 6.00am to 9.00pm.  One of the problems that she has with her business is that it is the rainy season which makes it difficult for her customers to come and buy the merchandise that she sells.  Fidela sells rice, sugar, canned goods and drinks in her small store.  She would like to use her loan to buy sacks of rice, drinks and canned goods for her store.  In the future, she would like her children to become professionals and to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy rice, drinks and canned goods

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is from the town of Banga. She is 35 years old, married and has three children aged 14, 11 and 3. To make a living, Analyn owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector planting and harvesting rice for sale. She works hard to provide her family with food on the table, clothes to wear and other things they need.
Analyn joined Kiva partner, CEVI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Analyn is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase sacks of seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Tungalagtuya

texts.en:
Tungalagtuya D., 35, is married and lives with her husband and two children in the Suhbaatar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. Now they live in a rented house. Her husband drives a taxi and her older daughter attends a local primary school. 

Tungalagtuya graduated from a vocational school as a cook after she finished high school in 1993. She opened a cafeteria at a local transportation center in 2007. Now she operates her cafe at a crowded location and her business has become more stable. 

Tungalagtuya is a sociable person who wants to expand her cafeteria. She is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to replace her kitchen tools and the furniture in her cafe.

loans.use: To buy new tables, chairs and kitchen tools

loans.name: Angoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ANGORITAS” iniciará el ciclo número tres en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal D. Panamericana.  Está compuesta por ocho integrantes, la asociación comunal está dirigida por una mesa directiva y a la cabeza D. la misma se encuentra  una presidenta, la señora Daysi.   L. negocios que las integrantes D. la banca comunal llevan adelante son variados: elaboración D. paquetes con vajilla para regalo, confección D. prendas, Kiosco  D. Salchipapas, venta D. ropa Americana, venta D. edredones, venta D. verduras, costura D. ropa para mascota.
 
La señora Daysi, presidenta D. la asociación comunal, indica que forma parte D. la A.C. “Angoritas”  3 cicL., aproximadamente  año y medio,  el mismo tiempo que tiene el negocio D. venta D. hamburguesas y salchipapas.  La señora Daysi antes no tenía negocio, con su primer crédito pudo comprar lo indispensable para iniciar el negocio, como ser: pan, papa, aceite, salchichas, carne, bolsitas.  El crédito D. este ciclo es para comprar L. insumos por mayor  y D. ésta manera  ahorrar, pues cuando las señoras compran por mayor, el peso es completo y el costo es menor. 
Las ventas se realizan en el Kiosco que le prestó su tía, L. días jueves, sábado y domingo.
Esta forma D. trabajo le da tiempo para atender a sus cinco hijos, desafío que lleva adelante sola, debido a que su esposo falleció.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta D. Pro Mujer, ella responD. que le gustó el hecho D. que le dieran la oportunidad D. recibir crédito con la garantía solidaria ya que no contaba con otra garantía.  También, dijo que el trato D. la asesora era bueno, pues ella le animaba a seguir adelante.
En la reunión se encontraba la mamá D. una D. las socias (la señora que está tejiendo en primera fila), por eso son nueve en la foto.
texts.en:
The Communal Association “Angoritas” is starting its third loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Panamericana Community Center. The group consists of eight members. This Communal Association is led by its Board of Directors. At the head of the Board is the President, Sra. Daysi. The members of the Communal Association engage in various businesses so that they can get ahead. These incluD. making dinnerware to use as gifts, sewing garments, selling sausages and potatoes from a kiosk, selling American brands of clothing, selling quilts, selling vegetables, and making clothing for pets.

Sra. Daysi, the President of the Communal Association, said that she has been a member of “Angoritas” for approximately a year and a half and has participated in three loan cycles. During this time, she has managed a business selling hamburgers and “salchipapas” (sausages and fried potatoes). Sra. Daysi did not have a business before. She used her first loan to buy supplies she needed to start her business such as bread, potatoes, oil, sausages, meat, and paper sacks. The loan for this cycle will be used to buy supplies in bulk, thus allowing her to save some money. Whenever the ladies purchase in bulk, the unit cost per item is less.

Daysi conducts her sales from a kiosk she borrowed from her aunt. Her business is open on Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. By working to this schedule, she is able to take care of her five children. Her greatest challenge is leaving them alone since her husband is deceased.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, Daysi said she enjoys the opportunity to receive a loan with a group guarantee since she currently has no other type of guarantee. In addition, she has been treated well by the staff and is excited about continuing ahead.

The photo shows nine adults because the mother of one of the members (the woman in the front row who is knitting) was present at this meeting.

loans.use: Purchase potatoes, oil, bread, sausages, paper sacks, and condiments

loans.name: Sreyneang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyneang C. (pictured here) is 33 years old and her husband, Mr. Ratana Khut is 43 years old. They have been married since 2002 and have two young children--one son and one daughter. They live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.
 
Sreyneang has been a silk weaver for ten years. Her husband is a security guard. She is asking for her first loan of $300 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Men

texts.en: Men K. is married and resides with her husband in Takeo province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-angkorean temples. K. sells brooms, earning an income of $4 per day. Her two children are employed at the factory, earning an income of $6 per day. Each month, the family has to spend $45 on food and $55 on the other necessary expenses. K. is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be K.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work

loans.name: Maria Elsa

texts.es:
Doña María, tiene 49 años de edad, reside en Cacaopera, departamento de Morazán, se dedica a la venta de papitas, dulces y CD, vive en compañía de su hija Reyna, quien le colabora en las ventas y su hijo Eduardo, que estudia.
Ella tiene 30 años de experiencia, el negocio lo heredo de sus padres, su horario de venta es de 8:00am a 6:00pm, lo atiende en su vivienda y en ocasiones de feria sale a vender, actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de materia prima y mercadería.
Este préstamo le ayudara a crecer adquiriendo lo necesario para la preparación de su venta como papas, dulces, así mismo CD variados, satisfaciendo las exigencias de los clientes. Su objetivo con el negocio es, estabilizar sus ventas en la zona y darse a conocer con los clientes.
texts.en:
Doña María is 49 years old and resides in Cacaopera, Department of Morazán. She sells potato chips, candy, and CDs. Maria lives with her daughter Reyna, who helps her with making sales, and her son Eduardo who is a student.

She has thirty years of experience. Maria inherited this business from her parents. Her hours of operation are from 8am to 6pm. She manages her business from her home and occasionally sells at the fair. At the moment, she is requesting a loan to buy materials and merchandise.

This business will help her grow by being able to acquire items to sell such as potatoes, candy, and various CDs so that she can meet the demands of her customers. Her goals for her business are to stabilize her sales in the area and to get to know her customers.

loans.use: To purchase potatoes, candy, and CDs.

loans.name: Mary Jean

texts.en:
Mary Jean M. is from the village of Taglimao, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 31 years old. Mary Jean is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Jean owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling  canned goods, snack foods & biscuits. She also buys and sells gold dust in the local community. Mary Jean has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mary Jean joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Jean has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Jean is requesting a new loan of 18,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional gold dust & snack foods for her store. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Mary Jean from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional gold dust & snack foods for her store.

location.town: Taglimao, Cagayan De Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mulombi

texts.en:
Mulombi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. 

She operates a tailoring business, selling at retail to her neighbours and passersby. In addition she has a charcoal business which contributes another source of income. Mulombi faces a major challenge of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) she wants to purchase bundles of cloth materials and sacks of charcoal. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of cloth and sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: El Triunfo Group

texts.es:
El contacto para el inicio del presente comité fue la señora Lina Mercedes, quien invito y organizo a sus amigas para formar parte del programa Comité D. Mujeres Emprendedoras.
La sra. Lina Mercedes se dedica a la venta D. ropas, esta acompañada con el señor Victor hace 19 años y tienen cinco hijo estudiantes menores, tres en la primaria y dos a la secundaria. 
La señora Lina solicitó el crédito para la compra D. ropas en general, ya que se dedica a esta venta desD. hace 5 años. Ella sueña con abrir una merceria en su casa y dar lo mejor a sus hijos: educación, alimentación, vestimenta.
texts.en:
This group was created on the initiative of Señora Lina Mercedes, who invited her friends and took the necessary steps for the group to join the program of the Committee of Enterprising Women.

Señora Lina Mercedes sells clothes. She married Señor Victor 19 years ago and they have five children, all minor and going to school: three children attend elementary school and two attend secondary school.

Señora Lina applied for a loan to buy a diversified set of clothes, since she has been in this traD. for five years. Her dream is to open a haberdashery at home and proviD. the best to her children: education, food and clothing.

loans.use: to buy a diversified set of clothes.

loans.name: Clara Maribel

texts.es:
Clara, vive con su madre y dos hijos de 9 y 7 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de meriendas y tortillas, tiene varios años de estar dedicada al negocio, y es la fuente de ingreso con la que cuenta para cubrir las necesidades del hogar.
Clara solicita un préstamo para la compra ingredientes para preparar las meriendas, como pollo, carnes rojas, verduras, condimentos y maíz para las tortillas, con este préstamo solventara la necesidad de materiales para preparar las comidas diariamente.
El objetivo de ella es que como Madre, ver a sus hijas formados académicamente, poderle financiar sus estudios para que puedan superarse.
texts.en:
Clara lives with her mother and two children who are 9 and 7 years of age.  She sells prepared meals and tortillas.  She’s been in this business for several years and it is the source of income she relies on to cover household needs.

Clara is asking for a loan to buy ingredients for her meal preparation like: chicken, red meats, vegetables, condiments and corn to make tortillas.  With this loan she will cover the need for supplies used in daily meal preparation.

Her goal as a mother is to see her children academically prepared, to be able to pay for their schooling so that they can do well in life.

loans.use: buy chicken, red meats, vegetables, condiments and corn to make tortillas.

loans.name: Fely

texts.en:
Fely is married with three children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Fely is a farmer and grows crops and vegetables to earn a living. She has been doing this for 19 years. She has requested a loan to purchase farm supplies and equipment.

Fely has been a member of PMPC for two years.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Melicendra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Calca en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Melicendra; la socia tiene 27 años de edad, la socia es conviviente, La socia tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 3 años de edad; La socia se dedica al comercio minorista, la socia tiene una tienda de abarrotes y la socia desea invertir el crédito para la implementación de  su tienda de abarrotes la socia desea comprar productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar, fideos, harinas, leche para implementar su tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para implementar la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Melicendra, 27, is a member of the “Señor de Huanca” communal bank located in Calca District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

She has a spouse and two children who are 6 and 3 years of age.  She is a retailer.  She has a grocery store and she wants to invest the loan to buy basic need items like rice, sugar, noodles, flour and milk to stock the grocery store.  She is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of products to stock the grocery store.

She is grateful for the support she’ll be granted and commits to make her installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy stock items for her grocery store.

loans.name: Khalida's Group

texts.en:
Khalida sews clothes for neighborhood clients to earn a living for her family. She is is 42 years old and married with a 6-year-old son who has not started his education yet. Her husband is a rickshaw driver providing transport services to passengers. He has been operating his transport business for the past 16 years. As a result, his rickshaw has grown old and on time maintenance is required.  

Therefore, Khalida has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner Asasah for her husband who will replace his rickshaw body with a new one and also do some repair work so it performs better. This will help him save his business asset and also allow him to provide better transport services to his customers. Khalida is hopeful that with the increased income her son will be able to attend school in the near future. She is a new loan applicant and very confident about her family’s bright future.

loans.use: buy a new rickshaw body and make some repairs.

loans.name: Yonatan

texts.en:
Yonatan is a 54-year-old man who retired from a local agency. He is married to Yanse, a 40-year-old housewife. They have six children ages 7 to 23 years old and five of them are still attending school.

After retiring from his job, Yonatan is running a freight car business to support his family as his pension is not sufficient to cover the needs of his family as well as the educational needs of his children. 

Besides running the freight car business, Yonatan also plans to run a poultry business to generate more income. He is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan on five boxes of chicks, feed, and to renovate the cage. He is hoping that his loan application will be approved.

loans.use: To purchase five boxes of chicks, feed, and to renovate the cage.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
This is Sabina, 48, resident of GMA, Cavite City, Philippines. She is married to Jesus, a salesman, and is mother to four children. She, together with her husband and children, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Sabina operates a Bamboo furniture business. She buys Bamboo furniture from a local supplier and sells them at her store. She offers Sala sets, Bed and Tables made from bamboo. She displays her stocks of bamboo furniture in a vacant lot for customers to see. Her customers usually come from the local community and nearby areas. She earns a minimum of Php3100 in profit every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy new stocks of bamboo furniture. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Sabina dreams to be able to give her all her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business and she also hopes to grow her business in the future. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of bamboo furniture for her business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Uganda.  She is single and has 3 children, all of whom are in school. Christine has a business of a retail shop. She has been in this business for 3 years, and she works 6 days out of every week.  

Christine has requested a loan of 200,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO.   She will use the loan to buy more boxes of soap, bags of sugar and cartons of salt.  She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire.  The main business challenges for Christine include defaulters and thieves.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked shop and also to be a wholesaler.  

Christine lives in a home that she rents.   She has access to electricity and to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more  bags of sugar, boxes of soap and cartons of salt

loans.name: Renacer Group

texts.es: Gloria tiene 46 años D. edad  es madre  soltera y tiene 03 hijos, quienes han sido su motivación para seguir luchando, Gloria lleva años  dedicándose  a la venta D. comida,  ella empezó ayudando a su mamá quien también se dedicaba a dicho trabajo poco a poco fue ganando experiencia y es así como Gloria deciD. alquilar un puesto e iniciar su propio negocio, gracias a su arduo trabajo Gloria a sacado adelante  a sus hijos sola ya que nos manifiesta que tuvo que hacer el papel D. padre y madre para ellos, también se dedica a la venta D. bebidas (gaseosas) en su domicilio lo cual obtiene un ingreso mas para su hogar. El deseo D. Gloria es que sus hijos sean profesionales y D. ampliar su negocio. Con el crédito solicitado lo invertirá en su restaurante comprando  platos, ollas, cubiertos, e insumos para la preparación D. sus comidas. La Alcancía Comunal “Renacer” es un grupo conformado por 08 mujeres emprendedoras dedicadas a diversas actividades comerciales, ellos están muy agradecidos con el Programa- Prosperidad ya que hacen posible su progreso.
texts.en:
Gloria is 46 years old and a single mother with three children, who motivate her to continue pushing forward. She has been selling food for years. Gloria started out helping her mother, who was also in the same line of work, and steadily gained experience until she decided to rent a stand and start her own business. Thanks to her hard work Gloria was able to help her children get ahead by herself, having to play the role of both father and mother. She also sells sodas from her home as a way of generating more household income. Gloria’s wishes are to see her children become professionals and to expand her business.

With the loan she requested, Gloria will invest in her restaurant by purchasing plates, pots, cutlery, and supplies for preparing her dishes. The Communal Bank “Renacer” (To Be Reborn) is a group that consists of eight enterprising women who are dedicated to different business activities. They are very grateful for the “Prosperidad” Program, which has maD. their success possible.

loans.use: to buy plates, pots, cutlery, and supplies for preparing her dishes.

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru: Аъзам женат и любящий отец 3 детей. Он занимается изготовлением и продажа национальных блюд: плов, лагман (спагетти), бифштекс и других видов разных национальных блюд. Он сам является шеф-поваром в данном бизнесе. Его столовая находится на центральном рынке местного города и там много народов. Из-за этого у него много постоянных клиентов, которые часто посещает его столовую. Аъзам хотел бы получить займ для того чтобы купить основные средства и частично расширить свой ассортимент пищи.
texts.en: Azam is married and is a loving father of three children.  He is involved in preparation and sales of national food dishes, such as plov (pilaf), lagman (noodles), beefsteak and various other national dishes.  He is the chef cook in this business.  His cafe is located at the central market of his local town, where there is a lot of people.  This is why he has many loyal customers, who often visit his cafe.  Azam wants to obtain a loan in order to buy necessary ingredients and partially expand his food selection.

loans.use: to buy primary ingredients and expand food selection

loans.name: Douglas

texts.en: Douglas is a hardworking business man aged 44. He is married and blessed with four children. For the past six years, he has been practicing dairy farming to earn a living. He also does horticultural farming. In the next 5 years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenya shillings to buy two dairy cows.

loans.use: To buy two dairy cows

loans.name: Taraiya

texts.en:
Taraiya is 63 years old and married to Nchoonga.  He and his wife are blessed with three children. Taraiya is a livestock trader in the area of Bissil where most of his clients are female.  He has been in this business for the last two years and earns an income of KES 4,000 per month.

Taraiya was introduced to Kiva partner KADET LTD by KADET staff.  He is applying for his first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET.  Taraiya plans to use the entire loan to purchase livestock.  He will use the anticipated profit to start a ranch. 

Taraiya hopes to become the best livestock businessman.  He is very focused.

loans.use: To purchase livestock for his trade business.

loans.name: Tania

texts.es: Tania es una mujer joven de 26 años, vive en casa de sus padres junto a su pequeña hija Valentina, a quien le brinda amor de padre y madre. Tania es un ejemplo de madre a seguir, pues trabaja arduamente para su pequeña hija. Hace 01 año empezó a trabajar en el cafetín del colegio de su localidad; donde además vende caramelos, galletas, refrescos, entre otros. Ella se levanta muy temprano para estar en su cafetín junto a su pequeña hija. Lo que mas le gusta de su trabajo es poder estar tranquila junto a su hija a quien le dedica su tiempo mientras espera el recreo de los alumnos para poder atenderlos. Con el tiempo piensa incrementar mas productos para su cafetín y dejar satisfechos a sus principales clientes quienes son los alumnos y docentes de la escuela. Este será su primer crédito con MFP, asegura que aportará puntualmente su cronograma de pagos y agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por permitirle trabajar junto a ellos. Con el crédito solicitado, comprará productos para abastecer su cafetín como: galletas, caramelos, gaseosas, entre otros.
texts.en: Tania is a 26-year old single mother who lives with her parents and her young daughter Valentina. Tania is an exemplary mother; she works very hard for her little girl. A year ago she started to work at a food stand inside the local high school. She sells candy, cookies, soda, and other goods. She wakes up very early to work at the food stand, and she brings her daughter with her. Her favorite part of her job is the free time she has with her daughter while they wait for the students' breaks. She hopes to offer more variety at her food stand in order to satisfy her clients who are the students and teachers at the school. This will be her first loan with MFP, and she pledges to make her payments punctually and is thankful to her fellow community bank members for giving her the opportunity to work with them. With the loan she will purchase products to restock her food stand like: cookies, candies, sodas, and other products.

loans.use: Comprar galletas, caramelos y gaseosas.

loans.name: Chantal

texts.en:
Chantal is 46 years old and is married with six children. She owns a business selling food and soft drinks like Fanta, water and juice in her restaurant.

She has been in this business for four years and the hours of her work are from 6 am until 9 pm every day. She currently employs two people to help her.

Chantal has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her restaurant business by buying more food and drinks such as Fanta, water and juice to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her restaurant by buying more food and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia, de 25 años es una mujer sencilla. Vive en compañía de Juan, su esposo desde hace 6 años. Ambos tienen un hijo: Nilver. Pero cuidan también de su sobrina Melina, pues su mamá falleció cuando apenas era una bebe. Juntos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en el caserío de Aymara. Su corazón es grande, pues su mayor tesoro es la humildad y el amor por las personas. Aunque su sobrina no es su hija, ella la cuida como tal. Por el futuro de los suyos, ella trabaja en la agricultura, sembrando tubérculos como papa, olluco, oca y mashua. Los cuales cuida en sus 10 parcelas de terreno productivo. Lo que más le gusta es pasar su tiempo en el campo, como también viajar a la ciudad de Huancayo, donde vende sus cosechas. Paralelo a ese trabajo también se dedica a la crianza de animales como 6  vacas y 48 ovejas. Cuenta que vende la leche que produce su ganado por litros, como la carne de carnero en la feria de los días viernes por Acostambo. De esa manera obtiene un dinero extra para el hogar. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “los pinos” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación, porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Julia, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa.
texts.en: Julia, 25, and her husband, Juan, have been married for 6 years.  They have a son of their own, Nilver, and a niece, Melina, who they've cared for since her mother died when she was just a baby.  They live in a house they own in the town of Aymara.  Julia has a big heart.  Her greatest virtues are her humility and the love she has for other people.  Even though her niece isn't her own child, she cares for her just as if she was.  Julia is a farmer.  She grows tuber crops common to this area--potatoes, olluco, oca and mashua--on land that she owns.  Spending time on the land is what she likes best, but she also likes going to Huancayo where she sells her crop.  Along with farming, she also raises animals: 6 cows and 48 sheep.  She goes to the market at Acostambo on Fridays, sometimes to sell milk and other times to sell meat.  She uses the income to help support her family.  Julia belongs to the Los Pinos community bank and this is her first MFP loan.  She hopes that you will help her with her plans.  She, in turn, is committed to repaying the loan on time.  She says, too, that she likes her community bank because the members are responsible and supportive.  Your help will allow Julia to buy natural fertilizers for fertilizing her fields.

loans.use: to buy supplies for farming business.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en:
Sokha (in the photo) lives along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penn City. She is a widow with one son and two daughters- one is in school and the others assist their mother in the business. 

Sokha sells jasmine flowers. She buys jasmine flowers from her village and transports them to sell in the market, located in Phnom Penh. Sokha asked for a Kiva loan once. She is now asking for her second loan in the amount of 1,000 USD to continue her business by purchasing jasmine flowers under contract for resale.

loans.use: to buy flowers under contract for resale

loans.name: Palmas Group

texts.es:
Palmas en un grupo solidario muy sociable, el cual se encuentra en su 1° ciclo, conformado por 7 mujeres muy buenas y trabajadoras a quienes les preocupa el bienestar de sus familias. Sus reuniones están ubicadas en Monterrey, Nuevo León.

Marcela es una responsable e inteligente integrante del grupo, tiene 32 años de edad y vive felizmente con sus esposo y sus 2 hijos (cuates niño y niña) los cuales estudian y uno de ellos juega en un equipo de beisbol. Marcela se dedíca a la venta de zapatos, de productos por catálogo, joyería y productos naturales. Le gusta vender de todo y comenzó de la manera mas sencilla vendiendo zapatos, lo cual le ayudó a confiar mas en sus vecinas y darse cuenta si eran responsables. Con el crédito que recibió surtirá tenis y zapatos para la temporada navideña, ya que es lo que la gente mas necesita en estas fechas, además de que así puede ayudar a su esposo con los gastos en el hogar y para la educación de sus hijos.

Uno de los sueños mas anhelados de Marcela es seguir creciendo con el negocio y poder concervar a sus clientes buenos para así a largo plazo comenzár a ofrecer productos naturales para bajar de peso pero estando directamente con la empresa.

El grupo nos cuenta una anecdota de una de sus integrantes  y nos menciona que cuando ella comenzó a hacer sus grupos su marido la regañaba y le prohibía andar en eso, pero conforme pasaba el tiempo pudo demostrarle a su esposo que ella sola podía hacerse cargo de sus pagos y de su negocio sin necesidad de depender de él. Ahora el marido deja que hagan las juntas en su casa sin ninguna molestia.
texts.en:
“Palmas” is a very sociable communal bank in its first cycle; it has 8 women members who are very good and hardworking and who are concerned about their families’ wellbeing.  Their meetings take place in Monterrey, Nuevo León.

Marcela is a responsible, intelligent group member.  She’s 32 years old and lives happily with her husband and two children (twins, one boy and one girl) who attend school and one of them is on a baseball team.  

Marcela sells shoes, catalogue products, jewelry and natural products.  She likes to sell a little bit of everything and started the easiest way selling shoes which helped her trust her neighbors more and figure out if they were responsible.  

She will use the loan she got to stock up on tennis shoes and shoes for the Christmas season because this is what people need the most around this time and this way she can help her husband with household expenses and their children’s schooling costs.

One of Marcela’s most wished-for dreams is to continue growing in business to keep her good customers so that she can continue to sell them natural products to lose weight in the long run but being associated directly with the firm.

The group shared an anecdote about one of the members.  They mention that when she started to form her groups her husband would scold her and prohibit her from taking part in this but as time went by she was able to show her husband that she could take care of her payments and of her business all by herself and didn’t need to depend on him.  Now the husband lets her have the meetings in their house with no complaints.

loans.use: to stock up on more tennis shoes and shoes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 29-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling food in a food stall in yambio, South Sudan for 2 years.

Mary is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase rice and cassava flour. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase rice and cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Maame Elizabeth

texts.en:
Maame Elizabeth  is a fishmonger at Efutu. In front of her in the photo are some of the smoke fish she sells. 

She has been into this business for the past 10 years now. 

She is married to a farmer and has five children. Maame helps her husband to provide for their family. She will use her loan to purchase more fish for sale. With the new profit, Maame will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for sale.

loans.name: Silas

texts.en:
Silas is 33 years old and married with two children aged two and four. For the past twelve years he has repaired electronics in order to earn a living. He also employs two people.

Since Silas joined Faulu Kenya, his business has grown. He has applied for a 30,000 KES loan to buy additional spare parts.

Silas hopes to expand his business and open more branches in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa, 46 years old, is married with six children. For the past ten years she has had a shop where she sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Elisa has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. She has requested a loan of 14,000 PHP to buy more stock for her store. With the anticipated profits she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock for her store.

loans.name: Djekafo Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe DJEKAFO II sont des femmes mariées avec une moyenne d’âge de 36 ans et ont en moyenne 4 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames à Zanfina, un des villages de la commune de Konobougou,  préfecture de Barouéli, région de Ségou, 4ème région administrative du mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but de pouvoir mieux organiser leurs activités en début d’hivernage. Les spéculations cultivées sont le mil, l’arachide et le fonio. Elles sont à leur cinquième collaboration avec l’institution.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, BANA première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout, compte acheter les intrants, les petits équipements et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir environs 0,5 hectare de mil et d’arachide.
Les productions sont vendues au niveau de la ville de Fana,  après les récoltes à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 000F CFA environs par campagne.

loans.use: Labour, semence, engrais, herbicide, sarclage et petits équipements

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe créé depuis juillet 2012 rassemble des membres qui habitent le même village et ont comme activité le petit commerce.

Fatou qui se trouve à l'extrême droite de la photo et levant le bras,est la représentante du groupe,elle est âgée de 43 ans,est mariée et mére de 05 enfants dont 01 garçon.

Elle tient une boutique dans son village où elle vend au détail du riz,de l'huile,du sucre et des oignons.

Avec le crédit,elle compte acheter 03 sacs de riz pour une valeur totale de 39000f,02 bidons d'huile pour une valeur unitaire de 16500f,01 sac de sucre à 22500f et 01 sac d'oignon pour une valeur unitaire de 8500f.

Une partie des bénéfices servira à épargner et l'autre partie sera réservée aux dépenses familiales.

loans.use: acheter du riz,de l'huile,du sucre et des oignons

loans.name: Omutia

texts.en:
Omutia M. is a married woman with nine children. She has done charcoal business for five years now.
 
She started by buying one sack and then sell it in a small groups of bundles put together at 500 shillings Uganda money.
 
She got a loan of $200 from WITEP  that enabled her to increase her stock to ten bags now.
 
Uganda is a rainy forest country where by charcoal is the major fuel for cooking both in towns and villages.
 
The demand of charcoal is very high during this period when there is too much rain. Given a loan of $800, she plans to increase the stock by hiring a lorry then can buy up to 80 sacks of charcoal.
 
This will fetch her enough money to pay for the loan money and take care of her family.
 
She is a respected woman in the community.

loans.use: Increase stock of charcoal

loans.name: Allahverdi

texts.en:
Allahverdi has been engaged in this business for 5 years. He has his own machine-shop.
He works with his brother. This young man is Allahverdi apprentice. 
He is single, Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region Behmenli village, settled  on front line in Fizuli region Boyuk Behmenli village. 
Having borrowed a loan of $400 he bought welding apparatus.
Now they needs a loan of $800 to buy equipmens for repairing cars.

loans.use: To buy equipmens

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Julie is a resident of this town and sells plantain from her own farm. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $750.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Hue

texts.en:
Miss Hue is 39 and her husband is 41 years old. They have 4 children between 14 and 7 years of age. They are supporting all their children to go to school in grades between 9 and 1. Hiep, her husband, suffers cataract disease and Hong suffers from a tumor. The family has had to pay a lot of money for their medical treatment.
