Miss Hue sells food for breakfast in the morning to increase their income by about $2/person/month. However, their average income is low at $6.5/person/month. Now she wants to borrow a loan of $75 for her breakfast food selling business.

loans.use: Sell food for breakfast

loans.name: Minaya

texts.en: Minaya S. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwest Azerbaijan. She is married and has 2 children. Minaya owns a small stand near her home where she and her son sell household products and vegetables (some of which she grows in her own garden such as melons, tomatoes, etc.) to many people in her neighborhood. Although her stand is very old and not in good shape, she has many loyal customers. However, she is caught in a cycle in which she can only re-stock the products that she sells. She needs $700 in order to fully stock her inventory, maximize sales, and expand her business.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Jeidy Victoria

texts.es:
Jeidy es una señora casada D. 27 años edad, actualmente no tiene hijos. Jeidy se dedica a la venta D. juguetes, peluches y ropa en un puesto que tiene en el mercado MUTUALISTA D. la ciudad D. Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, ya trabaja en este rubro alrededor D. 5 años. Si bien este sector es bastante competitivo porque existen otras vendedoras que ofrecen lo mismo que ella, Jeidy se caracteriza por tener siempre novedades en su mercadería. En cuanto a los precios, los mismos varian D. acuerdo a los artículos que demanD. el cliente. Nuestra cliente tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y morales, actualmente también trabaja en FIE, financiera donD. empezo su actividad crediticia.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Jeidy is a 27 year old married woman, who currently does not have children. She works selling toys, stuffed animals, and clothing in a booth in the Mutualista market in the city of Santa Cruz D. la Sierra, and has been working in this role for about five years. As this type of business is fairly competitive since there are many other vendors with the same products, Jeidy stands out because she always has a variety of new products. The amount of money she needs to buy products depends on what her customers want to buy. She has a great credit history and is a good person, who currently works also with another organization where she began to borrow money for her business.

loans.use: To pay bills and buy merchandise

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Mrs. Joy I. is 37 years old, married and has 5 children; she lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells provisions and drinks. She is requesting a loan of US$400 to buy more provisions and drinks for sale. She has 19 years experience in business.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and drinks for sale

loans.name: Sophie's Group

texts.en:
Sophie S. has 5 dependents. With a loan, she wishes to start a mini—grocery store to sell fresh food such as sweet potatoes, vegetables, Irish potatoes (russets), cassava, etc.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To start a mini-grocery store

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en: Kadiatu C. is 39 years old and married with two children. She sells beer, soft drinks and some snacks.  Kadiatu raised her capital from selling palm oil on a small scale for the past 10 years.  With loans from SMT and income from the palm oil business, she established a bar and restaurant in the town of Makeni.  She has more customers and the income is supporting family expenses.  She plans to expand her business and meet her customers demand.  A Le.2, 000,000 loan will improve her business income.

loans.use: Kadiatu is expanding her business in an effort to meet her customer's demand for cold drinks and snacks.

loans.name: Dith

texts.en: Mrs. Dith D., 55, is a widow with two children. She looks after her house and cooks for her children; she also owns a plot of farmland where growing rice earns her on average about $2 a day.  Her children work in a garment factory, making a salary of $50 each a month. Mrs. D. is requesting a loan from Kiva of $500 to purchase a water pump to irrigate her rice crops.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en:
Mrs. Sen H., 52, is a widow with nine children. She owns a plot of farmland growing rice, making on average, one dollar a day. Three of her children are married and live outside the family home. Three other children are employed by a garment factory earning a salary $50 each a month and one other child is a wedding chef in the village. The other children help her with the rice fields.

To generate more income for the family, Mrs. H. is requesting a loan to rent a plot of land to grow sugar cane and to purchase fertilizers to put on her fields.

loans.use: To rent a plot of farmland for growing sugar cane and to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Meriluz Rosa

texts.en:
Meriluz Rosa M. V. has a business manufacturing milk based products in Moche, a suburb of Trujillo, La Libertad Region.  Meriluz makes yogurt, cheese, and chocolates from an extra kitchen she built into home.  She started the business 4 years ago after years of selling milk.  She earns much more money now.

Meriluz is 39 years old, married and has 4 children.  She loves being her own boss and being able to spend more time with her family.  She has many loyal customers who she distributes her goods to weekly.  She has learned over time the importance of keeping her clients happy.  This includes standards of quality, quantity, and preparing her products to the specific needs of a client.

A member of the community bank Siempre Adalante II, Meriluz is requesting a loan of $300 to repay over 6 months.  She will use the loan to buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, and fruit.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as sugar, milk, and fruit.

loans.name: Kem

texts.en:
Kem O. is 39-years-old and is a weaver in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She weaves Khmer traditional dresses made from silk. One dress takes 10-15 days to complete and costs at least $100. Hand woven dresses are preferred over machine-made.

Her husband, Mr. Kong Sombo, 44, builds houses, earning about $5 a day. They have four children, one is married and lives away from home. Two daughters are also weavers and the youngest child is student.

Kem would use her loan to purchase beads, silk and other tools to expand the weaving business,

loans.use: To purchase beads, silk and other tools to expand the business

loans.name: Hak

texts.en: Hak K., 44, lives with her niece in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She owns a generator which serves to recharge all the batteries in the village. People living in the village depend on batteries to power their lighting, television…etc. On average, she makes $10 each day. Her niece knows some computer programs and can install songs onto hand phones. After Mrs. Hak receives her loan, she would like to loan some money to help purchase a computer for her niece to set songs onto hand phones for other people and charge them for it. This will give them extra profit to support the family.

loans.use: Hak would like to purchase a computer to set a song.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is a sweet woman that works selling food insiD. a market, an activity with which she helps her husband with the household expenses. Even though their children already have their own families and live separately, this couple remains in love. Thanks to her activities they don't feel lonely, instead they have great desires to continue ahead and realize some of their dreams. Juana wishes to expand her food booth and proviD. a better service to her clients. This is the reason why she is requesting a loan for the purchase of various utensils and furniture necessary to improve the environment and service to attract a larger number of diners. She is waiting for your response.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer.

Juana es una dulce señora que trabaja en L. venta D. comida dentro D. un mercado, actividad con L. cual ayuda a su pareja en los gastos dentro D. su hogar, debido a que sus hijos ya tienen su propia familia y viven aparte, esta pareja veL. en amor, uno del otro. Gracias a sus actividades no se sienten solos, sino con grandes deseos D. seguir adelante y concretar algunos sueños. Doña Juana desea ampliar su puesto D. comida y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.Por ello solicita un préstamo para L. compra D. algunos utensilios y muebles necesarios para mejorar el ambiente y L. atención y atraer a mayor cantidad D. comensales. ElL. está a L. espera D. su respuesta.

loans.use: Purchase of furniture and utensils to improve the booth in the local markets where she sells food

loans.name: Apéssi

texts.fr:
Née en 1963 à Tékponou, Madame D. Apéssi réside dans le même village où elle mène ses activités. Mariée, elle est mère de cinq enfants tous à sa charge. Très dynamique, elle commercialise du cola qu’elle achète très loin. 

Il faut dire que c’est un produit qui coûte très cher et dont le commerce nécessite beaucoup de fonds. Aussi vend-elle de l’huile rouge qu’elle stocke. Pour ce faire, elle sollicite un crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1963 in Tékponou, Mrs Apéssi D. lives in the same village where she conduct her activities. Married, she is the mother of five children who are all in her care. A very dynamic individual, she commercializes cola which she purchases from very far away. It is an expensive product and many funds are necessary to be invovled in its commercialization. She also sells 'red oil' (palm oil), which she has stocks of. In order to continue to do this, she is asking for a loan.

Translated from French by Chloe Tuot, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Storage and sales of palm oil

loans.name: Elsa Bertha

texts.es:
La señora Elsa pertenece al Banco Comunal Las Brisas, ubicado en la Av. Laureano Del Águila Mz.A Lt.1, distrito D. Yarinacocha, departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 54 años D. edad, es madre D. 3 hijas mayores D. edad, es casada y su esposo trabaja como policía. Con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/.300, deciD. invertir en la venta D. costura.
 
En la actualidad, Elsa, continúa con el negocio D. costura “venta D. ropas” para damas, caballeros y niños. 

Con este préstamo D. S/.1,500, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, invertirá en la compra D. 10 metros D. tela para muebles, 8 kilos D. tela para blusas, tela para vestidos, camisas, blondas y otros. 

Elsa es trabajadora, empeñosa y desea seguir surgiendo en la vida agradeciendo siempre a Dios y a Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Elsa belongs to the Communal Bank “Las Brisas,” located on the Laureano Del Águila Mz.A Lt.1 Avenue, Yarinacocha district, Ucayali state. She is 54 years old, mother to 3 grown daughters, she is married and her husband works as a police officer. With the first loan she received for S/.300 she decided to invest in a seamstress business. Today Elsa continues her business selling clothing for women, men and children. With this loan for S/.1,500 which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of 10 meters of furniture fabric, 8 kilos of blouse fabric, fabric for dresses, shirts, silk lace and other fabric. Elsa is hard-working and she wishes to continue be successful in life, always thanking God and also Manuela Ramos.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a variety of fabrics

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: Don Miguel tiene 53 años de edad, es casado y habita en el barrio Anexo Villa Libertad,  su esposa es ama de casa y ambos tienen dos hijos de 14 y 17 años de edad, los cuales están estudiando la secundaria. El negocio que tiene don Miguel es una zapatería, en el cual hace y repara zapatos, pues esta ha sido su fuente de trabajo ya que desde muy joven su papá le enseñó el oficio y le herederó la zapatería,  son cuarenta y cinco años de experiencias y es un negocio estable. Con la solicitud de préstamo lo quiere para invertir en materia prima en la compra de cuero, suelas, pega y todo lo que ocupa en su negocio. A largo plazo es seguir manteniendo su negocio, hacer mejoras en su local así como comprar otras maquinas para seguir haciendo ofreciendo un servicio excelente a sus clientes, poder seguir dando estudio a sus hijos para que sean hombres de buena educación.
texts.en:
Miguel is 53 years old, married, and lives in the neighborhood Anexo Villa Libertad. His wife is a housewife and his children are 14 and 17 years old, both of whom are high school students. Miguel’s business is a shoe store where he makes and repairs shoes. This business has been his source of work since he was very young when his father taught him this trade. He inherited the shoe store with 45 years of experience and stability. With this loan, he would like to invest in basic materials such as leather, soles, glue, and other items that are needed in his business. In the long term, he wants to continue maintaining his business, offering excellent service to his customers. Also, he wants to be able to continue sending his children to school so that they become men of great education.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Puchase basic materials for manufacturing shoes

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan  vive en la calle Inca Roca  de la zona Alto Tacagua  de la ciudad de La Paz.
 
El es casado vive junto a su esposa y sus tres hijos de 22, 20 y 18 años respectivamente.

Trabaja como chofer de automóvil en una de las líneas céntricas de la ciudad.


El crédito lo destinara en la compra de repuestos para el motor de su movilidad y realizarle un mantenimiento general.
 
 
Es el tercer  crédito con Impro, el primero  via kiva, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Juan lives on Inca Roca street in the area of Alto Tacagua in the city of La Paz. He is married and lives with his wife and his three children; 22, 20 and 18 years old respectively. He works as a driver in one of the main routes of the city. The loan is going to be used to purchase spare parts for his vehicle's motor and to perform general maintenance. It is his third loan with Impro, the first via Kiva, the assessment showed that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Bradley Banks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase spare parts for the engine of his taxi and for general maintenance

loans.name: Tamemgbo Group

texts.en:
This is Abdulai K., Mahawa G., Kadiatu K., Alie K. and Fatmata S.. They called their group "Tamemgbo," a Temne word for “let’s keep trying.” They have received several loans from Kiva through SMT. They have repaid the previous loans successfully. Their previous loan was for Le 800,000 each. That loan helped them a lot. They were able to make a lot of profit from the loan and solve many of their problems. Today, they are requesting a new loan for Le 1,000,000 each to add to their businesses.

Abdul (right) is the leader of this group. Abdul was born in Makeni in northern Sierra Leone. He is forty-five years of age, a husband with four children: two in secondary school, one in primary school. The youngest is not of school age yet. Together, he and his wife sell second-hand bed sheets. He has been a businessman for over fifteen years.

With this loan of Le 1,000,000, Abdul will buy about five bales of second-hand bed sheets to add to his business. He travels to Freetown, a distance of 390 miles round trip, to buy the bed sheets. A bale of second-hand bed sheets costs between Le 220,000 and Le 250,000. The fare to and from Freetown is Le 30,000 and a single bale will cost him Le 3,000 to transport back to Makeni.   

The only challenge Abdul is facing in his business is that of occasional slow sales. The people of Makeni struggle to generate the discretionary income necessary to purchase fresh bed sheets from Abdul. Also, a challenging rain or dry season can also impede sales. Apart from this, business is going well for him and he loves doing it. His goal now is to be able to buy a plot of land so that he can start building a house.

loans.use: Buy five bales of second-hand bed sheets

loans.name: Eva Ruth

texts.es:
Eva A. se dedica a la venta DVDs, CDs. VCDs, en su tienda ubicado en la zona de Bella Vista en su mismo domicilio donde vive en contrato de anticrético.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (CDs, tapas, envolturas y afiches)
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con buen cumplimiento en el pago de su crédito.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Eva A. dedicates herself to the sale of DVDs, CDs, VCDs from her home/store located in the Bella Vista zone where she lives under an “anticrético” contract (a Bolivia-specific property rental arrangement). The loan would be designated for the purchase of merchandise (CDs, cases, labels). This is the second time she requests a loan with Impro, and her history qualifies her as a top client. In other words, she has a good track record for paying her loan installments. Her desire to work gives her the opportunity to access this credit, given that she is a responsible person.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La señora Danelia S. es originaria de la ciudad de Masaya cuna de las artesanías de Nicaragua donde se desempeña en su negocio de elaboración y venta de hamacas típicas las cuales son comercializadas en su propia localidad donde es muy visitada por personas y en ocasiones por turistas los cuales se enamoran de las bellas hamacas que ella elabora.

Es importante destacar que Ceprodel ha sido su apoyo porque le ha brindado créditos para su desarrollo y es por este motivo que hoy en día una vez más espera que su crédito sea aprobado para así continuar su negocio de elaboración de hamacas ofreciéndolas en la ciudad de Masaya.
texts.en:
Daniela Sanchez is originally from the city of Masaya known as the birthplace of the Nicaraguan crafts. This is where she carries out her business in the assembly and sale of traditional hammocks, which are marketed in her own location. She is very visited by people and on occasion by tourists who fall in love with the beautiful hammocks that she creates. It is important to emphasize that Ceprodel has been her support because it has provided her loans for her development. It is for this reason that she currently once again hopes that her loan is approved so that she may continue in her business in the assembly of hammocks that she offers in the city of Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of materials.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El señor José está casado con la señora Ermelinda de Díaz, tiene 4 hijos, vive en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Itá, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de planteras de todos los modelos y tamaños hace más de 18 años. Su fábrica lo tiene situado en su domicilio, dos de sus hijos lo ayudan en el negocio, los demás se dedican a actividades diferentes a la de él, mientras que su señora ayuda en los quehaceres del hogar.  Sus ventas las realiza en la ciudad de Itá, alrededores e interior del país.
 
El señor José solicita el préstamo para la compra de leña y arcilla, los cuales son materias primas esenciales para la elaboración de sus productos, de modo a satisfacer la demanda de un pedido importante que uno de sus clientes solicitó.
texts.en:
José is married to Ermelinda de Díaz; he has four children and lives close to downtown Itá. He has been making and selling planters of all sizes and shapes for more than 18 years. His factory is located in his home; two of his children help him in the business, the other two have their own lines of work. His wife helps with all the household chores. He sells in the city of Itá, in the surrounding areas and in the interior of the country. José is asking for a loan to buy firewood and clay, which are the raw materials essential to his business, in order to fill a large order placed by one of his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood and clay

loans.name: Lidia Candelaria

texts.es:
La señora Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal “El Comercio”, del barrio San Andrés, en el distrito de Desaguadero, Provincia de Chucuito, Departamento de Puno; tiene 25 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene a su cuidado 01 hijo, asimismo posee estudios de primaria completa. 
Ella Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su negocio es el engorde de ganado y su comercialización, así como la venta de productos y accesorios de limpieza y higiene (cremas dentales, para zapatos, escobillas, etc.); su primer préstamo fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, con lo que pudo adquirir ganado menor para engorde y su venta en las ferias de Zepita.  
Actualmente requiere un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1500.00 Nuevos soles, el mismo que se comprometa a pagar en 03 cuotas mensuales, con dicho préstamo desea adquirir ganado mayor (toros) para engordarlos y venderlos en las ferias ganaderas de Zepita o Huacullani; asimismo desea seguir mejorando su negocio de venta de artículos de limpieza e higiene; su anhelo es comprarse una casa propia en Desaguadero, puesto que aún sus padres la vienen acogiendo, finalmente ella desea educar a sus hijito y apoyarlo en todo lo que requiera.
texts.en:
Señora Lidia is a member of the El Comercio Communal Bank, which is located in San Andrés, in the district of Desaguadero, in the Province of Chucuito, in Puno. She is 25 years old and the single mother of one son. She has been working with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years now. Lidia raises livestock to sell in Zepita's markets and also, sells cleaning products and toiletries (toothpaste, shoe polish, brushes etc.). Her first loan was of 500 soles, which she used to buy young livestock, raising them and eventually, selling them. Now, she is requesting a loan of 1,500. soles, which she will repay in 3 installments, so that she can buy some bulls to raise for the market, either in Zepita or in Huacullani. Also, she would like to continue to improve her second business, her trade in cleaning products and toiletries. Lidia dreams of buying her own house in Desaguadero, even though many people - including her parents - are renters. More than anything however, she wants to be able to give her son an education and to support him in every way.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock and cleaning products

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is 38 years old and married. She has given birth to three kids. Currently all are in school in the community where they live. She sells porridge in her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods enjoyed as breakfast by almost all Ghanaians. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken with sugar, milk and bread, or taken with what we called 'Kose'. 'Kose' is prepared from milled beans and it is fried with cooking oil so in just about 20 minutes it is ready to be served with the porridge.

With a large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, beans, sugar and milk to increase production. She also wants to upgrade her lingerie sales. She hopes to earn a good income to support her kids in school. She treks to Tachiman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her supply of goods. With the loan, she believes she can buy more from the farmers which will prevent her from having to travel frequently.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar, milk, etc.

loans.name: Anora

texts.ru: Социальное положение Аноры на сегодняшний день очень низкое. Ей 36 лет. незамужем. Не имея постоянной работы Анора занимается мелким предпринимательством и продает различные мелкие товары: носки, носовые платки, и тому подобное. Опыт ее работы на рынке хотя и большой, но за эти годы его объем не увеличился настолько, чтобы смело можно было бы его назвать успешным. Скорей всего это результат того, что вся прибыль идет на покрытие семейных расходов. Анора вынуждена  взять небольшой займ, чтобы внести новый ассортимент товаров.
texts.en:
Anora presently lives at the bottom of the socio-economic ladder. She is 36 years old and unmarried. Being without steady employment, Anora has a business selling various small items: socks, handkerchiefs and the like. Although she has a lot of experience selling at the market, over the years her volume of sales has not increased to such an extent that it could be labeled a success. Most likely this results from the fact that all the profit goes to cover family expenses. Anora is obliged to take out a small loan to bring in a new assortment of goods.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her assortment of goods

loans.name: Manal

texts.en: Manal is a 21 year-old single woman with a home-based business living in Jnah, Mount Lebanon. She sells beauty products, lingerie and jewellery to the neighboring areas. Today she is requesting to borrow $1,000 to purchase merchandise to increase her sales.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Mañaneras Group

texts.es:
Aida C..- es la presidenta del banco comunal, se dedica a la actividad D. la panaderia la misma que hace 10 que viene realizando el negocio.
Enviudó hace 5 años atrás ahora en la que se convirtió en el único sustento para su hogar.
Ella cuenta con casa propia, su objetivo es aumentar su capital y agrandar su panaderia, ya que empezó a diversificar sus productos con repostería.
Bernarda C..- vive en el barrio 3 D. mayo en la localidad D. la Guardia a 20km. D. la cuidad D. Santa Cruz. En casa alquilada en la que vive con sus dos hijos y esposo el Sr. Mario Méndez, D. profesión chofer.
Tiene como actividad la venta D. masitas esto lo realiza en la misma zona al frente D. la H.A.M. D. la Guardia.
Rosa Aceri.- tiene como actividad la venta D. cosméticos, el destino D. préstamo fue para la compra D. una maquina D. costura, oficio el cual  esta empezando a adquirir .Es madre soltera, la misma que tiene la responsabilidad, D. su familia es una persona muy trabajadora ya que la misma es la que sostiene a toda su familia. Su sueño D. la Sra. Es llegar a comprarse su casa propia.
texts.en:
Aida C. is the president of this communal bank. Aida was widowed 5 years ago and became the sole breadwinner for her household. She has maD. her living with a bakery for ten years. She is also a homeowner and would like to increase her capital so she can grow her bakery. Aida has already begun to diversify what she sells in the bakery. Bernarda C. lives in the 3 D. mayo neighborhood of Santa Cruz in a home she rents. She lives with her two children and her husband, Mr. Mario Méndez. Her husband works as a driver. Bernarda sells dough for a living. She works in the same area she lives in, in front of H.A.M. D. la Guardia. Rosa Aceri sells cosmetics for a living. She is just starting a business as a seamstress and has asked for a loan so she can buy a sewing machine. Rosa is a single mother. She has total responsibility for her family and is therefore a very hardworking woman. She dreams of buying her own house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Aumento de capital

loans.name: Yawavi

texts.fr: Cette femme exerce depuis 2005 comme activité génératrice de revenus la vente des objets plastiques. Son ancienneté dans ce commerce a fait qu’elle a une bonne maîtrise de son activité. Ses clients lui font confiance. Actuellement elle est en rupture de stock, elle veut se réapprovisionner et sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit pour acheter des plastiques et divers.
texts.en:
Since 2006, this woman has been selling plasticware. Her seniority in this business ensures that she masters it. Her clients trust her. At this time, she's out of stock and want to resupply. She's therefore seeking her first loan from Kiva's partner, WAGES, in order to buy plasticware and other various items.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy plasticware and other various items

loans.name: Naergas Group

texts.en:
Naergas is the group leader of Naergas group. There are two members in this group. They want to take a loan of 30,000 Afghani and each of them wants to expand their business.

Naergas wants to take a loan for her husband who has car-parts shop.

Rawalah wants to take a loan for her husband who has a general store.

So they are very happy with this loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand her husband's business

loans.name: Zachariah

texts.en: Zachariah O. is aged 41 years and is a widower. He is the father of two: Amon and Cynthia. He has also adopted two other children: Edwin and Winnie. Zachariah owns a general store where he sells different building materials and electrical goods, and he has been in that business for three years. He also offers printing and photocopying services to supplement his store's income. This KADET loan marks his first from any lending organization to finance his business. He plans to buy bicycle parts, and other basic building materials in order to tap the ready market available as many people are putting up buildings in his neighborhood. In future Zachariah hopes to diversify his business by venturing into the freight transportation sector. About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is committed to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to rural communities in order to relieve suffering and improve living conditions within those communities.

loans.use: To purchase bicycle parts and basic building materials

loans.name: Uguloi

texts.ru: Умарова Угулой 1974 года рождения замужем, имеет троих детей. Муж работает таксистом.Она год кредитуется в Микроинвесте. Угулой занимается продажей женских платков. Она торгует в магазине «Нури Худжанд». Товар она привозит из оптового рынка г. Истаравшана. Спрос на её товар большой из за национального обычая. На запрашиваемый займ она хочет закупить новый вид платков.
texts.en:
Born in 1975, Uguloi U. is married and has three children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. She has been working with MicroInvest for one year. Uguloi sells women's scarves at the Nuri Khujand store. She brings her merchandise from a wholesale market in the city of Istaravshan. Her merchandise is in high demand due to the traditional customs. Uguloi wants to use this loan to purchase new type of scarves.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of women's scarves

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: Rosario tiene 36 años, está casada y es madre de 3 hijos con quienes vive en la casa de su suegra, quien les brindó el apoyo necesario para mantener su hogar. Desde que se casó se dedicó a la venta de ropa y zapatos, actividad que realiza hace 6 años junto a su suegra, quien le enseñó cómo y dónde vender. Es así que todos los días, desde muy temprano sale a las calles para ofrecer las diversas prendas novedosas que adquiere cada quincena en el centro de la ciudad. A pesar de la distancia, a Rosario no le incomoda trasladar su mercadería durante el largo trayecto, pues eso beneficia a sus clientes, porque consigue ropa de calidad a menores precios, prendas que también vende al crédito. Sin embargo, su mayor ambición es tener un local propio donde vender su mercadería, ya que hay prendas que por no exhibirse dejan de venderse, perjudicando sus ganancias, es por ello que espera pronto  encontrar un puesto dentro de algún mercado de su localidad donde pueda vender cómodamente. Este es su décimo préstamo con Microfinanzas PRISMA y lo que más le agrada es la conformación de un equipo de trabajo eficiente, ya que sus compañeras están muy comprometidas con el desarrollo de su banco comunal. Con los 1500 soles que ahora solicita comprará la mercadería necesaria en prendas de vestir para incrementar sus ventas.

loans.use: Incremento de mercadería

loans.name: Thoeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoeun L., age 57, and her husband, Mr. Vong Voir, age 62, were married in 1982 and have nine children: five sons and four daughters. Five of the children are married and do not live in the house, one daughter is a garment factory worker, and two others attend school. The couple farms; they grow rice.

One of Thoeun’s sons has just finished his baccalaureate degree. He hopes to continue his bachelor degree at university in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, about fifteen kilometers from his house. Therefore, Thoeun is requesting a loan of $700 to purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her son to drive to school

loans.name: Fredelina

texts.en: Fredelina is 42 years old and she is married to Benjamin. They both manages their tricycle transport business. The couple is blessed with five children; two of them are already married. They are hoping that they could be able to provide for the education of their three left children in their house. Fredelina wanted their motorcycle to be repaired, changes some of its spare parts. In this regard, she wanted to request for a loan amounting to PHP4, 000 from the KIVA lenders for the repair and maintenance of their motorcycle since they don’t have enough money for the said purpose. Furthermore, Fredelian shared that having their motorcycle used in transport business is a big help in providing their daily immediate needs and allowances of their children to school. These are the reason why, she wanted their motorcycle be maintained for it is where they get their daily source of income.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Tetyana

texts.en: Tatyana is a widow. She lives with her daughter who is disabled. Tatyana sells women's clothing at the central market in Kherson city. She has been in this business for 10 years. Tatyana is very disciplined and responsible person. She knows her market sector and buys items that sell well. Tatyana would like to borrow 15,000 UAH to increase the assortment.

loans.use: to increase the assortment

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 46-year-old widow with four children between the ages of 22 and 28 years old. None of children goes to school. Alice resides in, and owns, a two-room house where she is staying with five people. The family has access to electricity but no piped water. Alice takes care of additional family members as well.  

Alice sells secondhand shoes in Owino Market and pays for transport costs to and from work and transportation expenses because she buys from her place of work. On average she receives three customers a day. She works in the outskirts of Kampala. She has been in this business ten years and with MCDT for two years, servicing her fifth loan, working with the same group mates. Her monthly expenses include feeding her family and buying medication. Her challenges include defaulters and thieves. 

Alice wants to use this loan to buy more secondhand shoes. She is hoping to see her business grow bigger and to be able to start buying directly from Kenya and Mombasa.

loans.use: To buy shoes for resale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia is thirty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to six children. All of her children are in school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kade. Felicia works to support her husband to provide for the family. She is a trader. She trades in palm nuts. She buys the palm nuts from nearby communities and supplies to retailers and palm oil producers in her community. Felicia also sells at the local market and treks as well. She has been in business for seven years and wants a loan to procure palm nuts in bulk to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy palm nuts in bulk.

loans.name: Mousa

texts.en:
Mousa is a 29-year-old entrepreneur who is married with one child. He has a small computer repair shop.

He is requesting a loan of $3000 in order to purchase parts and tools needed for completing his jobs. It will inspire confidence in the service he provides, and most importantly customer satisfaction, which is of paramount importance to him.

loans.use: Purchase parts and tools

loans.name: Monterrey Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal  “MONTERREY “se encuentra en su 1º Ciclo y consta D. 12 personas 11 mujeres y un varón que se llama Wilber. Todos viven en el mismo barrio y tienen diferentes negocios, la reunión se lleva a cabo en la casa D. la Sra. Marioly. Los negocios D. las socias son diversos por ejemplo Sra. Mirian, presidenta, tiene una venta D. Jugos su puesto es en la calle, otra es costurera D. ropa, otra Sra. VenD. empanadas y refresco, otras venden comida, venden ropa. Las socias mencionan que existe gran cantidad D. competencia en relación a este crédito pero ellas hacen la diferencia que Agrocapital trabaja D. manera transparente, y le da muchas ventajas y accesibilidad a este crédito. Generalmente las socias indican que el crédito lo sacan para sus negocios, para aumentar su capital, asimismo puedan crecer con sus negocios. En su mayoría tienen experiencia en Banca Comunal y otras con crédito individual. Sus antecedentes crediticios están sobre los requerimientos D. la Institución.
texts.en:
The "Monterrey" Communal Bank is currently in its first loan cycle. It consists of 12 people: 11 women and one man named Wilber. All of them live in the same neighborhood, but they operate different businesses. Meetings are held in Marioly's home. The partners' businesses are diverse; for instance Mirian, the president, sells juices from a stand on the street. Another is a tailor who makes clothes; another woman sells empanadas and soft drinks; others sell food or clothing. The partners mention that there is a great deal of competition in loan offerings, but what maD. the difference for them is that Agrocapital operates in a transparent manner and offers them many advantages and favorable access to this loan. Generally, the partners indicate that they are seeking a loan to use in their businesses, increasing their capital so that their enterprises can grow. The majority have previous experience in a communal bank, and some have had individual loans. Their credit evaluations exceed the Institution's requirements.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
La señora Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal “La Juleñita” desde hace 6 años, vive en el distrito de Juli, provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió secundaria incompleta, se dedica a la venta de artesanía.

Gladys nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital y comprar más insumos.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 600.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  bayeta y lana al por mayor.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una librería. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y las reuniones con las socias
texts.en:
Gladys has been a member of the “La Juleñita” community bank for six years. She lives in the district of Juli, in the Province of Chucuito, Puno Department. She is 33 years old, is married and has three children. She didn’t finish high school, and works selling handicrafts.

Gladys tells us that the first loan she requested from the Movimento Manuela Ramos, for S/. 300.00, was used to increase her capital and purchase more stock.

She is asking for a loan for S/. 600.00 with which to purchase felt and wool at wholesale.

Her dream for the future is to own a bookstore.

The things she likes best about her Community Bank are the savings and the membership meetings.

Translated from Spanish by David Kaisel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of felt and wool.

loans.name: Naem

texts.en:
Mr. Naem S. is 44 years old and lives in Sam Raong village in Takeo province. He and his wife, Mrs. Choeurn Brarch, are farmers who own two hectars on which to cultivate rice for living. Aside from being farmers, they are duck breeders who earn a small income to support their family. 

In order to improve and expand their breeding duck business, Naem S. is applying for a loan to buy more ducks for breeding. 

Naem S. is the father of five children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, three who are students in the local school, while another one is too young to study or work. His wife is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks for breeding

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin T. is a married entrepreneur. He runs a foodstuffs and fruits shop at Buguruni Matumbi in Dar es Salaam. Godwin purchases his goods wholesale from the city market shops. He has been in the business for four years and the business income generated is used to meet his family's needs and to capitalize his business. Godwin is asking for a loan of  1,200,000 TZS to buy more business goods.

loans.use: To buy more business goods

loans.name: Mirta

texts.es:
Mirta es una mujer muy trabajadora, tiene 50 años y vive con su esposo Sergio, de 52 años, y con 2 de sus 3 hijos; Sergio y María de 9 y 18 años respectivamente.
Nos cuenta que cuando llegó a habitar su casa, esta era muy humilde, pues era de materiales rústicos como esteras y carrizos, poco a poco la fue mejorando y levantando, gracias al duro esfuerzo de ella y su esposo. Ahora posee una tienda de abarrotes y también un pequeño taller de estampados de ropa, que es a lo que le dedica mucho más tiempo, pues es un trabajo que requiere de mucha dedicación. 
Lo que Mirta hace es recibir polos de talleres textiles, los estampa o borda diferentes figuras, haciéndolos más atractivos para que se puedan vender más rápido. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, puesto que le da la oportunidad de usar su creatividad. 
Para el futuro le gustaría que su taller sea más grande y tener a varios empleados trabajando para, pero sin descuidar su pequeña bodega, la cual también le resulta muy productiva.

Este es su quinto crédito con MFP y le ha ido muy bien con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que todas sus compañeras son muy puntuales, al igual que ella. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará materiales como pinturas de diferentes colores y algunas herramientas para facilitar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mirta is a very hard working woman, who is 50 years old and lives with her husband Sergio, who is 53 years old, who she has two of 3 children with; Sergio and María are 9 and 18 years respectively. She tells us that when she arrived to live at her house, it was very modest, and well, it was of rustic materials like a thatch roof. Little by little, she improved and raised it, thanks the strength of her and her husband. Now she owns a grocery store and also a small stand to pattern clothing, where she spends a lot of time working, as it's a job that requires a lot of dedication. What Mirta has to do is to receive textile fabrics, and stamps them with patterns and different border figures, making them more attractive so they can be sold more rapidly. She likes her job very much, as while as the opportunity to use her creativity. For the future, she would like to stand to become bigger and to have several employees working there, but without worrying about her grocery story, which is also very productive. This is her fifth credit with MFP, an affiliate of Kiva, and she has done very well paying her loans. To date, all of her partners are very punctual, the same as her. With the money that she is asking for now, she will buy materials like paint in different colors and also some tools to facilitate her job.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials

loans.name: Rhaida

texts.en:
Rhaida S. is from the village of Barangay 4, Talakag, Bukidnon. She is 32 years old. Rhaida is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Rhaida owns & operates a specialized retail store selling dried fish and shrimp in the local community. Rhaida has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rhaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rhaida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used as additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rhaida from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Adesola

texts.en:
Adesola has a bakery where he bakes and sells loaves of bread at wholesale and retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He has been in this business for a long time and he uses his experience in business to attract and retain more customers.

Adesola is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more baking materials to bake more loaves of bread to sell. He hopes to own a classic bakery in the future.

Adesola is 32 years old and married with a child who is 5 years old and attends school. His wife also sells groceries to support their home. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baking materials for his bakery

loans.name: Lovely Ann

texts.en:
Lovely Ann E. is from the village of Magcamiguing, Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She is 21 years old. Lovely Ann is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Lovely Ann owns & operates a business providing motor cab services in the local community. Lovely Ann has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lovely Ann joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lovely Ann has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase materials needed to provide service. Lovely Ann is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Lovely Ann from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Lane Kuru Group

texts.en:
This group is named “Lane Kuru”, a Temne phrase meaning “Believe in God”. The members are all local entrepreneurs in Waterloo, a small town near Freetown, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This will be the first loan this group is accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With the help of this loan, they will be able to add more goods into their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their standard of living. They are requesting a loan of 500,000 leones for each member of the group. 

Their leader, 35-year-old Fatmata M. (pictured in the middle), sells "Yoruba market". This includes a variety of assorted little stuffs first introduced and sold in Sierra Leone by the Yorubas from Nigeria. To name a few in English, they include spoons, knives, thread, rings, bracelets, “madoni cream”, etc. Fatmata was born in a place called Ribi. She is married to a businessman and they have five children and one foster child. Fatmata has been in her business for nearly 20 years now. With her share of the loan, she will expand her business by buying “Yoruba items” in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy spoons, knives, thread, rings, bracelets, “madoni cream”, etc.

loans.name: Heang Thea

texts.en: Mrs. Heang Thea T. is 33 years old and a villager who lives in Krang Pou village in Takeo province. She and her husband, Mr. Nov Phoung, are farmers who own two hectares of land to cultivate rice. For this farm, Mrs. Heang Thea T. decided to ask for a loan to pay a laborer to plow her farm. Aside from farming, Mrs. Heang Thea T. is a vegetable seller who earns a small income to support her family. This couple has four children; three are attending the local school and the youngest one is five years old. Her husband is in the picture with her.

loans.use: To pay a laborer to plow her farm.

loans.name: Eroy Juanita Group

texts.en:
Juanita E. is from the town of Plaridel. She is 49 years old and the group leader of a 2-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Juanita is married and has 2 adult-aged children. She owns and operates a fishing business, harvesting and selling ocean-caught fish in the local community. Juanita is just starting this business.

In 2000, Juanita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juanita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,500 PHP from PMPC, which was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Juanita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the 4th loan taken out by Juanita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Weddy

texts.en:
Weddy G. is from the village of Goleo, Sindangan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 44 years old, married, and has 6 adult and school-aged children. To make a living, Weddy owns & operates a business venture in the food sector, selling fish. The other source of income for the family comes from the income of her husband. Weddy has been engaged in her business for 15 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Weddy joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Weddy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to buy more fish to sell in the market. Weddy is requesting a new loan of Php 5,000 which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Weddy from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.  
 
About PMPC: 

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: Additional capital to buy fish to sell

loans.name: Filemon

texts.es: Filemón, de 66 años, es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, vive en su casa propia junto a su último hijo, quien lo acompaña y lo ayuda en la chacra. Desde hace 40 años, todas las mañanas, desde muy temprano, Filemón sale a trabajar a su chacra, sabe que tiene que poner todo su esfuerzo en hacer más fértil sus tierras, para poder obtener una buena cosecha. Sus productos los vende en la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde tiene muchos compradores, debido a la buena calidad de sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y lo hace con mucho esmero, sin embargo el tener que fumigar sus tierras le es muy peligroso, pero necesita de ello para evitar las plagas para que no afecten la producción. Con el tiempo espera alquilar nuevas tierras, para aumentar su producción. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, en sus primeros pagos fue muy puntual y espera poder serlo ahora también. En su grupo comunal es muy querido por el resto de las socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus chacras estén muy productivas.
texts.en:
Filemón is 66 years old; he is a hardworking and responsible man. He lives in his own home with his youngest son who helps him in the small farm. For some 40 years, Filemón gets up very early every morning and goes to work on his small farm. He knows that he needs to put all of his efforts in making his land more fertile so that he can have a good harvest. His products are sold in the city of Pichanaki, where he has a lot of buyers because of the quality of his crops. What he enjoys most in his work is to sow his land and he does this carefully he also fumigates his land which is very dangerous, but he needs to do it to prevent plagues so that they don’t affect his crop production. With time, he hopes to rent more land to increase production. This is his third loan with MFP (Kiva’s field partner) his first payments were very punctual and he hopes to be able to be the same way again. In his communal group, he is well-liked by the rest of the members. With the 2,000 nuevos soles, he will buy more manure and fertilizer for his lands since he hopes that his small farms will be very productive.

Translated from Spanish by Mayra Duque, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure so that his land will be more fertile.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma F. is a married woman who lives in Sitio Mapait, Brgy. Su-ay, Himamaylan City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures:  fishing , fish vending and hog fattening. Her husband Antonio, who is 51 years old, works as a fisherman and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children aged 16 to 25. 

Gemma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1992 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Gemma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 18,000 helped her to earn a monthly profit of PHP 16.000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 14th loan cycle, she is borrowing PHP 26,000, which she intends to use to buy fishing gear so that she can continue to save up to renovate her home and to send her children to college. Gemma F. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF :In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to buy more fishing gear

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 60-year-old father of six who lives with his wife and two daughters in Los Chiles, located in the northern region of Costa Rica.

Like many member of the Los Chiles community, William is a farmer. He dedicates his time to the planting and harvest of various subsistence crops including, tubers and chili peppers. William is always busy, organizing his day so that in the morning he wakes up early, eats breakfast and then feeds his chickens and pigs. He then switches gears, taking on the work in the fields.

This loan will be used to finance the production of Habanero chili peppers. Specifically, William will use this money to purchase seeds, fertilizer, tools, pesticides, and other materials/ingredients necessary to the production of chili peppers. All labour and transportation tasks will be carried out by William and his family.

William dedicates part of his time as a hired hand on a nearby farm. He worries about the coming harvesting season and hopes that he will be successful this year. William’s goals are to maintain stability in his family, achieve higher production rates, improve his economic situation, and offer a better standard of living to his family.

A major difficulty and limitation for William has been his lack of working capital. He hopes to use this loan effectively to improve life on his farm for everyone.

Piper and Capiscum Processors Compañía Agrícola Industrial, or PROPICA, is an international buyer and seller of chili pepper and ground pepper products. In cooperation with Fundación Mujer, PROPICA has guaranteed to purchase the agricultural products (the peppers) that are to be produced with the help of this loan. PROPICA acts as a guaranteed client for small agricultural producers in the area of Los Chiles, thus ensuring that their products will reach market.

The collaboration of Fundación Mujer and PROPICA represents a unique opportunity to William, his family and his community. By offering a source of start-up capital, and a guaranteed client to purchase what is produced, this is a chance to improve family and community standards of living. Above all, William wants to take advantage of the current opportunity that has been presented; he wants to profit from this collaboration and see improvements in his neighborhood.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and nutrients necessary for the production of chili peppers

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna C. is from the village of Lunao, Gingoog City. She is 47 years old. Luna is married and has 9 adult-aged children. To make a living, Luna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks & other delicacies in the local community. Luna has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Luna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. Luna is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Luna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Abadahemana Group

texts.fr:
Ada N. est une commerçante âgée de 48 ans qui habite la Commune  de Rugombo à l’Ouest du Burundi. Elle fait le commerce de haricots  au Marché de Rugombo il ya de cela 7 ans. Elle n’a  pas pu fréquenter l’école parce qu’elle était orpheline. Son époux, Samuel Nduwimana est un cultivateur. Elle arrive au 5e cycle dans le crédit communautaire avec Turame. 

Elle a 5 enfants : 2 filles et 3 garçons âgés de 26 ans, 24 ans, 17ans, 15 ans et 7ans. Trois d’entre eux étudient. 
  
Elle demande le crédit Kiva pour  augmenter la quantité de haricots à commercialiser dans l’espoir de réaliser un grand bénéfice. Elle préfère le crédit Turame-Kiva du fait qu’il présente des facilités liées au remboursement progressif avec un taux d’intérêt bas par rapport aux autres institutions financières mais aussi la garantie matérielle est très facile.

 Elle est une des membres du groupe  communautaire « ABADAHEMANA ».
texts.en:
Ada N., a member of the Abadahemana community loan group, is a 48-year-old merchant living in the Rugombo Commune in western Burundi. She has run a business selling beans at the Rugombo Market for 7 years. She was unable to attend school because she was orphaned. Her husband, Samuel Nduwimana, is a farmer. She has reached her fifth group loan cycle with Turame. She has five children: two girls and three boys, aged 26, 24, 17, 15, and 7. Three of them are students. She is seeking a loan through Kiva to increase the amount of beans she can sell, with the hope of realizing a larger profit. She prefers the Turame-Kiva loan system because it provides an easy and progressive repayment schedule with lower interest rates, as compared to other microfinance institutions, and also because the material guarantee is very easy.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the stock of beans for sale, with the hope realizing a larger profit

loans.name: Blanca Azucena

texts.es:
Blanca de 52 años, vive en una zona urbana llamada “Orquídeas” fue llamada así porque encontraron una gran cantidad de flores orquídeas en su descubrimiento. Ella tiene una papelería, desde hace años para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares. 

Ella inicio su negocio vendiendo confites pero como necesitaba mas dinero para tener su negocio, comenzó a ser grupos de prestamos en la Fundación D-miro, con las ganancias que obtuvo readecuo su casa para ubicar en la parte delantera su papelería. Ahora trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Vende cuadernos, plumas, papeles. 

Para tener mejor surtido su negocio quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería, cuadernos y vitrinas. En el futuro quiere arreglar su negocio y asi darles una mejor atencion a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Blanca, 52 years old, lives in an urban area named "Orquídeas” because there were many orchids there at the time it was first discovered. For years now she has had a paper shop in order to help with family expenses. She started her business selling confections. When she needed more money to have her business she started requesting group loans with the D-miro Foundation. With the income she made improvements to the front of her house to accommodate the paper shop. She now works from 7am to 10pm every day. She sells notebooks, pens and paper. With the money from the loan she wants to purchase paper goods, notebooks and displays to diversify her inventory. In the future she wants to renovate her shop to better serve her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Displays, notebooks

loans.name: Teresiah

texts.en:
Teresiah F. M. is twenty one years old, single and does not have any children. Her business is located at Jua Kali market in Nairobi. She makes and sells cookers, sauce pans, metal boxes etc to the local people from within the industrial area and also customers coming from afar like Machakos, Isiolo and Narok. 

She has been doing this business for the last thirteen months and she says that this business is profitable. The major challenge that Teresiah has is lack of raw materials to make her end products and the fact that customers are not loyal since there are other people in the area doing the same business as hers. However, she works very hard from early morning to late evening to keep her business doing well. She is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more scrap metal for making more items to sell and grow her business. She hopes to grow her business, become a millionaire and help other people. She describes herself as active, God fearing and goal-oriented.

loans.use: Scrap metal

loans.name: Christhy

texts.en:
Christhy B. is from the village of Centro 2, San Guillermo,Isabela. She is 34 years old. Christhy is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Christhy owns & operates a motorcycle transport business in the community. Christhy has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month in this activities.

In 2009, Christhy joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Christhy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. Christhy is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in her business. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Christhy from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business.

loans.name: Susanne

texts.en: Susanna S. sells women’s clothing.  She lives in a big family with nine members where everybody pays his token to improve the family’s financial status. Susanna is a kind and caring grandmother, wishing to invest in her grandchildren’s education and future professional careers. A dedicated mother, grandmother and entrepreneur,  Susanna requires to purchase new clothing stock, for which she needs additional financial resources.

loans.use: purchasing new clothing stock

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama M. is married and has received a junior high education. Ama sells fish at Elmina. Her husband is a security man. Demand for her fish is increasing and she is requesting to use the loan to expand her business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Zahra

texts.ar:
زهرة في عمر 45 سنة متزوجة ولها ولد واحد تعيل زوجها واسرتها فهي تحب عائلتها وتضعها في  الأولويات في حياتها فهي تريد تعليم ابنها بأحسن
صورة وان ترقى به في الحياة المعيشية  تساعد زوجها في تخطي الحياة الصعبة فهو لا يعمل , عائلتها تدعمها كثيرا لتطوير نفسها تعمل في مجال خياطة الالبسة والبرادي منذ 
اكثر من 10 سنوات تجد صعوبة مادية في تحسين وضع عملها ولهذا هي تريد قرض من المجموعة بهدف  شراء اقمشة لتفصيلها وبيعها كبرادي زبائنها من معارفها ومحيطها
ليس لديها صعوبات كبيرة لتحسين وضعها
texts.en: Zahra is 45 years old. She is married with one child. Zahra financially supports her husband and family. She loves her family and makes them her first priority.  Zahra wants to provide the best education possible for her son, and improve her family’s standard of living. She helps her husband through difficult times as he is currently unemployed. Zahra has the support of her family. She has been working as a seamstress for more than 10 years. She has financial burdens and would like to obtain a loan from Al Majmoua to purchase textiles and sell them as curtains. Her clients are mainly her family, friends, and acquaintances. She only faces few obstacles in enhancing her income.

loans.use: To purchase textiles to sew into curtains

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne A. is 35 years old. She is from the Kondele area and is married to Samuel. They have three children, Teddy, 12 years; Hermsh, seven years; and Nicole, three years old.

Everlyne sells second-hand clothes and has been doing so for 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from Kadet Ltd after being introduced to Kadet by a friend who has benefited from the loans. Everlyne intends to use the money to buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock. The profits made from her business will be used to cater to the family’s needs and also pay school fees for her children.

Her desire is to see her business grow from retail to wholesale.

loans.use: Buy more bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Noche

texts.en:
Noche A. is from the village of Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. He is 37 years old. Noche is single. To make a living, Noche owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling bananas & coconut in the local community. Noche has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Noche joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Noche has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Noche is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Noche from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional bananas & coconuts to sell

loans.name: Rocio Esperanza

texts.es:
La Señora Roció C. es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Triunfadoras, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, su gente es muy cordial y amable quienes mantienen su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es conocido por la belleza arquitectónica.

Nuestra socia tiene 39 años, es separada hace 3 años y tiene 3 hijos de 18, 11 y 7 años de edad, su primer hijo  trabaja y estudia en la universidad, sus dos últimos hijos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad, con su trabajo ha logrado construir su casa propia.

La Señora. Roció labora en una panadería que es de su propiedad, aprendió este oficio trabajando en el y también ha seguido algunos cursos, lleva  trabajando en esta actividad hace 18 años, trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche  de domingo a domingo.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 3 años y con el dinero de su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de harina, manteca etc., y más materia prima. Su meta es engrandecer mucho más su panadería.
texts.en:
Rocio C. is a member of the community bank Mujeres Triunfadoras ("Successful Women"). She lives in Cuenca, a city of cold weather and very friendly and kind people who keep their culture and traditions. Cuenca's old town is renowned for its architectural beauty.

Rocio is 39 years old and she separated from her partner 3 years ago. She has three children aged 18, 11 and 7 years old. Her eldest son works and goes to university. The two younger ones go to school in the city. Thanks to her hard work she has managed to build her own house.

Rocio works in a bakery she owns herself. She learned the craft by working and she has also taken some courses. She has been in this line of business for 18 years. She works 8am to 10pm from Sunday to Sunday. 

She has been a community bank member for three years. She is going to invest the loan money in the purchase of flour, butter and other ingredients. Her goal is to expand the bakery.

loans.use: Buy flour, butter, eggs, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en:
Safia is 47 years old and has given birth to three sons and a daughter. They live in a small city called KasU., which is located in Punjab, Pakistan, and is famous for its leather industry. Her elder son has a transport business and her daughter is a school teacher. Her other children are getting their education by going to school. She is married to M. Y. who operates a grocery store in the market. He sells daily use items like oil, sugar, spices, rice, etc. He is known among his clients for his fair dealing and the quality of his products.

Safia also supports her family selling thread. She supplies thread at reasonable rates to different thread sellers at the markets. She is also a very good mother and wife. She performs her household responsibilities very well. 

Safia has applied for a loan from Kiva's partner, Asasah, to help her husband expand his grocery store business. With this loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store to sell. Safia is hopeful that through the loan investment her husband will be able to increase his income and make his business more profitable. She is a new loan user of Asasah and this is her first loan application.  

In the photo, the lady with a book (an Asasah passbook) is Safia.

loans.use: To buy groceries for a grocery store business

loans.name: Mrs. Ut Mom Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. U. M. is the president of a village bank located in Veay Chhneah village, Takeo province. She has been selected by the fourteen members of the village bank to be their leader for this group loan, which will improve the living conditions of all the families involved.
 
Mrs. U. M. is a mother of five children. Two are employed in garment factories, one helps her to do housework, and the other two are attending the local public school.  She is a hammock maker who is able to earn some money to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Sren Oeung, is a motorbike taxi driver. She wants to breed a cow, bU. she does not have enough savings, so she is asking for a loan to help her buy this cow, which she will use to start a new business.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Tomás

texts.es:
Tomás es un padre de familia de 34 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en el caserío CP-10 del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y porcino, el cría su ganado en un terreno propio donde Tomas a adecuado los corrales para su ganado es por ello que cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 4 años que gracias a los ingresos que percibe le permite mantener a su familia.

El desea adquirir alimento balanceado para su ganado ya que la demanda está aumentando. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Tomás es un padre bastante entregado a su familia y que siempre vela por su bienestar y desarrollo. Las personas que le conocen le tienen mucha estima y cariño.
texts.en:
Tomas is a 34 year-old father who lives with his wife and their 3 children in the rural CP-10 settlement in the Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area located in the Piura region, M. than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Tomas raises and sells sheep and pigs.  He raises his livestock on his own land, where he has set up corrals for his animals.  When they have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale to the merchants who often visit the area where he lives.
