He has been raising livestock for 4 years, and he is able to support his family with the income that he earns from this business.

He wants to buy some balanced feed for his livestock, since the demand for them is increasing.  To do this he is requesting a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

Tomas is a person who is very dedicated to his family and is always watching out for their welfare and development.  The people who know him are very fond of him and hold him in high esteem.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for his livestock

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen Q. is from the village of Santo Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 44 years old. Helen is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living she owns and operates a business venture in the food sector, making and selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $38 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Helen joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. 

Helen is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her 3rd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

location.town: Liloy-Sto. Niño, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is a 41-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three business ventures:  buying and selling RTW (clothing), manicure service and food vending. She lives in Toledo, Cebu. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2008 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,900. Marites is borrowing PHP 20,000 so that she could buy more clothing stocks to sell, buy supplies for her manicure service, and ingredients for her food vendng business. This will be her seventh loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 20,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Marites aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to buy more clothing stocks to sell, buy supplies for her manicure service, and ingredients for her food vendng business

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “LOS LIDERES”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Manuel; él tiene 32 años de edad, soltero; el socio es ingeniero de sistemas y trabaja para una empresa estatal de lunes a viernes por las mañanas, el socio se siente feliz en su trabajo ya que le brinda satisfacciones tanto económicas como personales el socio es una persona bien alegre y responsable con las ganas de seguir luchando cada día para que tenga un mejor futuro.

El socio solicita el préstamo para sus gastos personales como la compra de ropa,zapatos entre otros y tambien para apoyar economicamente en el negocio de su mama que tiene una lavanderia. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Manuel is a member of "Los Líderes" (The Leaders) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in Cusco province and department.

Manuel is 32 years old and single.  He is a systems engineer and works for a state-run company, Monday to Friday mornings.  Manuel feels happy in his work as it brings him both financial and personal satisfaction.  He is a very cheerful and responsible person who has a desire to continue working hard every day so that he can enjoy a better future.

Manuel is requesting this loan for his personal use to purchase clothes and shoes, among others, as well as to be able to economically support his mother who has a clothes-washing business.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase clothes

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora is currently in a business of selling tea. She is 37 years old, married with 4 children, and all of them go to school. Flora borrowed a loan to stock more tea to sell. She hopes to open up a shop in the future with extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more tea to sell

loans.name: Um

texts.en:
Um S. is a divorced mother caring for three children, one of whom attends the local school and is dependent on her income, while the other two work in a garment factory. A self-sacrificing and determined woman who tries to earn money to support her children, she sells rice and vegetables to passers-by in her community.

Um S. will use the loan to buy more rice to store for future sale. This will allow her to gain more income and more valued customers, thereby enabling her to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to buy rice to store for future sale.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad, vive con sus dos hijas y pareja en su casa propia la cual cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz, ubicado en la zona urbana del Valle Sagrado de los Incas en la ciudad de Calca a 45 minutos de la ciudad del Cusco. Estas zonas se caracterizan por su alta actividad, agrícola, ganadera y turística que desarrollan sus pobladores.

Luzmila es una mujer trabajadora y estudiosa, ella está estudiando el curso de corte y confección en la ciudad de Urubamba y le falta poco para terminar el curso. Ella va estudiar desde las 8 de la mañana hasta la una de la tarde de lunes a viernes.  Ella abrió un pequeño negocio de venta de anticuchos de forma ambulatoria y con este pequeño negocio que ha colocado Luzmila trata en lo posible de brindar un mejor nivel de vida para su familia mediante los ingresos de sus ventas diarias. 

Mediante una visita a la Asociación Arariwa Luzmila trata de adquirir un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles para abastecer su puesto de venta de más insumos como por ejemplo Carne y papas y así pueda satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, y de paso incrementa sus ingresos.

Luzmila es conocida por sus vecinos, por ser una mujer alegre, dispuesta a ayudar a otros y una madre responsable con el objetivo de que como familia salgan adelante apunta de esfuerzo y trabajo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a 32 year-old mother who lives with her two daughters and partner in her own home which has basic services of water and electricity.  Her home is located in an urban area of The Sacred Valley of the Incas, in the city of Calca, 45 minutes from the city of Cusco.  These areas are noted for their high level of commercial activity and for the farming, livestock raising and tourism that their residents work in.

Luzmila is a hard-working and studious woman.  She is taking a course in dressmaking in the city of Urubamba and she doesn't have long left before she will have finished the course.  She studies from 8.00am to 1.00pm, Monday to Friday.  She opened a small business selling kebabs as an itinerant street vendor and, through her small business, Luzmila has tried as much as possible to provide her family with a better quality of life through the income from her daily sales.

Luzmila visited Asociación Arariwa to acquire a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles so that she could stock her business with more supplies such as meat and potatoes and thereby meet the needs of her customers and, at the same time, increase her income.

Luzmila is well known by her neighbors as being a cheerful woman who is ready to help others and also a responsible mother whose goal is to get her family ahead in life through her efforts and work.

loans.use: to stock her business with more supplies such as meat and potatoes

loans.name: Melida

texts.es:
Melida, se dedica a la venta de hot dog, vive con su esposo y un hijo de 16 años, ella aprendió a preparar la venta junto a su esposo desde hace 11 años, recorren varias calles ofreciendo la venta desde las 8:00am a 5:30 pm.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de materiales, repollo, aderezos, salchichas, jamón, servilletas y polipel, con esta compra espera producir más.
Su objetivo es crecer en las ventas, pagar las deudas y velar por su familia.
texts.en:
Melida lives with her husband and 16-year-old son and works selling hot dogs.  She learned to prepare them to sell with her husband eleven years ago and they travel to various streets selling from 8am to 5:30pm.

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of materials like cabbage, seasonings, hot dogs, ham, napkins and bags.  She hopes to produce more with this purchase.

Her goal is to grow in sales, pay off her debts and watch over her family.

loans.use: to buy cabbage, seasonings, hot dogs, ham, napkins and bags.

loans.name: Nonvigbe 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe NONVIGBE 1 est formé de quatre personnes qui résident toutes dans la même zone géographique au Bénin. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Noelie, est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. Noelie est née le 21 Août 1974 dans une ville du Bénin et est mariée à un certain Julien. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés dont deux sont à leur charge. Noelie vit ensemble avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Noelie n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a près de quatre ans que Noelie mène comme activité la vente de céréales (maïs, haricot, etc.), ainsi que de la farine de manioc dans son quartier. Parallèlement à cette activité, Noelie vend de l’huile végétale et de la tomate dans le même quartier. Noelie achète ses produits dans l’un des marchés du Bénin. C’est la troisième fois que Noelie et son groupe NONVIGBE  1 sollicite de crédit auprès de ALIDé. Ce crédit leur servira à renforcer leur activité afin de mieux répondre à la demande de leur clientèle.
texts.en:
NONVIGBE 1 is a group composed of four persons who all reside in the same geographical area of Benin. Noelie is this group’s representative. She is the one with her hand raised in the photo. She was born on August 21, 1974 in a city in Benin. She is married to man named Julien. The couple has four children, who are all in school. Two of the children are their dependents. Noelie lives together with her family. The couple jointly ensures that the various family expenses are covered. 

For nearly four years, Noelie has been running a business selling grains (corn, beans, etc.), as well as cassava flour, in her district. Concurrent to this business, she sells vegetable oil and tomatoes in the same district. She purchases these goods in one of the markets of Benin. This is the third time that Noelie and her group NONVIGBE 1 have requested a loan from ALIDé. This loan will serve to bolster their businesses in order to respond better to the demands of their customers.

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, cassava flour, vegetable oil, and tomatoes

loans.name: Paulo Cesar

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE HUANCA”; el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Calca en la Provincia de Urubamba y Departamento de Cusco.

El socio tiene 33 años de edad, el socio es conviviente, El socio tiene 1 hijo de 2 años y 6 meses; El socio es docente de profesión y es artista, el socio actualmente se dedica a la artesanía, el socio realiza trabajos y pinturas andinas, el socio tiene en Pisac una galería de arte y el socio desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de materiales así como pinceles, pinturas, marcos y todo lo referente al trabajo en pintura. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para realizar pinturas de arte y exhibirlas en la galería.

La socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Señor de Huanca” communal bank located in Calca District in Urubamba Province and Cusco Department.

He is 33 years old and has a live-in partner.  He has a son who is two-and-a-half.  He is a Teacher by profession and also an Artist.  He currently works as an artisan.  He paints Andean scenes.  He has an art gallery in Pisac and wants to use the loan to buy art supplies like brushes, paints, frames and everything related to painting.  He is asking for the loan to buy supplies to make paintings to exhibit in the gallery.

He is grateful for the support that will be granted and commits to make his installment payments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy art supplies.

loans.name: Lanie Mae

texts.en:
Lanie Mae is 25 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married, with 2 children.  Lanie Mae has a shop that sells canned goods, biscuits & snacks. She has had this business for 2 years. She requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks.

Lanie Mae has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Lanie Mae hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages & snacks

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Both Soam and her husband work as farmers, but Soam doesn’t do the same work as her husband. Soam raises pigs at home but her husband works as a farmer. Both of them can earn $6 per day. They always think about their three children. For developing a family living in modern times, Soam would like to borrow $1,000 with the purpose of purchasing rice to sell.

loans.use: to purchase rice to sell.

loans.name: Maritha

texts.en: Maritha has practiced farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 11 years.  She is 41 years old, married to James, and they have four school-going children. She was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our field officers and this will be her third loan. She paid all her previous loans well and in good time. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer. In the future, Maritha hopes to become a leading farmer in Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mutindi

texts.en: Mutindi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past ten years, Mutindi has operated a fruit-selling business, selling from the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge in the high cost of transportation in her business. Mutindi dreams of expanding her business to meet her customer’s needs. With the Kshs 15,000 she wants to purchase 50 bags of passion fruits and oranges. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase 50 bags of passion fruit and oranges.

loans.name: Vladimer

texts.en:
Vladimer is from the village Abastumani, South Georgia. Abastumani is famous throughout the country as a mountain resort and it is full of tourists during most of the year. 

Vladimer is 44 years old. He lives with his family – his wife, Nina, their 19-year-old son, their 18-year-old daughter and his mother, who is retired.

Vladimer works in the local bathhouse as a security person. His wife works in the same bathhouse as a cleaning lady. Their total monthly salary is 240 GEL. 

Along with their jobs, they get additional income from renting a family-owned house. They rent it to the tourists. 

Vladimer requested the credit for renovation of this house. After the renovation, he will be able to rent it for a higher price. Vladimer will use the increased income for financing the children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase materials to renovate his rental house.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a hardworking businessman aged 33. He is married and blessed with two children who are still in school. For the last four years, he has been operating a motorbike transport business to earn a living. He also does dairy farming to supplement his income. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. He is requesting a loan of 80,000 Kenya shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 28 years old and a married woman with three children, one of whom is in school. She is married to a man who is a teacher. She has a business selling breads in Dar es Salam branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years. 

Rose requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more bread to sell

loans.name: Laure Nougnimè

texts.fr: Agée de 36 ans Laure Nougnimè est marié à un cuisinier du nom de Célestin. Le couple à deux enfants,tous scolarisés et n'étant plus à leur charge.Laure Nougnimè n'a jamais été à l’école Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille Laure Nougnimè prépare de la nourriture qu'elle vend dans une cafétéria.Laure Nougnimè exerce cette activité depuis 13 ans environ.Grâce au revenu que lui génère cette activité Laure Nougnimè contribue aux différentes dépenses de sa famille.Laure Nougnimè s’approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour améliorer son niveau de vie et son revenu, Laure Nougnimè Rosine sollicite pour une troisième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les deux premiers prêts reçus par Laure Nougnimè ont été bien remboursés.Laure Nougnimè ambitionne dans l'avenir équiper d'avantage sa cafétéria.
texts.en:
36-year-old Laure Nougnimè is married to a cook called Célestin.  The couple have two children who are both in school and no longer dependent on them.  Laure Nougnimè never went to school.  In order to cover her own needs, as well as those of her family, she prepares food which she sells in a café.  She has been in this business for approximately 13 years.  Thanks to the income that she makes in this business, she contributes towards her family's expenses.  She stocks up in one of the markets in Benin.

In order to satisfy her customers and improve her standard of living and income, Laure Nougnimè is requesting a third loan from ALIDé.  Her first two loans were repaid on time.  In the future, she plans to further equip her café.

loans.use: to buy boxes of canned food, sauce seasonings and Dinor-brand oil

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: El Sr. Luis es soltero, trabajador y perseverante en su lucha diaria de salir adelante con trabajo y esfuerzo; vive en casa de sus padres y se dedica a prestar el servicio de taxi en su moto; por todo el cercado de Ica. El crédito otorgado lo va a invertir en el mejoramiento de su vivienda (compra de muebles y mesa), su principal desafío del Sr. Luis es el trabajo arriesgado que realiza ya que él presta el servicio hasta altas horas de la noche, su sueño del Sr. Luis es tener su propia casa y vivir independientemente de su familia. El esta muy agradecido por el crédito otorgado ya que con ello va a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Luis is single, hardworking and persevering in his daily struggle to get ahead through work and effort.  He lives in his parents’ house and works providing mototaxi services throughout Ica’s surroundings.

The granted loan will be used to make some home improvements (to buy furniture and a table).  

Luis’ main challenge is that his work is risky in that he has to provide service until quite late at night.  His dream is to have a house of his own and to live independent of his family.  He is very grateful for the granted loan because it will help him improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy furniture and a table.

loans.name: Abed Al-Kareem

texts.en:
Abed Al-Kareem is a 37-year-old man. He is married with no children. He is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. 

Abed Al-Kareem wants to make some repairs to his house such as painting and changing tiles, but the amount of money he has isn't enough, so he needs to take a loan of $1,000 from FATEN. 

When Abed Al-Kareem gets the loan, he will be able to pay for making repairs for his house and this will provide the family better and more healthful living conditions. Abed Al-Kareem is photographed in FATEN branch.

loans.use: To pay the expenses for making some repairs to his house.

loans.name: Siglo Xxi Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Siglo XXI” lo conforman 18 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran artesanía, comercio, manualidades, preparación y venta de comida rápida entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco.
María integrante del Banco comunal quien en la foto aparece en la última fila del grupo, en el tercer lugar de derecha a izquierda, usando una chaqueta color verde agua y una bufanda color lila. Ella se dedica a la producción de manualidades desde hace 7 años, entre estas se encuentran la producción de  muñecos. Ella distribuye su tiempo diario de acuerdo a las tareas hogareñas que tenga, lo que generalmente es por las mañanas, por lo que destina las tardes para la producción de sus manualidades. Comenta que disfruta de su oficio, ya que además lo practicaba su madre. 
María ofrece sus productos en diversas ferias artesanales, para posteriormente venderlas. 
Sus materiales los compra en diferentes locales de la ciudad de Temuco cada 20 días. 
Con el crédito comprará una máquina de coser que le servirá para aumentar su producción. Ya que actualmente realiza las costuras a mano.
Sus metas son aumentar la producción de sus productos de manualidades. 
Comenta que durante la temporada de navidad y vacaciones de verano aumentarán considerablemente sus ventas debido a la demanda de productos en las ferias artesanales en las cuales ella participa. 
María vive junto a su marido y sus tres hijos de 19, 18 y 8 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel personal son que sus hijos ingresen a la universidad a estudiar una carrera profesional. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además disfruta de las reuniones y del grupo del Banco comunal, ya que existe dinamismo, disposición y respeto.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Siglo XXI” (Century XXI).  It is made up of 18 entrepreneurs who make their livings in different areas including craft work, trade, handicrafts and preparing and selling fast food, among other businesses.  All of them live in the city of Temuco.
María is a member of the communal bank.  In the photo, she is in the back row, third from the right.  She is wearing a light-green jacket and a lilac scarf.  She has made her living in handicrafts for the last 7 years.  Among the items she crafts are dolls.  She spends time each day taking care of the housework, which is generally in the mornings.  And then she sets her afternoons aside to make her handicrafts.  She says that she enjoys her trade and that her mother did the same. 
María offers her products for sale in the various artisan fairs. 
She purchases her materials every 3 weeks in different stores around the city of Temuco. 
With the loan, she will purchase a sewing machine, which will help her to increase her production.  Currently, she does all the sewing by hand.
Her goal is to increase production of her handicrafts. 
María says that during the Christmas season and summer vacation, her sales will increase considerably due to the demand for products in the artisan fairs that she participates in. 
María lives together with her husband and three children, who are 19, 18 and 8 years old.  Her dream, on a personal level, is that her children be able to go to university and study for a professional career.
She is very happy with and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza has offered her to invest in her business.  In addition, she enjoys the meetings and the members of her communal bank, where there is dynamism, aptitude and respect.
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía Region.  The city is located 670 km. south of Santiago (the capital of Chile).  In the surrounding areas are a series of lakeside beaches (Pucón, Villarrica) and striking native flora and fauna concentrated in nearby native parks.  It is also worth pointing out that this region is home to 50% of the Mapuche population, the native people of our country.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine, which will help her to increase production.  Currently, she does all her sewing by hand.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has three children.

Monina has a pigpen where she raises and matures pigs for sale. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy animal feed for the pigs.

Monina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Monina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for her pigs.

loans.name: Nelly Del Carmen

texts.es: Nelly con su credikiva anterior, compró mercancía en mayor cantidad como ropa, adornos y hasta  planes de recarga para ampliar su oferta de servicios de telecomunicaciones. En la actualidad está planeando invertirle a su negocio en la época navideña y de fin de año, pues conoce que en esta época usualmente es muy efectiva la inversión. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará ropa infantil y femenina, adornos navideños y nuevos planes de minutos, para que sus clientes tengan la oportunidad de acercarse en masa a saludar a sus familiares y desearle el  “feliz y próspero año 2012” a través de los servicios de telecomunicaciones que Nelly ofrece. Ella pide a los financiadores de Kiva  "que sigan ayudando para seguir avanzando."
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Nelly purchased a greater quantity of merchandise such as clothing, ornaments, and even phone minute reloading plans to expand her telecommunications services offerings. Currently, she is planning to invest it in her business at Christmastime and New Year's, since she knows that at this time investment is usually very effective. This is why she is taking out a new Kiva loan, with which she will purchase children's and women's clothing, Christmas ornaments, and new minutes plans, so that her customers will have the opportunity to be closer to their families and will be able to wish them a "happy and prosperous 2012" through the telecommunications services Nelly offers. She asks that Kiva lenders "continue helping to continue advancing".

loans.use: to purchase children's clothes, Christmas ornaments, and new phone minutes plans.

loans.name: Tony

texts.en: Tony is a 26-year-old, hardworking man living in Hioma, Uganda. He has been running a poultry farm for 2 years now. He started the project by using his personal savings and he faces a challenge of diseases that attack the chicks. His personal goal is to build a permanent house and go back to school. He also wishes to diversify his business in the future and increase the number of birds to 200. Tony needs the loan to buy more chicks for poultry farming.

loans.use: to buy chicks for poultry farming

loans.name: Eugenia Mercedes

texts.es:
Eugenia de 22 años, es una mujer trabajadora ya que es vendedora ambulante de ropa y bisutería. Comenzó su trabajo vendiendo por revista y catálogos ahora tiene un grupo de clientes estables ya que vende la ropa en el mercado de Milagro. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde muy temprano vendiendo la ropa. Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su familia por eso quiere continuar trabajando vendiendo.  El préstamo lo quiere comprar ropa y así poder tener más ingresos para ayudar con los pagos de la casa ya que es madre soltera.
texts.en:
Eugenia is 22 years old. She is a hardworking woman who is a street vendor. She sells clothing and jewelry. She started her job selling via catalogues and now she has a group of regular customers, since she sells clothes in the Milagro market.  

At present, she starts work very early selling the clothes. She has a lot of dreams with her family and that's why she wants to keep selling. She wants the loan to help with house payments, since she is a single mother.

loans.use: to buy clothes

loans.name: Cheruiyot

texts.en:
Cheruiyot is 30 and has been in dairy farming for eight years, with his milk production sold to the local market in his home area of Litein, South Rift Kenya. He is married and runs a motorcycle transport and retail shop business besides farming. (He is captured here on one of his motorcycles for transport business although he is requsting a dairy loan.) 

Cheruiyot has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says the dairy income will help him improve his family income and living standards. He has high hopes that his business will continue to grow in the future, so that he will be able to make farming his core business. 

He laments the fluctuation in market prices.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Merry Grace

texts.en: Merry Grace, a 26-year-old married mother of two, lives in the Philippines where she has operated a shop that sells bananas and coconuts for five years. A member of HSPFI since 2009, she is requesting a loan for PHP8,000 to buy bananas and coconuts to sell. In the future, Merry Grace hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas and coconuts to sell.

loans.name: Sirojidin

texts.ru: На фотке снята Сирочидин. Ему 32 года. Он женат и отец троих детишек. У него одна дочка и два сына.  Сирочидин трудолюбивый житель района Яван.  Он занимается животноводством более 8 лет. Ирочидин имеет большой коровник. Он занимается один и хорошо справляется. Сирочидин покупает скота и откармливает их в течение определенного времени, потом перепродает их на скотном рынке. Сейчас он хочет приобрести несколько молодых телят. Для купли скота ему требуется определенная сумма денег. По этой причине Сирочидин просит Вас дать ему кредит.

loans.use: Для купли несколько молодых телят.

loans.name: Cesar

texts.en:
Cesar P., who was born in Chimborazo, a region in Ecuador known for its famous extinct volcano. Mr. P. is married with one son, he is a homeowner, and his forte is preparing a delicious South American soup called encebollado. His restaurant is located on one of Guayaqil’s major avenues and has been serving up Don P.’s famous recipe soup for 8 years. Before starting his own business, Cesar worked at a restaurant for 12 years. When he thought he was ready to open his own business, he used what little savings he had and rented a small storefront along a well-positioned thoroughfare in downtown Guayquil. He and his wife work hard every day from 6:00 am until 1:00 pm, and they are requesting $1035.00 to be able to buy key ingredients in bulk. For instance: oil, dressing, cola, etc… He also would like to buy some uniform utensils and dishes to serve up encebollado.

 

For more information about the history and culture of Riobamba, the largest city in the province of Chimborazo, read here.

loans.use: Ingredients for encebollado and dishes

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en:
Nazila has temporarily settled with her family in a hostel in Sumgait city. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Agdam. She is 47 years olad and has three children. She borrowed a loan of $500 from Normicro to purchase a sewing-machine. She has been working as a seamstress out of her own home for the past 12 years. After buying the sewing machine she thought it was the time to start her own business, but she lacked the start-up capital. Her second loan of $800 was spent on the purchase of another machine for the production of genuine leather jackets and genuine leather clothes for women. She has a lot of clients and has found that working at home is no longer suitable. 
Nazila needs a loan of $1500 to open her own tailor shop.

loans.use: To open her own tailor shop

loans.name: Maku

texts.en: Nkurankan, Ghana is a large market centre for the people of the Yilo Krobo District of Ghana. Madame Maku is a resident of this town and sells maize in olonka containers, and bags, at the market. She is a client of Kraban Support Foundation, and is seeking a Kiva loan of $900.00 to help her improve her business.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Munavvar

texts.ru:
Munavvar A. has been in business for 2 years and an active member of MicroInvest for the past year. She delivers her goods by herself. She is married and has 2 children. Her children are going to school. She needs $300 for purchasing seasonal merchandise. She is counting on receiving maximum profit from selling her merchandise and using the proceeds for her family’s needs.

Translated from Russian by Keith & Jamilya Leitich, Kiva Volunteers.

Ашурова Мунаввар, является активным клиентом МЗФ «Микроинвест» более 1 лет. В сфере предпринимательской деятельностью занимается не менее 2 лет. Товары привозит сама. Она замужем и имеет 2 детей. Ее дети учатся в школе. Ей необходимо 300$, для закупки сезонного товара. Она рассчитывает получить максимальную прибыль от продажи своих товаров, потратить их на нужды семьи.

loans.use:
To increase sales turnover
для увеличения товарооборота

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Mrs. Graciela R. is 45 years old and is has been married to Mr. Hugo Romero for 25 years. The two have 6 children, all students. Four of them attend primary school, one attends secondary school and their oldest daughter is a student at a university. This brings a lot joy to Graciela and hopes for a great future for her children. Graciela began selling door-to-door and, with a bit of capital, opened a small store from where she sold candy and refreshments. After many years of hard work and saving, she was able to open a store and today sells a variety of basic products such as rice, vermicelli, yerba mate tea, sugar, coffee, milk, breads, etc. As the business grew, so too did her need to increase the size of her store. She would like to invest in adding an extension to the store. She requests a loan of $200 to increase the size of her store. This will allow her to continue to grow and increase her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

La Sra. Graciela R. tiene 45 años de edad, está casada hace 25 años con el señor Hugo Romero; la pareja tiene 6 hijos, todos sus hijos estudian, cuatro de ellos están en etapa primaria, uno en etapa secundaria y su hija mayor ya va a la universidad, lo cual representa una gran felicidad para Graciela pues anhela un buen futuro para sus hijos. Graciela empezó como vendedora ambulante, con un poco de capital; luego monto un pequeño kiosco donde solo vendía golosinas y refrescos. Tras varios años de trabajo y gracias a su buenos ahorros pudo montar una despensa, donde hoy día vende diferentes productos básicos necesarios tales como arroz, fideos, yerba mate, azúcar, café, leche, panificados, etc. Al igual que el negocio fue creciendo, el local fue quedando pequeño, por lo que hoy día se ve obligada a invertir en la ampliación de la infraestructura de su local. Solicita un crédito de $ 200 para poder ampliar su negocio, esto le ayudará a seguir creciendo y aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use:
Increase the size of her store

ampliación de la infraestructura de su local

loans.name: Mayra Cinthia

texts.es:
With her desire to improve herself in the face of scarcity, Mayra decided to open a small shop two years ago in her parents' house, hoping to pay her university expenses. She is the oldest of four children, and because of the needs of the little ones, her parents weren't able to make her dreams a reality. Nevertheless, thanks to her diligence, drive, and her tiny store, she is making them happen. This fact fills her with satisfaction and she knows that all efforts require sacrifice; with the help that you offer her and her parents, they have been able to gain economic stability and her little siblings enjoy their well being. Her intended plans are to continue running her small shop with more items, for which she is requesting a loan of $350. Let's make it so this hard-working young lady can continue to harbor her dreams of well-being and prosperity in her heart.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

Con sus deseos de superación y ante la escasez económica, Mayra decide abrir una pequeña tienda hace dos años en casa de sus padres con el propósito de poder solventar los gastos económicos que requiere sus estudios universitarios de educación.Ella es la hermana mayor de 4 hermanos y debido a que los pequeños en casa requieren muchas cosas sus padres no han podido hacer realidad su anhelo. Sin embargo gracias a su diligencia y empeño lo está concretando valiéndose de este pequeño centro de ventas. Este hecho la llena de satisfacción y sabe que todo propósito requiere de sacrificio; con la ayuda que les brinda también a sus padres estos han podido obtener una mayor estabilidad económica y ahora sus hermanitos gozan de bienestar.Su propósito futuro es seguir implementando su pequeña bodega con más artículos para lo cual solicita un préstamo de 350 dólares.Hagamos que esta joven trabajadora siga albergando deseos de bienestar y prosperidad en su corazón.

loans.use: Purchase of highly needed items for a small general store.

loans.name: Vasil

texts.en: Vasil B. is single. He lives in the village of Ressovo, near Vratza. He has worked as a construction worker in Spain but he has lost two fingers on his right hand in an accident. After the accident he returned to his native village.  His parents helped him by giving him nine sheep to start a farming business. He now has 15 sheep but wants to buy 5 more and to supply some fodder for the winter period. He applies for a $750 loan.

loans.use: To purchase some sheep and fodder

loans.name: Prossy's Group

texts.en:
Prossy N. currently operates a charcoal selling business. She wants to open up a new business of cloth making, increase her business knowledge, and also develop her skills as a business lady. She is seeking a loan to help her to do this.

Background on BRAC and BRAC Uganda

BRAC (Building Resources Across Communities) is a development organization that began operations in Bangladesh as a small-scale relief and rehabilitation project in 1972 to help the country overcome the devastation and trauma of the liberation war and focused on resettling refugees returning from India. Today, BRAC has emerged as an independent, virtually self-financed paradigm in sustainable human development. It is one of the largest Southern development organizations employing over 100,000 people, 61% of which are women, and working with the twin objectives of poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor. Diagnosing poverty in human terms and recognizing its multifaceted nature, BRAC approaches poverty alleviation with a holistic approach.

The successes of BRAC in the international development arena have stimulated a series of discussions, both with African delegations, who have visited BRAC programs, and with donors who work in Asia and Africa. Both the African countries and the donors have encouraged BRAC to join the development campaign in Africa to achieve the Millennium Development Goals (MDGs) and more recently to join the campaign of “ending poverty”, which is an area where Africa represents the greatest global challenge.

In Uganda, BRAC registered as a Non Government Organization (NGO) in January 2006 to undertake programs in Education, Health, Water & Sanitation, Agriculture & Livestock and Microfinance. The Microfinance and Education are the pioneer programs launched in Uganda and, as of July 2007, had served 21,273 borrowers and enrolled 1,155 adolescents in its education program.

loans.use: To open a new business alongside an existing business

loans.name: Gregoria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Gregoria lives in the district of Laureles Norte in Managua. She is married and has 4 children, two are of age and independent and she is only in charge of her two younger children. Her husband is a street vendor of second-hand garments. Because of the high living costs, doña Gregoria decided to find ways to help her family get ahead and therefore started to sell food from her home, but she also sells clothing, shoes, homemade “cajeta” (caramel), and “buñuelos” (fritters).

She needs the loan to buy products such as meat and vegetables for the production of “nacatamales” and soups. Doña Gregoria is a 48 year-old lady who wishes the best for her children and she is also striving to improve their life standards.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Doña Gregoria habita en el barrio Laureles Norte de Managua. Es casada y tiene 4 hijos, dos de los cuales ya son mayores de edad y viven independientes a ella, sólo tiene a su cargo a dos hijos menores de edad. El esposo de doña Gregoria se dedica a la venta de ropa usada ambulante.Debido a los altos costos de la vida Gregoria decidió buscar la forma de poder sacar a su familia adelante es por eso que decidió empezar a vender comida en su casa, pero también se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, cajetas y buñuelos que ella misma elabora.

Necesita el crédito para comprar productos para su negocio como lo son carnes, verduras para elaborar los nacatamales y las sopas. Gregoria es una mujer de 48 años que desea lo mejor para sus hijos, y siempre está buscando la forma de darles una mejor vida.

loans.use: Purchase raw material for the production of "nacatamales" and soups.

loans.name: Nozir

texts.en:
Nozir D. is 30 years old and is married with three children.

Nozir  manufactures  fences form  metal wire. He has been in this business for 4 years. These fences are widely used in the rural areas for making the barriers for animals in enclosures, pens,  and yards. Nozir is well-known in his neighborhood and has lots of orders. The business is stable and allows Nozir to use the generated incomes for improving the living conditions of the family. 

Today he requests 2 000.00 Somoni ($600.00 US Dollars) for the term of 12 months. The loan shall be used for purchasing the input materials, like wire, required for manufacturing the fences. Since this would be his first loan, Nozir promises to be accurate in payment.

loans.use: Purchase of input materials like wires for the manufacture of  fences.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is 40 years old and is a married woman with 3 children, ages 20,16 and 12 years old. Khadija began selling clothes in 2005. Everyday, she works from 9am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $65 from her sales.

In the past, Khadija has taken out 2 successful loans from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es:
Mrs. Elizabeth is a good client. She works alongside her husband, making bread to provide for her family of six. Thanks to previous credits she has requested, she and her husband were able to build their own oven in their home, which has benefited them much. They have been working long enough to get this business ahead; now they need a new loan to be able to buy more materials for their job so that they can reach more customers and increase their income.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La Señora Elizabeth es una muy buena cliente, trabaja junto a su esposo, haciendo pan para mantener a su familia, en la que son seis integrantes. Gracias a un anterior Crédito que se le otorgó, ella y su esposo lograron construir su propio horno en su domicilio lo cual les beneficia mucho. Han estado trabajando bastante tiempo para sacar este negocio adelante, ahora necesitan un nuevo crédito para poder comprar mas material de trabajo y asi poder atender a mas clientes y de esta manera aumentar sus ingresos.

loans.use: Invest in purchasing flour for their bakery

loans.name: Balla

texts.fr:
Mr. D. has been in the business of metal-working for 22 years. He has his workshop located right on the street in a good area of the local market. He is requesting this loan to use to buy necessary raw materials, etc. He is married and the father of 7 children. This business is his main source of income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva volunteer

MR D. est menuisier métallique depuis 22 ans , il a son atelier situé pignon sur rue et occupe une bonne part du marché local .il sollicite un pret pour acheter de la matière première et des matériaux de fabrication .il est marié et père de sept enfants ;ses principaux revenus sont tirés de cette activité .

loans.use: purchasing materials for his metal-working shop

loans.name: Ven

texts.en:
Ven P. , 39, is a farmer and that make less than $1.00/day. Growing rice is a very unpredictable business that is very dependent on the weather and rains. Her husband is the key person who earns money to raise the family. He works as a taxi driver and earns $5 each day. This couple has four children, one of whom is married; two work as a garment workers.
Ven’s husband now would like a loan from Kiva to fix his car. The car is the main finance resource for the family.

loans.use: To fix a car.

loans.name: Paula

texts.en:
Paula is requesting this loan to buy more merchandise for her convenience store, Tienda Mary. She has had this business for one year. Before that, she worked selling fruit in Guatemala City. She says that her customers are asking for more products and she wants to meet that demand. Therefore, she is going to use her loan to purchase daily consumption items such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc. This is her first loan with FAPE, but she has received other loans from other banks in the past.

Paula is 53 years old, married, and has 7 children, who are between the ages of 14 and 38. Her children have studied but only through primary school. Paula herself has studied a little and says she can read and write a little. Paula has many dreams to improve her life. She wants to invest in more inventory, to advance herself, and maybe someday have more businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Megan Montgomery, Kiva Fellow.

Paula está pidiendo este préstamo para comprar más mercadería para su tienda de productos básicos que se llama Tienda Mary. Ella ha tenido este negocio por un año. Antes, trabajó en la venta de frutas en la ciudad capital de Guatemala. Ella dice que la gente pide más mercadería y ella quiere satisfacer esta demanda. Por lo tanto, va a usar su préstamo para comprar cosas de consumo diario como frijol, arroz, aceite, jabon, etc. Este es su primer préstamo con FAPE, pero ha recibido otros préstamos de otros bancos en el pasado. Paula tiene 53 años, es casada, y tiene siete hijos que tienen entre 14 y 38 años. Sus hijos han estudiado, pero solo sacaron primaria. Ella misma estudió un poco y dice que puede leer y escribir un poco. Paula tiene muchos sueños de mejorar su vida. Quiere invertir mas en productos, superarse, y quizás algún día tener más negocios.

loans.use: to purchase daily consumption items such as beans, rice, oil, soap, etc.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Mariama D. est une veuve de 56 ans avec à sa charge 03 enfants. Elle souhaite avec ce prêt renforcer son activité qui consiste à acheter de l’arachide pour la transformer en pate et la revendre. ce prêt est remboursable au bout de six mois en une seule échéance .
texts.en:
Mariama Diarissso is a 56-year-old widow with three children to take care of. She would like to use this loan to strengthen her business, which consists of buying peanuts to turn into peanut butter for onward sale. This loan is to be repaid after six months in a single installment.

Translated from French by Sarah Llewellyn, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy peanuts to turn into peanut butter that can be sold at retail
